Reviews.Title: “Lovely villa, TERRIBLE management”
Reviews.Author: ElsieLew
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in an oceanfront gold two bedroom villa. Except for the master bedroom smelling mildewy and water stains on the curtains, the villa fit our needs well. It was roomy, well appointed, nicely updated and the view was great. It would have been the perfect trip had any of the resort amenities promised on the website when we booked in September been what was really provided when we checked in in March. When we booked in September, the resort amenities included daily housekeeping, resort wide charging privileges, and access to the Ritz pool. I knew the access to the Ritz pool was no longer available (thanks, TA!) but the housekeeping and charging privileges had also been removed. While I understand that any establishment is free to change arrangements and it said as much on the website, a note in my check in folio informing me that what I was expecting is no longer available is a deceitful way of running a business, and borders on bait and switch. At no point was ANY of this information communicated to me prior to my arrival. I purposely booked directly through Kapalua Villas rather than VRBO or another booking agency so that I could have the comfort of knowing my interests were represented by the villas and that I would have resort privileges. My phone calls to management went unreturned. We had a great trip and the staff were otherwise very friendly, but I have certain expectations of courtesy when I spend this much money on a trip, and the Kapalua Villas management fell so far below those expectations that I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “DOWN Down down”
Reviews.Author: Will P
Reviews.Content: With this recent visit being our fourth, I must state that this will be our last. The decay of the product and service quality is speeding up and we simply do not these are worthy of the rates being charged. The resort itself is still good, and golf was top notch. Pineapple Grill is excellent and the local markets offer a good enough variety for home cooking, both are very expensive and indicative of Maui pricing. The villa we were given was dirty and looked worn, not what I would ever call a GOLD. The agent at the desk (Tatsuko) was polite and helpful with changing out unit. However, the second unit was not much better in that it still showed signs of neglect in cleanliness. Both had musty smells and there was visible hairs, dirt, and dust on the floors and in the bathroom. Kitchens were ok but not like the one we had in years past. Inconsistency is everywhere, you spend valuable time adjusting instead of relaxing. There are other options and we are going to try them out. Sorry Kapalua but you had many chances.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, more active weather than other Maui locales”
Reviews.Author: k9runner
Reviews.Content: The view from our unit at The Kapalua Villas was spectacular, but please be aware that the weather up that way is more acitve than Lahaina or Kaanapali: in other words you will experience more wind and rain. It can be sunny and calm farther south and you'll have light rain and strong winds in Kapalua. The unit itself was good, many recent updates, clean and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Gold Villas”
Reviews.Author: ilv2trvl2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at this property. The villa was clean, spacious, and the grounds were beautiful. I would definitely return for another visit and would recommend it to someone visiting Maui. My only negatives would be the distance from Kahalui airport (OGG) and the pools were too cold to use. Really enjoyed the spa as well....

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, Ants... Not we asked for!”
Reviews.Author: Dumeel P
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay here for 5 days from Mar 8. This all happened in unit 1712. 1. First we were informed that we would not have access to Ritz Carlton pools - which was a surprise since we were not informed when we booked vacation 2. First day, we found lot of ants in the living room. Maintenance could come only next day to clean up 3. By the time maintenance showed up next day, we found semi-dead cockroach in the middle of the living room On contacting maintenance and manager, we were informed that this is quite routine and there are all these critters within the wall - the last thing we wanted to hear. Since we didn't feel safe, we moved out this unit in 2 days. We don't think it is worth to stay here. May be other units are little better.

Reviews.Title: “NOT as described! NOT even close!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie S
Reviews.Content: Ok, the staff were pleasant enough at the desk, although I did not get a sense that they were well informed. Our issues rise from the condition of the villas, two out of the three we occupied were simply disgusting and NOT WHAT WE PAID FOR! The rooms were poorly furnished, the mattresses were saggy and worn, the showers were oddly shaped, not a bath or a shower by any sensible definition. Paint needs to be applied throughout, and the kitchens were at least ten years old. Go to Walmart, buy some modern televisions and dvd players please. I cannot comprehend what we got for upgrading to GOLD! Now, one of the villas was very nice, and none of the items were in poor shape. But even this one was lacking any outstanding features that would stand out compared to lesser priced units.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected-poor view”
Reviews.Author: Ghost07
Reviews.Content: When I booked this Gold 2 bedroom Ocean View, I assumed, based on past experience in the Kapalua area, that we would be getting a Kapalua Ridge villa. I even emailed, asking if we would be getting a Ridge villa or a Bay villa. The reply was that it hadn't been assigned yet, but would likely be a Ridge villa. When I arrived, it was a Golf Villa. That didn't please me, but I drove to it and took a look anyway. It was a ground floor 2nd tier condo, it didn't even overlook the fairway, although you could kind of see the fairway through the roofs and trees. You could tell you were in Hawaii because you could spy the ocean through those same roofs and trees. I drove back down to the rental office, and was told that, nope, there were only TWO of the two bedroom categories in the Ridge, and both were rented, I couldn't switch to anything at all, not even a better view of the golf course. The master bedroom window overlooked the little stairway alcove into the condo; even when the blinds were wide open, it was too dark in that room to see anything. The only lights were bedside lamps. The 2nd bedroom did have a lanai, so it was much brighter in there. We are accustomed to the Ridge, and have stayed in the Bay, and wouldn't have probably minded this condo either, except the view was NOT AS ADVERTISED OR EXPECTED. We also had a real ant problem in the living room/dining room area. Yes, the condo was upgraded, but we honestly go to that area just for the view. SO disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation at the Golf Villas (26T8) AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Jens G
Reviews.Content: This was our third vacation at kapalua and our second vacation in Villa 26T8 and it was again a perfect vacation! The unit is so completely updated and extremly clean, the maid comes every other day. This apartment is really worth every cent, you can feel like home away from home. The kitchen has everything you need for your vacation, the balcony has a perfect view to the ocean and it is so quiet that the only noise you hear comes from the birds. Did I already mention the shower? A walk-in shower made of granite with a glass wall! We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Ridge Villa, perfect choice, good value for Maui”
Reviews.Author: AmaraHappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September 2011. It was a surprise trip for my sweetheart. I had never been to Maui before, and it had been about 15 years since I had been to Hawaii. We usually go to Mexico, and yes, we love all inclusive resorts. I did a ton of research prior to choosing a place to stay to get the best value. Kapalua Villas lived up to my expectations! The furnishing were new and modern, no outdated tacky decor. It was great to have a well equipped kitchen for meals. We stayed in a Ridge Villa, partial ocean views on one side and golf course view on the other. I was very happy with the views. We were also able to use the facilities at the Ritz Carlton and the Kapalua Spa. We enjoyed hanging out at the pool at the Ritz and the spa was gorgeous and peaceful. We did use the resort shuttle to get to the spa and beach, very efficient and easy. September was a great time to travel to Maui. Weather was warmer, and not so crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Roach Alert !”
Reviews.Author: Nina K
Reviews.Content: We checked in here yesterday. I found a roach on the kitchen floor this morning. My husband took care of it. But I'm getting more NERVOUS now. This is ruining my vacation. I called them and asked some roach bates. We've already unpacked so switching the units seems too much as of now. I'm with my 5 year old daughter right now 'cause my parents and husband went golf. This terrible nervous feeling is growing as time passes. We have two more nights to stay here. Considering the previous review down there about roaches, I wonder whether moving to another unit is a good choice or not. I'll update it later.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful villa and facilities”
Reviews.Author: niagarariverfatman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at the Kapalua Villas on Maui. We had a gold 1 bedroom, ground floor villa. The villas are spacious and beautifully decorated and finished. A full kitchen, large living room/dinning room, large bed room and bath is the general floor plan. Based on what you get, these villas are very cost effective compared to the places of similar quality and size in Wailea. But there are a couple of drawbacks. The villas are located on the far western part of Maui, which can be very windy. And it can take a long time to drive to locations in the center or eastern part of the island. For example the day we arrived it took us more than 1.5 hours to drive the 30 miles from the airport to the villas. Now there was some road construction, but even on the weekend traffic was bad and travel times were high.

Reviews.Title: “Maui, Not like going to an all inclusive!”
Reviews.Author: SunFunMar2009
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Maui... We have been to several all inclusives. We were in Maui for a wedding so it was the main reason for picking this vacation.We had a gold villa one bedroom suite, which was beautiful at the kapalua golf villas. This is a very rainy part of maui, yes you can drive 10 min down the road and the sun is shining It rained three out of seven days which did not impress us. It is dark in Maui until 7:30 am so dont think you are going to get up to start enjoying the sunshine The hottest it ever got to was about 82 f by 1:00 pm and then it is dark by 6:00 pm. It is very expensive there. You will need a vehicle as the resort shuttle wouldn't even take us to a luau which was off the property. The shuttles do not leave the property. From the start of check-in at this resort we new we were just another person. The customer service was horrible. Here's your map, this is your room number and give us your credit card for the resort fee. This included such a great deal she said your parking, wifi and access to the spa. No services at the spa just access to the spa. We tried to ask a couple question and were told it is in your package. So after 20 min of driving around trying to follow the map that we were not to ask questions about we gave up and found a shuttle driver sleeping in his van. Could have been his break time so we asked him instead of him saying follow me i will show you he says oh where is your map. We never did get wifi to work on our ipad. The 1-800 number in the room is only for the connection they could not help with wireless. We also had tella marketers calling us in the evenings. We went to the front desk a couple days later to get some help again trying to find our beach and the other pools and chatted with Samantha a very nice lady, who advised us the manager would be calling us to apologize and fix things. He never did. I guess I thought perhaps he could've comped the resort fee at least upon check out . So I would say this place really doesn't make you feel like a guest. You will not get cleaning service everyday. The kitchen had every appliance you could think of if you are going on vacation to cook. It is very quiet if you want to come some place to relax. You will need to drive to the beach or take the shuttle. At the end of February you will apparently no longer have access to the Ritz Carlton pools so if you are a pool person this will not be the place for you. The pineapple grill gave great service may be a bit pricey. Very beautiful golf courses with a price tag. Oh and don't go to the Rc residences.. This should've been pointed out on the map as you will very kindly be asked to leave. So when in Maui we say bring MasterCard We will be sticking with all inclusives for the guest appreciation, the cost, sunshine and no need for a vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES !”
Reviews.Author: CP H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Kapalua Villas from February 4th thru February 8th, 2012. We stayed in unit 31G1. The view from the unit was beautiful and the surrounding grounds were in great condition. The unit itself was nice but not the quality I would expect for the rate we were paying. The first night I went downstairs and turned on the kitchen light and thought I saw "something" scurry across the counter, I wrote it off to fatigue from a long day of travel. The next morning I went downstairs to make coffee and found a roach behind the coffee pot. I dispatched him and took him to the desk at the check in center. They seemed polite but not shocked. They said no other units were available but they would spray the unit with a "safe" product. The next night we discovered a roach in the bedroom. I caught him along with one in the kitchen (photo). Again, not what you would expect for the money we had paid.

Reviews.Title: “Condominium resort”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The villa was very, very spacious for only two people. We could have definitely fit four people into our villa if we wanted to. We found the access to the Kapalua Spa as the best "perk" that was included in our stay

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations. Quiet area”
Reviews.Author: tburns10
Reviews.Content: Hi, I just got back from Kapuala yesterday. We stayed in the Bay Villas, unit 24 (the ground level unit). The rental agency (Sullivan properties) we booked the condo through sent us the key directly. We were not greeted nor shown to our unit. There really was nothing personal done for us. The rental agent called us the next day to see if we made it ok and/or had any questions. The unit we stayed in did offer daily maid service and consiere service from the Ritz-Carlton which is next door for $25 a day. We did not get that service. I LOVED the Bay Villas. The only draw back was since there was no AC in our unit (we didn't need it) we had all the windows open and there were 3 couples staying in the unit next door that were loud. The grounds are incredible and the condo's are very secluded. If you want to to be in the heart of the action, I do not recommend the Bay Villas. If you want to come home from a day of activity to a quit, peaceful and beautiful property, this is the place for y ou. If you'd like, I can email you some of our pics.

Reviews.Title: “I was worried but I shouldn't have been”
Reviews.Author: christie4007
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights in villa 2623. I had read some awful reviews of the gold villas and a friend had stayed in one last year and said they were dated and to have very low expectations. We had such low expectations we bought few groceries on the way to the villa so we could check out quickly if it was horrible. We have stayed at the Ritz and at the 4 seasons in Maui on past trips so we have been in premium spots and I think our "wants" for a hotel are pretty high. We were not disappointed. We stayed in ridge villa 2623 and it was clean, updated, nice furniture and very large lanai. It's an open concept loft master bedroom so I don't know if it would be terrific for couples to share a 2 BR, probably better for a family. The staff at the check in were fantastic. The only time we needed help was when the dryer wasn't working and they were at our door within 5 minutes to fix it. The spa was beautiful and I truly expected it to be only passable. I guess I need to not believe every review. Only concerns I have are that the pools in the villa areas are really small (think a backyard pool) and what will happen when you can't use the Ritz anymore? That might be the only reason we don't return. Otherwise I have nothing but praise for the villa we were in. I do think it would allay a lot of fears about the variability of villas if you could see pictures of the villa you will truly get. I know that would make me more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Villas w perfect views”
Reviews.Author: cbw51
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 b/r :Ocean View" villa. The unit was set high on the hill overlooking Kapalua Bay and the Bay Course for the Ritz Carlton. The sunsets were magnificent from this vantage point (the few times we were actually in the villa during sunset). Yes, we looked over other villas and roofs but the view of the ocean and the flowers trumped it all. Because it was my best friends villa, we had all the privileges of staying at the Ritz (for a nominal fee). It was a short walk to the General Store, Ritz Carlton and the Kapalua Bay Beach. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Ocean View Villas (aka, Mostly Other Houses View Villas)”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnoob
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2-bedroom "Ocean View" Villa and discovered that our unit (Unit 11G4) was what most resorts/hotels would classify as "Partial Ocean View" at best (and even then, "Partial Ocean View" might be a generous characterization - I would call it "Mostly Other Houses View"). When I book a vacation rental, I'd rather than play this game of creative writing. That (by far) is my biggest complaint - if you're going to misrepresent the property to me, then we're already off to a bad start. This seems to be a common theme echoed by past reviewers - there is sometimes a huge difference between villas supposedly in the same category. Here are some other positives and negatives... Positives: (1) great location - we've stayed in the Kapalua area before and we love the fact that the area is bit removed from Maui's "hotel zones"; Kapalua Bay also has, in our opinion, one of the best family beaches in Maui since the beach sits inside a protected bay (the beach is within stroller/walking distance from the villas); (2) kitchen/laundry - our unit had a full kitchen as well as washer/dryer units and since we were traveling with 2 toddlers, this was a major convenience; (3) Ritz-Carlton access and proximity - villa guests have access to the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua's pools and facilities (HOWEVER, access to the Ritz-Carlton pools ends after February 18, 2012 and access does not include the Ritz-Carlton Residences pool, a fact I was rudely informed of when I asked about it - "Sir, that is private property !!" (Like I'm an idiot for not already knowing the answer to my own question. See my spotty service comment below.) Negatives: (1) spotty service - when we checked in, we were given maps, informational booklets (advertising), resort IDs, etc., what we weren't given were the keys to our villa (a fact we failed to note until we drove all the way to our villa a couple of miles from the villa check-in offices - shame on us for not checking but we assumed the keys would be a part of the "orientation" packet) - also, after a few requests/queries to the front desk, we basically stopped asking for anything since the answer was usually "no" (or totally unhelpful); (2) our unit was a bit dilapidated - water stains above the kitchen/living room area, leftover paint cans in the closet, loose screws lying by the windows; (3) noise - our unit was the lower unit and we could hear every footstep of the guests in the unit above us.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: DeSmetguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom Gold Golf Villa, 12P6 for a week. It was very nice and relaxing. The entire place was updated including the appliances. One other really nice service about the Kapalua Villas is that even though you have checked out, you can still avail of the showers at the Kapalua Spa for free if you want to freshen up prior to the long plane ride back to the mainland as most flights leave late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: FranK O'Phile
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in the Golf Villas, and the second in Unit 27T1. This unit has been newly redecorated and has top-of-the-line appliances, furniture and bathroom features. Our check-in was quick and easy. Since this was our third stay at Kapalua, we knew our way around the property, and found it easy to drive over to our unit. A word about Kapalua: yes, you can expect a little more rain and a little more rain in northwest Maui, but the natural beauty of the place more than offsets the slightly different weather. One of the many reasons that we like Kapalua is the shuttle. You could literally arrive at the property, park your car, and never use it again for the next six or seven days. A simple phone call results in an air-conditioned minibus arriving in ten minutes or less, to take you to any restaurant, golf course or store within Kapalua. Although we didn't use the free telephone service, that is a big plus. We did use the free wi fi, which worked perfectly. In my opinion, these amenities make the $25 per day resort fee well worth it. For first time visitors, there is a Safeway store right along Highway 30 in the north end of Lahaina. This is a good place to get groceries.

Reviews.Title: “2 Bedroom Gold Golf Villa”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelJunkkie
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bed gold golf villa but when we arrived at check in were told that the villa had been sold and removed from the rental pool. They had tried to email me ahead of time but I didnt receive the email. They offered us a 3 bed standard villa or a 2 bed gold. We took the 2 bed gold. The manager and staff were apologetic and very helpful. The villa has to be approx 15 years old but has been renovated. It was clean, convenient and large enough for us to squeeze 2 adults and 5 kids. The kapalua resort was very nice. The shuttle service was great. Golf academy was great. I would stay again but would only recommend the villas if you like golf. Otherwise would probably stay in Kaanapali instead.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Villas Mold”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed2012_12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas unit 18G3 and were not impressed by anything but the view. It is very outdated, has holes in the screens and mold was found on the window shades and rubber stripping on refrigerator and freezer doors. The hardwood floors really need to be redone and the floor tiles need a really good cleaning. I also believe we were way overcharged for our condo. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved in past, will not go there again!”
Reviews.Author: bngws
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the gold level units in the past and by looking at other people's reviews it seems there is a variability to the rating of a gold level. After getting to our Bay Villa unit we found it had a 10 foot spiral staircase but the quality otherwise what what we experienced in the past with the gold units. Since we an almost 2 year old with us we felt this was not safe with the spiral staircase. (We rented a crib from them so I guess they couldn't put the two things together). They said they would get us another unit in the morning, however we did not move until 6pm the next evening, so we could not get unpacked and settled until then. The new unit could not have been considered gold level (Ridge 2212), well maybe back in 1982. It had loud and ineffective window A/C units, dirty plywood kitchen cabinets veneered with melamine, torn window shades which did little to block light, and horrible mattresses. I asked the front desk if this was a gold level unit and they said it was, but was very different from what we stayed in the past. Now it had beautiful ocean views and we could see whales breaching all day long. We could also use the Ritz pool and facilities, however you can no longer charge anything to your villa. To some this may not seem like a big deal, but it made you feel like second class citizen when there. All the restaurants on the Kapalua compound were excellent, but it was nice to have the option to cook in your villa and not get bloated on resort food. We decided to check out early and stay at the Four Seasons for the remainder of our stay to maybe plan a future trip there and to catch up on sleep because of the horrible mattresses. Upon checkout the front desk did not ask us how our stay was or why we were checking out early. I guess they learned not to ask a question they do not want to know the answer to. Kapalua is very beautiful and not a crowded as some other resort areas such as Kaanapali or Wailea, but it is windier, cloudier, rainier, and cooler than the other resort areas. The golf was good but I would recommend the Plantation course over the Bay course. It is only $20 more and has great views and much better condition. The greens are very difficult however. I guess I'll check back and see what the Outrigger reply will be.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: dogwalker27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kapalua Villas in January 2012 for 6 nights. We rented a gold villa oceanfront one bedroom. The place at a breathtaking view and was very spacious for a one bedroom condo. The condo we rented was very comfortable and clean with modern appliances. We rented through outrigger and did use the ritz beach and pool often and it was within walking distance from our unit. We rented a car so did not use the shuttle others were talking about. The only negative is that this part of the island seems to get more clouds than other partd but it is a quick fix with a 15 minute ride down the rad.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great value.”
Reviews.Author: RoxyL
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful place and a great value.So much to do in the resort.Beautiful beaches.Great for families or couples.Much nicer than many of the other resorts on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Rain, wind and Unexpected $25/day Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: DreaminTim
Reviews.Content: We didn't realize that Kapalua is the most windy, rainy place on the island. Although it is indeed beautiful (we had oceanfront Gold), the perenial wind and rain put a pall on the trip. If you want sun, you definintely have to move to other places on the island most days. The $25 per day resort fee was unexpected and you need to pay just to get high speed internet. This also includes a shuttle with long delays at dinner time, when you would expect to want to use it the most.Decor was a bit dated/used.

Reviews.Title: “A Wow view”
Reviews.Author: Phillagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 level 1 bedroom. It was nice to have access to the Ritz and golf. The views are AMAZING in the ocean view villas!! I mean truly AMAZING! Huge glass windows, nice outside space. This end of the island was very windy when we were there in May, not sure if that is the norm, but it was very windy.

Reviews.Title: “So many positives but a few issues will probably keep us from coming back”
Reviews.Author: saratoga4
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives: We decided to try the Kapalua Gold Villas for a one week stay from Christmas through New Years. We typically visit Maui about once per year, and generally we stay at the Grand Wailea or the Hoolei Villas at the Grand Wailea. We booked an ocean view gold 2 bedroom villa for $739 per night plus resort fee and taxes, which seemed like a great rate for the Christmas break. First the positives: The Ridge Gold Villa we ended up in (more on that later) was a beautiful, recently remodeled unit with a granite kitchen, new furniture, and marble bathrooms. At about 1800 square feet with 2 bedrooms and 3 full bathrooms, there was plenty of room for my wife, 2 teenage kids, and me. Also, the ocean view from the lanai was beautiful. Due to a mixup with our room, we were offered housekeeping daily (instead of every 3rd day), and we appreciated the gesture by the management. Staying at the Villas, you get access to the Ritz Carlton pool (where the service is impeccable), and this pool is only about a 10 minute walk. You also get access to the Kapalua Spa, about a 10 minute walk also, that had a great fitness center, some yoga and fitness classes, a beautiful pool, and great massages. There are a number of good restaurants throughout the Kapalua resort, and there is a complementary shuttle to get around the resort - just call a few minutes ahead. Kapalua is about 10 minutes north of Kaanapali and 20 minutes north of Lahaina, so there is plenty to do near the resort. Yet what is nice about Kapalua is that it never feels crowded. However, Kapalua is a few degrees cooler and a bit windier than Kaanapali or Wailea, and it does rain more, but the weather was fine during our stay (although we understand there was a lot of rain the week before our trip. While overall we had a great stay, there were a few negatives: First, when we checked in, they initially put us in a standard villa (not a Gold Villa), and the place was a dump. It was straight out of the late 70's or early 80's, it was filthy, and it smelled. The front desk tried to tell us this was a Gold Villa, but after insisting we be moved or we would check out, she moved us. She kept insisting this first villa was Gold, but the housekeeping manager later admitted it was a standard villa. We would have never stayed in anything like that first unit. The entire ordeal wasted a little over 2 hours, and definitely got our stay off to a bad start. Second, the service is not up to a 4 or 5 star caliber. The staff are poorly trained. We called asking for down pillows (the foam pillows on our beds were in very bad shape), and they brought more foam pillows. Then when we called again asking for down pillows, the front desk didn't know if they had them. It took determination and insistence, and demonstrating some frustration, to finally get someone to bring some down pillows. The same happened with Internet access. A simple question about which wireless network to join was met with complete puzzlement, so we just figured it out on our own. After these incidents, the housekeeping manager offered us daily housekeeping and her apologies. She was the one person who understood customer service, and she made up for the shortcomings of the rest of the staff. The general manager also left a message apologizing for the issues a few days later, which was appreciated. Our only other complaint will probably keep us from coming back. The bed was unbelievably uncomfortable. The very thin mattress is clearly past its prime. Our backs were killing us, and we don't have any back problems. We will probably try Kapalua again, but stay at either the Ritz timeshare or at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Ridge”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawk68
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 BR, 2BA Condo (#621) at the Ridge and could not have been happier. The deck overlooked the golf course that overlooked the ocean and the island of Molokai. What I really liked about this area was that it was away from all the traffic and hub-bub of Lahaina, but only 15 minutes north. It is a short walk to DT Fleming Beach, and the grounds of the Ritz Carlton. There is kind of a general store that has an assortment of food items. There is also a trail that runs 3.5 miles round trip that connects the various communities fronting the Pacific. Totally happy to be based in this area for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Bay Villas Will Spoil You”
Reviews.Author: iliveinchicago_2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas 3 times over the last two years and will probably continue to stay there as long as we're fortunate enough to visit Maui. We've invited first timers to Maui to stay with us at the Bay Villas and they have been back on their own since then and have said the Bay Villas were the best place they've stayed on the island. There's a special aura when you're on Maui and adding an extra dose of luxury and peacefulness you feel at the Bay Villas makes that aura even more special. We'll be back on Maui next month and guess where we're staying? You got it - Kapalua Bay Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good appartment, good value”
Reviews.Author: Syrge
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1-Bedroom Gold Villa (Gold = renovated/updated) with a golf course view. This view is less expensive than the Ocean view of course but we decided to spend the saved money somewhere else. The view to the golf course was also good. Weather was not as great. It rained a lot and so it did not matter if I have an ocean view or a golf course view. It rained either one. The Villas are very nice, modern, good appliances incl. Bosch 24" washer and dryer, granite counter tops, 2 Flat screen TVs (one small in bedroom, 1 bigger one in the living room). Room was clean. The daily service included changing towels (as many you request, also for the beach), daily newspaper, wireless internet (mine did not work)...but for that you have to pay the resort fee in addition to your regular room rate. So don't be suprised. The room also will be cleaned each 3rd day, that means vacuumed and swiped. This service was not very good. This cleaning was 3rd class but when you want you can always call the reception and complain. I decided not to complain too much this vacation but your free to do so and I think then they will improve also the service. Overall I can recommend this (Gold Villas) appartments.

Reviews.Title: “A great 30th Anniversary Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kapalua Ridge Villas in a gold villa for 2 weeks in November/December. It would be hard to describe all the superlative parts of this resort in a review. Perhaps the best comliment I can pay to the resort is to say that the wow factor is everywhere you look. The location is outstanding - beach, ocean views, sunsets, golf and sun. We had rented a one bedroom Ridge villa overlooking the Bay villas and Ritz Carleton residences and the ocean. The location on the ridge gave us spectacular views of some of the resort grounds and the ocean from the lanai and one of the golf course fairways from the front side. We watched whales breaching in the channel between Maui and Molakai, incredible sunsets each night, and the most intense rainbows we can remember seeing. The one bedroom unit we rented was large, well equipped, very comfortable and furnished appropriately. Everything worked and worked well. One minor problem was resolved quickly and cheerfully by the resort maintenance staff. The restaurants on site were easily reachable by resort shuttle (a great perk). The dining experience at Merrimans Kapalua is world class, with tremendous views of Kapalua beach and the ocean and the cusine easily matched the views.We also visited Sansei at Kapalua for sushi and the Pineapple Grill. The food and dining experience at both was wonderful. We golfed the Bay course one day and while expensive its views and quality easily paid back the cost. The golf staff were professional and polite to work with. The area around the resort, and nothing is too far away in Maui, if you have a car, is excellent for exploring. Lahaina is a very interesting day trip - not far away but a different world from the Villas. We stayed two weeks, could have spent the entire winter or a lifetime there. Sigh.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation Stay”
Reviews.Author: RDavidVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: We rented a Bay Villa for 8 days late November initially and extended for 3 more into December...wish we could have stayed even longer. It had a marvelous view, was quiet, clean and very comfortable. Craig Hayase from Quam Properties even came by on a Saturday to make sure everything was in order. He was wonderful to deal with as were all the members of the Quam staff who helped us out with a door code problem. We would definitely come back and stay here again. It's close to great beaches, tennis, yoga, fine dining. And everyone we met at the BBQ was friendly. And oh those cardinals who visited us in the morning...very cute.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with excellent snorkeling in Kapalua Bay”
Reviews.Author: jessieclaire
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews as well as my memories of being in Maui over 15 years ago and how much I enjoyed the snorkeling in Kapalua - it was our favorite snorkeling spot that trip. Kapalua Bay was as I remembered it - beautiful golden beach, small secluded bay, excellent variety of fish that are so easy to see even when you are close to the shore. We even saw a sea turtle! The bay was not too far from our room - we stayed in the Bay Villas, so were able to take the path along the shore - maybe a 10 minute walk. The condo room itself was much better than I could have expected. We stayed in a Gold 2 bedroom villa with an ocean view. The place was huge - there were actually 3 full bathrooms - and the kitchen, living room, and dining room were more than adequate space for my husband and me and another couple. The only disadvantage was that the second bedroom was a loft - so it was open to the first floor which gave less privacy. We were only there for 3 nights, so it was not really an issue, but it would probably work better with kids as opposed to another couple. We really enjoyed being on a large resort property with plenty of restaurants as well as having access to the Ritz Carlton pool. The shuttle service that takes you around the resort is easy to use and great for when you want to go to dinner and have a Mai Tai or two. Overall, we had a great time and would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Sceptical....and I haven't even arrived yet!”
Reviews.Author: L B
Reviews.Content: We are supposed to be going to the Kapalua Villas this weekend, so, based on the recent reviews regarding the discrepancy in the rooms and service, I thought I best call in advance to make sure we were all set to go. This is our first trip with our baby and so, as you can imagine, I am a little anxious that everything will be as expected. We did upgrade to Gold based on the Kapalua Villas website and the description, etc. I called yesterday to confirm the reservation and ensure that we had a crib as requested. Come to find out, although the website for both the Kapalua Villas and the site in which we reserved the accomodations on, say a crib is an additional $5, apparently, it is not a crib, but a Pack n' Play Playard (basically a playplen). While a Pack n' Play is fine, for the size of my daughter now, we really need a crib (as they mentioned on the website). Apparently, now to get a crib we have to pay an addtional amount over the quoted amount on their website. When we questioned the discrepancy the woman that was helping us basically said we had to pay it as the website stated a Pack'N Play......which, oh by the way, it doesn't. Then, I was asking about the condo we will be staying in and the person helping me was basically no help, saying she had never seen it, etc. So......to say that I am a bit uneasy for the trip we have coming up is an understatement. I wish I had stuck to my original plan and just rented a suite in a hotel. I will update my review once our trip is over.

Reviews.Title: “Love Kapalua area and the condo was gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: relaxationseeker0
Reviews.Content: The "Gold" condo was gorgeous and we loved walking along the cliffs to the nearby beaches. We had access to the Four Seasons Hotel pool and an incredible Spa. Those were just bonuses on top of the condo on the cliffs. We stopped at Costco on the way in and cooked our own food in the lovely kitchen. AC, flatscreen TVs, very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “A mix of great and horrible”
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 4 days at the Golf Villas, Condo 17T8 in Kapalua Villas. The facility is great. Use of the Ritz and the spa is nice. But run away from Condo 17T8. Lots of space, and a nice layout. However, the refrigerator would not stay closed (we had to block the door with the rice cooker). The truly heinous part was the bed. It was a king size mattress that was so saggy it looked like a mixing bowl . I have seen newer mattresses in third world flop houses. I slept on the floor. One tip: eat at the Sansei restaurant. Great food.

Reviews.Title: “Best option if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing golf vacation in Maui...”
Reviews.Author: Eva Z
Reviews.Content: Spent a two-week long vacation back in Feb, 2009 in Maui Hawaii. First week was about surfing and beach relaxation so we stayed elsewhere(The parents of a friend of ours got a condo) right on the beachfront. The second week we drove here and stayed at Kapalua Villas for a golf week. The bay course and plantation course are stunning and super challenging. Totally kicked my little butt. LOL. Everything was quite expensive coz it was during Chinese New Year. We got a fairway view villa first and then we got upgraded to a gold ocean view villa which was quite big for two of us. The rooms are so nice and we enjoyed watching sun setting on our balcony. Beautiful and peaceful ... truly relaxing. There was a super market nearby the reception and it was a nice drive around the area as well. LOVE IT ! I spent so much money at the shops there on things with kapalua butterfly logo on it I don't even want to talk about it ... Guess I went a little bit C-R-A-Z-Y first time in Hawaii and staying at sort of a golf resort. Still I will return to this place. There is a restaurant called Merriman's Kapalua left me great memory too. Regional Hawaiian Cuisine. Amazing food.

Reviews.Title: “Best West Maui Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rsauer3473
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Kapalua on many trips and have found Kapalua Golf villas to be among our favorite places to stay even though we own two timeshares at the Westin a few miles south. These late 1970's condos are well maintained and, though they are a way from the beach, the privacy and access to beautiful views of Lanai and Molokai make up for it. Units are one and two bedroom in general and very spacious with interior decors reflecting the preferences of the separate owners. All have ocean and golf views as the units cascade down the hill south of the golf course. Guests can walk or drive to Kapalua Beach at the foot of the hill. There are four separate pools serving the development, each small and almost private. The surrounding patios have two or three Weber type gas grills for barbecuing. Rates through local rental agencies can be more economical than going through Kapalua Resort itself. We have used Sullivan Properties --------. The agency takes a 25% deposit up front with the remainder due within 30 days of occupancy. Rates are about $175 for one bedroom and $225 for two bedroom units. Senior discounts are available. Keys are mailed when deposits are received and they can be left in the units upon departure. Cars are necessary when staying here as the airport is about 25 miles away and shopping in Lahaina and Kaanapali is about 8 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Third time looking for an alternate”
Reviews.Author: M K
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time in Maui (my 8th to the islands) and the third at the Kapalua Villas. First time was just amazing - booked 1 bedroom gold ocean view. We stayed in the Bay Villas. Everything about the unit was great only wierd thing was 1.5 bathrooms and no tub which would have been nice we have 2 small kids who like baths. The maid service was okay, news paper delivery inconsistent and no turn down service. Second time booked same thing - stayed in Bay Villas again but this unit was a bit beat up. The finishes were not as good, and little things were broken like the shades and some fixtures. No tub again, maid service a bit worse, but there was turn down service and it was consistent. This past summer was the 3rd and we booked the same. But this time we were put in the Ridge Villas. The finishes in this unit were better than 2nd equal to 1st. But it was much further away from the ocean. Also lousy view from the bedroom. You are basically looking at the parking. The previous 2 stays you had a view of the ocean from the bedroom - unit was a 2 level plan this one was a single level unit. When my wife went to see if we could switch there was a blond woman there that told her that another woman was complaining and she basically told her if you don't like it you don't have to stay there ... wow - so my wife kind of wimped out and we stayed at the Ride. Also you are only allowed to go the the pools in your area. Which is a shame. Our pool was great for location. but it did not have a view of the ocean like our 2 previouys stays. The maid service was horrible (they changed their policy and only change bedding every 3rd day or something so basically we were making our beds - i understand recycling the sheets but make the bed), newspaper delivery was spotty, and they had no turn down service, also no slippers or robes - had to ask. And the kitchen had ants ... lots of them everywhere. we kept everything in the refrigerator. Something happened to their service. in addition to the nightly rate you pay a $25 per day resort fee. Last night I went to the office to print my boarding pass (which they said was a service on the back of the brochure) and same blond women said I need to go to the Ritz to print it ... come on. When i was there the last time on stay 2 I printed the pass right there and I could see the computer terminal I used on my previous stay. The Kapalua Villas are still a great location and there never seems to be a crowd - always quiet. But the service is inconsistent and staff seems a bit short on the whole aloha thing. And it is a bit of a crap shoot regarding the finishes in the units. We have always booked gold so i don't know what the regular units are like. Basically it is worth it to experience Kapalua - but our familiy has maxed out on it and we are looking for another place for stay number 5. And my review is really based on our last trip.

Reviews.Title: “It should have been better !”
Reviews.Author: MVO747
Reviews.Content: Spa - fantastic Ritz Hotel pool & beach - fantastic My "gold" unit - tired & bland Housekeeping a joke....every day they take the trash and give you a pile of new towels (they don't even hang them) On the third day they will change the sheets and only then make the bed. Come on Outrigger.....bring back the class !

Reviews.Title: “"All Expectations Exceeded"”
Reviews.Author: ctheworld64
Reviews.Content: Aloha, I have dreamed of visiting Hawaii since I was a little girl (when I used to think that you could drive there across a bridge). Now 47 years old, my husband and I were fortunate enough to make that dream come true (by flying of course). We stayed on Maui at The Kapalua "Golf" Villas from October 1st through October 15th, 2011 and absolutely loved everything about it. When it's your first time visiting a new place it can be scary and confusing trying to decide where to stay. After all, if you are anything like us you have planned and saved for a long time to be able to take a vacation such as this not to mention that you are using your vacation time from work. After reading reviews like this one for a lot of places on Maui, I decided on The Kapalua Villas and booked our trip through Orbitz. For months I wondered if I had made the right choice. After spending two wonderful weeks in Paradise, I can honestly say that I made the perfect choice and hope to one day be able to stay there again. We don't play golf but were in Building 12 of the Golf Villas and had a partial ocean view. Our Villa was tastefully decorated with quality furniture and appliances, very clean and comfortable and had an awesome view. The grounds are unbelievably manicured!! Many villas are much closer to the beach access than ours was so if that is important to you, I would suggest you call them and ask what those are called. I actually love to walk so didn't mind the 8-10 minute stroll down. Speaking of walking....there is a coastal trail which begins at the Kapalua Bay beach that you must check out. There was a pool right beside of our villa that had a shelter, tables and bbq grills so you could cook out by the pool if you wanted. By being a guest at the villas you also have access to the neighboring Ritz Carlton pool, hot tub, beach, restaurants and more. The Kapalua villas are located on the west side of Maui along with (in my opinion) some of the best scenery, places to snorkel, walk, bike and eat. The Plantation House is just down the road and serves breakfast until 3pm and has awesome views. There is this little country store called The Honolua Store on the property that we fell in love with and visited daily for pastries, very good inexpensive hot and cold food, coffee, tea, chocolate and souvenirs. This is getting really long so I will try to wrap it up...If you like the outdoors and want a peaceful, relaxing but memorable vacation I think that this is the place for you. We paid a $25 per day resort fee which I was a little hesitant about at first but with all of the amenities, daily housekeeping, internet and so much more, it was worth every penny. The Kaplula Villas along with the people of Maui went above and beyond to make our vacation an exceptional one. I have been back a week today and have shed tears every day because I miss it so and will long to come back there for the rest of my days. Mahalo to the Hawaiians for sharing their Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jeff M
Reviews.Content: My family and I have traveled to Maui each year for the past decade, and we are never disappointed. This trip was no exception and for the second year in a row, our stay at Kapalua Villas was marvelous. The grounds of the resort are in great shape, the numerous beaches (the big ones and the hidden gems) are some of the best in the entire world, and the wealth of activities all make for a perfect getaway with friends and family. There were eight of us on this trip and we had a total of three units, all gold (well worth the few extra dollars). The rooms were large, clean, and fully loaded, thought we did not stay inside all that much we were comfortable when we did. Spa, you must use the spa! Get a massage after working out in the best "hotel" gym we have seen (very modern equipment). Housekeeping was daily and we appreciated the care that was evident in cleaning up after our kids ( the adults too I suppose). The check in was warm and very informative and the concierge set us up with a full agenda in which everyone got to enjoy what they liked most. The golf courses are fantastic and never seemd crowded, similar to the resort overall. We are bringing more people next year and definitely staying at the villas. Staff that stood out include Sam, Tatzuko, Rexy, Editha, and the desk manager (sorry, didn't get his name).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful villas, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel Y
Reviews.Content: The actual villas were gorgeous, we had an ocean view which was quite spectacular and the villa itself was massive with all the up to date appliances etc. The resort as a whole had good restaurants and beaches and there is a free shuttle that can take you round so you can save your petrol. However, you must be aware before you stay here that you are a long way from anywhere, as much as it was nice to have peace and tranquility, if you like to be in the thick of things this is not the place to stay, it takes at least 20 minutes to get to Ka'anapali and so is not ideal if you want a drink with dinner etc. Also the daily resort fee is quite a lot and it is not full housekeeping service being a villa so I'm not entirely sure what it is for or why it cant just be included in the whole cost. Still a beautiful location and lovely place to stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Best villas and great value in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Frankleo08
Reviews.Content: Turquois, cerulean, royal, whatever your favorite shade of blue, you will see it in the sky and water at Kapalua. Perched on a bluff overlooking the Pacific and with a stunning view of Molokai, there is no lovelier place on the planet. Here, serenity takes hold and never lets go. This our second visit to the villas this year and both experiences have been above expectations. We stayed in an oceanfront one bedroom â€œgoldâ€� villa (23-G2). The great advantage to these villas is the plethora of space. Furnishings were very nice and the unit was in very good shape. Only a few cosmetic changes are needed. It has granite countertops in the bathroom with two sinks and plenty of vanity space and a large shower. The kitchen has stainless steel appliances and granite, too. Bedroom is approx. 12x12 with a very comfortable king bed. The internet connection was speedy and there are televisions in the living room and bedroom and both have DVD players. The only downside is their size. The living room TV is a 26â€� which by todayâ€™s standards is small. Unfortunately, it is built in to a cabinet and the owner may not want to change it out. The bedroom TV is small, too. Both of our stays were in gold units. There were some units for sale that we viewed that were not updated to gold. I would not recommend these as some of the furnishings were rather tattered and the kitchen counters and appliances were not updated. I believe the best units are from buildings 19 to 23. They front the ocean and have the best views You can rent these units on the Ritz-Carlton and Outrigger sites. Additionally, some are rented by the owners on VRBO and flipkey. The resort has great restaurants and golf courses. I recommend Merrimanâ€™s for dinner and the Plantation course for golf (I have done separate reviews for these.) The Pineapple grill is also great as is the Plantation house on the golf course. Kapalua is the premier resort on Maui if you are looking for a serene setting. However, if you are looking for a lot of action, you might be better off in Kaanapali. If you are looking for a Disneyland-esque experience you may prefer the ostentatious Grand Wailea and itâ€™s equally inflated prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy - If you have the money”
Reviews.Author: robvia
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in room 522, Ridge Villa. We booked it as a 1 bedroom, but they actually gave us a 2 bedroom unit and didn't lock the extra bedroom. This unit has 3 bathrooms, it was only the wife and I. We didn't use the other side of the unit. This is definitely upscale with marble counter tops, marble bathrooms, double sinks, full kitchen, wireless internet that worked, incredible views. The cons: Master bed was starting to sag in the spots where people sleep. They need a new mattress. What they really need is the new 7k Tempur-pedic beds. Also, the shower head was moldy, handle cover off, and there was some rust under the shower bar. The entire shower fixture needs to be replaced and the tub re-chalked. The carpet in the master bedroom is also starting to wear in the traffic area. There were water ants in the kitchen, need some Tero. Each bedroom has a wall unit for the AC, they work great but make noise. We mentioned all of this to the staff at check out. They listened but didn't make any notes. I'm not sure how they get feedback to the owners of all the problems. Pros: The work out room at The Spa is nice, and you get to use it. They give you a parking pass which lets you park at The Spa, then you can walk down to Kapalua beach. This is a good reason to stay at the villas, along with all the other stuff I mentioned. The cons may have you wondering why you spent so much money, we stayed 2 nights at Eldorado and though it was better. The over all "feel" of this area is upscale. If that's your style and you have the money, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “A great, relaxing honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: MrCheezle
Reviews.Content: We visited The Kapalua Villas from September 12th through the 22nd on our honeymoon. We rented an oceanfront gold one bedroom unit through Costco Travel and loved every minute of it. Our villa ended up being in the Bay Villas unit 35 with a beautiful oceanfront setting. It had a great layout with 1 and a half bathrooms, full kitchen, stacked washer/dryer and two porches. The whole area was quiet and relaxing but close enough to activities on the days we wanted to get out. The housekeeping staff did a great job with their two days of light service then a third of full cleaning. The front desk staff were happy and seemed truly excited to be working for Kapalua Villas. We loved hanging out at the pool at the Kapalua Spa (access was included as part of the restort fee). We even made it to the Ritz's pools one days which is a great place to people watch. The location of our villa was perfect. We walked a couple minutes down the paved trail to Kapalua Bay for snorkeling, swimming & people watching. The beach right near our villa was always quiet and protected. D.T. Fleming beach was beautiful though the afternoon we went down there the wind picked up so we walked back to the Spa's pools. Thank you to everyone at the Kapalua Villas for making our stay and honeymoon a wonderful experience. We are looking forward to making a return trip to Maui and the Kapalua Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but Older”
Reviews.Author: Kathy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these villas twice in the early 90's and wanted to go back. The unit we were assigned in July was very spacious - 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, laundry area, kitchen, large living room, 2 story unit. It is an older property so the trees are lush but it is an older style of condos. Our unit looked like it was decorated by a Chinese grandma. The property is a bit of a drive to most of the places we wanted to go (Maalaea Harbor, Lahina). Since our flight was not until 10pm, we asked for a later check out, but they said we had to be out by 11am. I thought they could have offered us a bit more time or at least somewhere to clean up after going to the beach for the day. All in all a nice place, but we will probably choose another place to stay when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, wrong part of the Island for weather”
Reviews.Author: theabsta
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the apartments at Kapalua, they were well furnished, very comfortable and lovely and clean. We had a fair view room and it was very peaceful with views of the golf course and the walk to the beach was only 10 mins away. We were hoping for an upgrade due to being on Honeymoon but weren't lucky enough! :-( The restaurants on site were excellent, we ate both at the reception building (can't remember it's name) and Merrimans. The latter was pricey but worth it with gorgeous food, the first more reasonable and featuring Mahi mahi (Hawaiian fish and chips) and chicken kebabs etc. For being guests at Kapaula we were allowed access to the Ritz Carlton pool and facilities. Well worth going to for service by your sun lounger and relaxing in style! Apart from the weather going cloudy most days we loved our time here, but would recommend a hire car!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Maui!”
Reviews.Author: courtney_meinen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Kapalua Villas. They are incredibly spacious, which we loved. The kitchen was updated beautifully. Our view of the water was lovely. The living, dining, and kitchen were all a nice size - plenty of seating and gathering room. The balconies were a great place to sit in the mornings. The Kapalua Resort itself is huge - there are many great restaurant options, but be prepared to walk a little to get to the beach. The pool at the villas isn't spectacular, although it is private. The Ritz Carlton pool area is very nice and there is a free shuttle provided up to it.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS AN AWESOME TRIP!”
Reviews.Author: mooooose-11
Reviews.Content: we stayed two weeks at the kapalua villas on maui. the villa was excellent. the grounds were well maintained. the staff was very friendly and helpful. you need a car to see all the sights. we saw the sunrise on the haleakala volcano and we traveled the road to hana. use the food coupons in the magazines located everywhere. we hope to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Ridge Villas”
Reviews.Author: clarity88
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Kapalua Villas, in Building 19 Unit 24. We were in Maui from August 27 to September 4th. We booked with Diane(Ridge Realty) who made our stay wonderful. The VIlla was just as advertised, upgraded, with a wonderful view of Oneola Bay. Fully stocked, with washer/dryer, towels, cooking/eating utensils. Great value, did I mention wonderful view? Will definitely return here again for the beautiful property. Also, thanks to Terry and Bill! Shihlong Yeh

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua "No Kai Oi" - Is the Best,”
Reviews.Author: Allen L
Reviews.Content: We are repeat visitors to Kapalua that live, work and play in Waikiki. We choose to spend our hard earned vacation time and money close to home at the Kapalua Villas. The staff there live and exemplify the true Aloha Sprit and provide the perfect escape for our family and friends. Outrigger Management has done a great job in maintaing the high standards that the Kapalua name represents. It is due to the fact that they have retained their loyal employees like Romel in reservations, to Samantha at the front desk and Shannon and Rexie, our bellmen as well as all the Shuttle drivers, housekeepers and maintenance staff. We are treated like family and will return again and again. They provided service beyond expectation. To get this kind of service you need to book through Outrigger. By the way, the use of the Kapalua Spa facilities was included in the resort fee and was an added bonus since our last visit. Thomas the personal trainer is worth his weight in gold. Also note that we always book an ocean view gold and it's worth every penny. Thanks again to the wonderful staff at Kapalua for making our dreams come true. A. & K. Lam

Reviews.Title: “Maui Condo”
Reviews.Author: Twila S
Reviews.Content: The Kapalua Villas are wonderful if you get a "Gold" room. These rooms are upgraded and have wonderful amenities. The resort provides a shuttle to and from your room to the Ritz Carlton, the local market and the beaches. The shuttle service is very speedy. We never waited more than 10 minutes for them to arrive, and they come right to your front door. It's perfect for families who want to do a variety of things without having to rent multiple cars. The grounds are just beautiful. The downside: It is a small drive if you wanta go to Kannapali or Lahania. Internet service is very spotty and slow so bring your own WiFi if you need it. The biggest problem (as others mentioned) is Housekeeping. Itâ€™s pretty poor. They show up very early in the morning, never the same person twice. They just replace the towels daily. Even on days (every 3rd) when they are supposed to do a full cleaning, it's just a light touch up, and re-making of the beds. Donâ€™t look for a â€œrealâ€� cleaning from this crew. They also love to park their carts in your carport. Housekeeping problem aside, if you don't need lots of housekeeping attention, then this is a great place. There's a great place to eat right on the Kapalua Bay for breakfast. Don't be in a hurry..it's slow service but the food is wonderful and the view amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: trav422
Reviews.Content: We hadn't intended to stay at Kapalua Gold Villas. We had actually checked into another hotel in Lahaina, Maui and had an extremely negative experience. Fortunately, our travel agent and the staff here squeezed us into a Gold Villa last minute on Labor Day weekend. The villa we are staying in has a "partial" ocean view, but I can see the ocean quite well. The only thing that would make it more of a "full" ocean view would be wrap around windows. Both my husband and I were awestruck at the quality of the villa (building 14, 1 bedroom unit), especially after staying in our last hotel. The owners of this unit have paid attention to detail and the decor is very pleasing. The beach access is awesome. The pools near the villas are quiet but not overly fancy. The best things about this place are the location, the view, and the quiet relaxation. The atmosphere is quite nice for a romantic couples retreat. There are plenty of places in the resort to dine and a couple small shopping places nearby with little fast food stops like Maui Tacos. The spa is really, really enjoyable. I would recommend this place to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: RickChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We rented one of the golf villas in February. Nothing fancy and we didn't have an ocean view but the property is nicely kept and we got a good value for 5 of us in a 2 bedroom unit. We paid less than $300/night which I thought was a great deal in season. It's far north in West Maui but I enjoyed not being in all the chaos and in a quiet area. We didn't play golf but the course looked great - having almost a private pool near our unit was a nice touch but you can also use the great pool at the Ritz as well. Tip: make sure to drive the road on the North coast of West Maui - beautiful and a lot less trafficked than the road to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but plan to stay a while”
Reviews.Author: ivestar
Reviews.Content: Jul 17, 2011 Romance "Great Place but plan to stay a while" Reviewed by a Hotels.com guest We really enjoyed our stay in Maui. You will need a car to take full advantage of this property but I would recommend staying for over a week. We only stayed 5 days and did not really get the full use of this property. The rooms are large and well appointed with everything you need for Cooking and living (except Kitchen Necessities like salt pepper, [â€¦] oil etc) We were in the Golf Villas so for us it was a 15minute walk to the Beach or the Ritz Carlton (I assumed it was closer when booking online) The Ritz Carlton is Amazing and great for relaxing. Some of Mauis best Beaches are nearby but as stated you need to walk at least 15minutes, drive or you can call the Villas internal transport that will transport you locally. Excellent BBQ facilities with a basic pool (scattered around the complex) This would have been an ideal place to settle down with some friends for a few weeks. We were always on the Go so didn't use to our full advantage. Overall a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with 1223/1224”
Reviews.Author: pantheon23
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed in 1223/1224, a two bedroom 3 bath Villa and this stay rivals some of our European vacations as far as hotel and ambiance (including our Tauck tour of Classic Italy). The only drawback, and a minor one at that, is that you have to drive to get groceries, etc., unlike most of the tourists who stay Ka'anapali. Having known this prior to arriving, we shopped at WalMart and Safeway upon our arrival at the airport in Kahului. You can also get a great meal at Da Kitchen in Kahului (not the same as the Ka'anapali franchise) before you get to the villa to settle in. We arrived at around noon at the airport and couldn't check in until 3pm anyway. In short, our villa was a home away from home. Granite countertops, SubZero built in fridge, walk-in open shower in the Master, a view of both Lana'i and Moloka'i to start off with. Parking is right out front, and although we didn't use it, the shuttle is available to take you anywhere on the property. We did have minor issues (really non-issues) with the porch light not working and 2 small cockroaches and, of course, geckos. But you're on an lush island, this is expected. I shooed the locals out and the service people changed the lightbulb with only one request. Towels are changed daily and they semi-clean the rooms. Remember, that this is not a hotel, so the beds are not made daily. I believe it's every other or 3rd day. No big deal. The person who griped about having his phone stolen should have known better to leave expensive personal items out. Passports and the like should be kept in the in-room safe. This villa should not be treated any different than high-end hotel. Things will get stolen. Be smart and use the safe. Best secluded beach to see giant (and I mean GIANT) sea turtles is Honokeana bay. You have to park on Napili Place (no later than 9:30 in the morning), walk down to Napili Bay and walk AROUND Honokeana Cove (head south on the black rocks) to the next bay which is Honokeana Bay. Jump right in and head towards the motel that had large rocks for their beach (really, rocks, not sand at the beach). You'll see the turtles feeding not far from these rocks. Although we didn't get to go, I can tell that Honolua Bay would have been good for snorkeling as well, but the secret's out and you have to get there early because parking is VERY limited. Kapalua Bay is a great one with family for just dipping in the water but you should definitely buy water shoes at Safeway because everyone of us got scraped by the rocks that are not to far from the water's edge. Fleming's Beach (1 mile north of the compound (?)) is great for boogie boarding or body surfing as it doesn't have rocks to get slammed into and there's a lifeguard. Oneloa Bay, which is on the Kapalua property, is also great for boarding or body surfing but the rocks can be troublesome and there's no lifeguard. Rent your snorkelling equipment at Snorkel Bob's just down the road. We only took advantage of the Ritz Carlton Hotel pool a couple of times but really, as beautiful as it was, it's still just a pool. You're in Maui to enjoy the beaches and that's what we did. But if you have little ones, they might enjoy movie night at the pool (Toy Story 3 was playing when we were there). One thing we wondered about is why these people would pay more money to stay in a hotel room (granted it's the Ritz) and not one of the Villas on the same property? But then again, we'd love to keep Kapalua Villas our little secret. Our daily routine is that we usually purchased breakfast and some souvenirs at the Honolua General store (now being run by ABC stores) and the food and prices were definitely reasonable. We really didn't have time to have a sit-down breakfast because of the activities that we crammed in (ziplining, crater excursions, side trips, etc), requiring early arrivals. In Lahaina, eat at the Cheeseburger restaurant and have mango shave (I learned it's not SHAVED, but SHAVE) ice at Ululani down the street. You can't go wrong there! Hula Grill at Ka-anapali had great food as well. I had the Wasabi Rib Eye steak there. The Aloha Mixed Plate restaurant (I believe it's behind the Safeway) had OK food, but they ran out of Kalbi and we waited 1 hour to be seated and another hour to be served. Stay away if you cherish your time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: SebGo
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Maui for a wedding which was held at the Kapalua Villas. We stayed in the Kapalua Bay Villas in a one bedroom (for my wife and me). The unit was very nice, though the layout was less than ideal - a two story loft sort of thing which delivered the inconvenience of two floors without the privacy or noise mitigation of an actual one-bedroom (the bedroom was a loft, so any activity on the first floor went right up to the bedroom - a disadvantage for the eastern time zone worker trying to get some business done before his sleeping spouse awakens. The Kapalua resort is incredibly beautiful and well done. We took advantage of the spa and spent an afternoon lounging around the pool and getting massages. The beaches that were accessible by foot were quite lovely, if a bit windy. Who would I not stay there again? Because it is a bit isolated, more or less requires a drive to get anywhere - but I guess that is largely the case throughout Maui - and because we'd rather be more in the flow of the community than isolated in this resort type setting with the wealthy tourists. For us, the Kapalua Villas delivered on the promise of a high end resort experience. That being said, we've come to the conclusion that we'd rather travel in a way that puts us more into the flow of the local scene. We surfed four days in Lahaina and enjoyed that - and the morning of snorkeling - more than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Just Beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: christraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Ridge Villa booked through VRBO, which was also managed by Ridge Realty. We stayed for 5 nights in July. We loved our unit, it was very spacious, clean, had air conditioning as well as ceiling fans, nice lanai, the bed was very comfortable. Swimming pool just across the road, which we used a few times. Great area for walking, close to beaches. We even walked down to Seahouse Restaurant for dinner and Slack-key show. It felt like we were staying in the middle of the golf course, as that was the view from the Lanai. It was so quiet and peaceful we loved it. Our unit was #2521, if we come back to Maui we would choose to stay in the same unit. Enjoyed snorkelling at Kapalua beach, and Black Rock in this area, but our favourite sport for snorkelling in this part of the island was Honolua Bay - went back twice to this bay. There is no daily room service with this unit which suited us, also you don't pay the Ritz Resort daily fee (we weren't going to use their facilities anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: DTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: The Kapalua villa's are on the west-side of Maui, ancd give you access to four great beaches. We stayed at a one bedroom villa with partial ocean view. This mis nice because we where in the nice green part of the resort, but could stil enjoy the view on the ocean. I have to say the villa was very large for us, with a full kichen this is perfect for families. And we enjoyed our breakfast on the balcony, perfect! I think staying in a place is nicer than staying in a traditional Hotel, it allows for more freedom and it is more quiet. Service was great too, all in all a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “What could be better”
Reviews.Author: jland0001
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great - right on golf course with view to ocean. Great furniture, beds and modern kitchen. Granite counters. PATIO ON GOLF COURSE. Village was great. Beach cannot be beat. Use of hotel pool but nice pool with BBQ'D area across street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It UNTIL House Keeping Stole My Phone!”
Reviews.Author: RockysGirl89
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this resort!! My whole family did. We stayed here the whole trip and on the last day my phone went missing. I had left my phone in my villa and when we came back it was gone. I called the front office, they were knew of the theft. We left the same day that my phone was taken. When I got home and went to the cell phone store to deactivate my phone they person who stole it was using it. They had also taken the Sim Card out and put it into a iPhone. I called the numbers they called and some were phone calls to house keeping at the villas. After discovering this new information I called the villas and spoke with Anthony [--], the resort manager. He blew me off saying I was not being fair to his staff and I had no proof. He went so far as to tell me I was rude and it was my problem not his. This changed my outlook on the villas. If house keeping will steal a cell phone and then use it what won't they steal? And a heads up, management will NOT help you! They instead say it is your fault!!!! I will not stay at this resort again due to this.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and impressive”
Reviews.Author: YYZErnie
Reviews.Content: After a week in Honolulu at a none-too-impressive hotel, we arrived at the beautiful Kapalua Villas. We had a 1 bedroom oceanfront villa with a lovely balcony that overlooked a small, grassy lawn and the rocky shore. Kapalua is a wee bit out of the way, so you will need a rental car, for sure. I must admit, though, that this location can't be beat if your goal is relaxation, and peace and quiet. The unit we had (36B4) was 1200 square feet; the size of a decent 1 bedroom apartment. It had a fully appointed kitchen and a stackable Bosch washer and dryer. When I'm on vacation, I hate having to forage for breakfast in the morning, and after a week in Honolulu, it was nice to be able to do some laundry. As well, we had access to the Ritz Carlton (with room charge privileges) next door and the Kapalua Spa. Unfortunately, the Spa does not allow you to charge to your villa, but that was no big deal. The Spa is great, and the people are really nice, so having access to it is fantastic. I've stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua before, and while it is heavenly, I think I now prefer the space, and the peace and quiet of the villas more. Our group rented 3 villas that week, and all were very different. Our villa was beautifully appointed with nice built-ins, tasteful art on the walls and interesting little pieces of furniture and curios that made the place feel warm and welcoming, just like home! There was a knock at the door each morning to change and/or replace towels as necessary, and every third day someone did a more thorough cleaning. Since I am not that messy a person, this was quite fine. Perhaps if you had a bunch of kids running around creating havoc, you might want to see a more frequent service, but it was all good. In summary, this is a lovely place to stay and I would certainly return without a moment's hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: DaveK55ars
Reviews.Content: Very nice property and an enjoyable visit. We used the spa, beaches and played golf and all were first rate as was our two bedroom gold villa. We took advantage of the shuttle and loved the access to the Ritz. The resort is fairly large and somewhat spread out, but we had no issues getting around. All the staff were efficient and friendly. Two great meals too, Plantation House and Merriman's. We had some problems with the free wireless internet and bed wasn't my favorite, but little else to find fault with. These are long flights from the East Coast, but I suspect we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, bad experience checking in.”
Reviews.Author: lovemybostonterriers
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending a week at Kapalua Villas on Maui. There were six of us total that shared the villa for the week: my husband and myself, his parents, and his sister and her husband. We were so excited to share this trip with them because we had been to Maui for our honeymoon 5 years ago and knew we would return with family. After a long day of traveling we got to the office to check in, and they had no record of our reservation for a 3 bedroom, 3 bath Gold villa.
