We had booked it through a travel agent and had all our confirmation paperwork, and the front desk staff didn't seem to believe that we had reservations. Just 3 weeks before that, I had called Outrigger's general phone number to confirm our reservation, and it was there. The nice man I spoke with on the phone repeated all our reservation info back to me with our names, the type of villa, and the dates. It was all there. But when we checked in, it was all gone, and there was no Gold villa for us to stay in. They only had a fairway view villa with 2 bathrooms. After over and hour of waiting and talking to our travel agent, we took the only thing they had. They said they would not charge our debit card again, but there is still a very large hold on it that hasn't cleared, and we checked out 3 days ago. Our travel agent worked very hard to figure out our refund because we had paid for and reserved the best, and actually stayed in a much less expensive villa. But it took Outrigger almost the full week to figure out it was their fault and what our refund was. I must say I am disappointed with how this was handled, and had hoped we would hear an apology from the manager or at least get a call from the staff making sure we were satisfied with our stay. But we did not. On a brighter note, the villa worked out ok for the 6 of us. We had so much fun snorkeling in Kapalua Bay, and Honolua Bay and exploring the island that we really didn't spend much time at the villa. Even though the villa was fairway view, it still had a stunning view of the ocean and property. The Kapalua Spa is a beautiful place, and a must see if staying at Kapalua Villas. We really would stay there again, and I understand clerical errors happen, but the sign of a great staff is super-serving the customer, and we did not experience that kind of service at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and peaceful...not crowded like Ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: Belgium3boys
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a beautiful place away from the crowds of Ka'anapali, consider this place. Most of these villas are privately-owned and managed by the Kapalua Resort. Wej stayed in the Bay Villas, and requested an "ocean view" villa. There are also "ocean front" villas, so there were a few villas in our view of the ocean. (there are other villas..."the ridge" and "golf". Some of the ridge villas also have views of the ocean.) The villa was well-equipped and nicely decorated. This can vary, however, based upon who owns the villa. The maid-service changed towels and trash every day, and bed-service every 3 days. Our unit did have a washer and dryer. The grounds are well maintained, there is plenty of pools and any villa isn't too far from one of them. The pools there have restrooms, lounge chairs, a bbq grill and tables/chairs for dining. We actually dined twice by the pool and used the grill. Very nice set-up. There is even a sink to do minor clean-up. The villas have access to the Ritz-Carlton amentities. We headed to the pool a couple of times. Their pool has 3 large sections, including an adult-only section. There are also two hot tubs/spas and a baby pool area. Around the pool is a kids' play area, shuffleboard and a bocce ball area. A nice amentity for the villas is the shuttle. It will bring you to any of the areas on property and would also bring you to Kapalua beach and maybe Fleming beach. The grounds are exspanse, so this is a nice service. You phone them and they arrive within 5-10 minutes to bring you where you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon at the Villas!”
Reviews.Author: amyn1438
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our June Honeymoon. This was our first time in Hawaii, and we split the stay between here and Honolulu. We absolutely loved everything about the Kapalua Villas from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The property is very large, with amazing views of the mountains and ocean from all over. Check-in was quick and easy. There is the Honolua Store on property, which is a small grocery store among other things. We stopped here first thing and bought some groceries. It was a little pricey. Our villa was amazing. This is what made the trip so great. We stayed in a Gold Ocean View villa. I would highly recommend staying in a Gold Villas, as everything was immaculate, and from reading reviews before our trip, it seems to me that anyone who was disappointed with their villa was not in a gold unit. I also enjoyed the ocean view, and debated between booking an ocean view or ocean front. I was happy we went with the ocean view because we had a panoramic view whereas it appeared if you were in an ocean front villa, you would have only a view of the ocean rather than of the ocean and mountains as we did, plus the ocean front villas are not by any of the nice beaches anyway. Kapalua Bay was by far the best beach. Great snorkeling, clam water, beautiful, and there is a beach stand where you can rent chairs, etc. I enjoyed renting a lounge chair rather than laying on a towel on the beach as it can be windy here and otherwise sand is blowing on you & your things. D.T. Flemming beach was nice, but way to windy the day we were there. We really enjoyed our villa as we were able to cook, do laundry, etc. This might not seem like things you want to do on vacation, but we liked being able to do these things as it seemed more like we were living there not just visiting. Our villa had a large, well equipped kitchen with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances, a nice dinning area, living room, huge bedroom with King bed, and two bathrooms, both with very nice stand up showers. We had a small balcony off our bedroom, and a HUGE balcony off the living room with sliding glass doors, a table, four chairs, and a lounge chair. We also had our own covered parking spot and our own entrance which was very nice. The small pools around the villas were quiet and nice, with grills, bathrooms, etc. available. We spent some time at the Ritz Carlton pool as well, which was very nice and we enjoyed being able to use their amenities as well. We especially liked the poolside service offered, and the comfy lounge chairs and nice towels there. We dined at Pineapple Grill, which was just ok IMO, as well as the restaurant on D.T. Flemming beach(I believed called the Beach House), for lunch which was nice with a great view. We had breakfast at The Plantation House which I would highly recommend. It was delicious with good service and amazing views. My husband played golf at the Bay Course and could not stop talking about how amazing it was, while I went to the Kapalua Spa for a massage which was equally amazing. We also used the facilities at the Spa on another day, which are included with your resort fee, and are very nice, especially the infinity edge pool. We took the short drive to Honolua Bay which also offered excellent snorkeling, and went down to Lahania one night for the Old Lahania Luau, which is highly recommended. Other than that we stayed on the resort, and you never really need to leave, it offers so much. We did however really enjoy having a rental car. There is a resort shuttle available, and we did see it operating frequently, but found it much more convenient to be able to hop in our car whenever we pleased. Parking was fairly easy and free around the resort. Our only disappointment was that our zipline tour we had scheduled with Kapalua Adventures was cancelled due to high winds, (and the day we were set to go out was the least windy of all the days we were there) so this is something to be aware of. It is pretty windy on this part of the island. We also were not aware of the fact that this had been cancelled until we got there. They called us in the morning but we had a missed call, but they didn't leave us a message which I don't understand why, and we could have scheduled something else had we known. The concierge was nice and helped us book a last minute sunset cruise, which was enjoyable, but I would have much rather done the zip lining. We also ate appetizers and had drinks at the Aloha Lounge which had great sushi & saki, as well as a great view of the Ritz pool (another plus of this pool it is open 24 hours). Overall we loved our stay here and would gladly return. We are jealous of the people who own property there, it is very beautiful and highly recommended for a stay both with family or for a honeymoon couple, we loved the secludedness of it!

Reviews.Title: “The Kapalua Villas were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: t0winsto
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed here and booked based off the reviews. It was amazing! We had an ocean front place 34g4 and I was impressed. We had a super updated place with stainless steele appliances and an awesome bathroom. Had outdoor chairs and tables. Everything you need in a condo. We stayed in the Bay Villas and it was easy to get to despite the map they gave us. The best part was access to the Ritz Carlton. We used the pool and resturants which were great! Plenty of great food around. Beaches were awesome and so much to do around the resort. We left the resort a few days to each because we had a car and ate in some local spots which was nice. We had 14 family members in town with us due to our wedding. We did this location as our honeymoon and would have liked to have the whole family stay with us. Great family atmosphere. Any review that says this place was average doesnt know what they are talking about. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, LOVE My Gold Kapalua Villa!”
Reviews.Author: lovelytan
Reviews.Content: I came to Maui for a relaxing vacation and fell in love with Kapalua! We stayed in the Ridge Villas (2123), which was a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom gold villa with golf view, although we still had a partial view of the ocean. This unit actually has 3 bathrooms. Upon checkin, the staff was extremely friendly and informative as was the concierge. The resort is quiet and peaceful and very well maintained. Our villa was very well maintained and the beds were comfortable. I actually liked the fact that the villa did not have central air because I traveled with my sister, who is always cold and I am always warm! With individual air units it was much easier to control the temperature in different parts of the villa. We went to the Kapalua Spa to work out, which is really nice. We also walked along one of the many trails in the resort. I highly recommend walking along the coastal trail--the view is spectacular! I really have nothing bad to say about Kapalua except that I wish my stay was longer!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our Bay Villa, 14B2- excellent!! Cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Loves2TravelALOT_11
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Kapalua Bay Villa, 14B2. It is a bridge unit so you don't have to climb stairs to unload suitcases or groceries. Unbelievable ocean views, even the sunset over Molokai from the bedroom. The kitchen is upgraded with marble counters and stainless steel appliances. The unit is air conditioned so even in hot times its cool. During whale season you can see them breech without even using binoculars. We were there a bit late in the whale season ( end of April beginning of May) but saw many pods passing by- It was bliss. This unit is a very short walk to one of the 3 pools all equipped with nice gas grills. Cant imagine a better villa than 14B2.. Strongly suggest you request this place. You wont be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Jsokol
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded our expectations. We stayed at a fairway room, clean, modern, comfortable and well managed. The resort shares common facilities with the Ritz. If you're a golfer, this is the place to stay! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great villa and amazing views”
Reviews.Author: Frankleo08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and three grandchildren spent a week in a beautiful two bedroom oceanfront villa in this wonderful resort. We were on the ground floor in 19-g2. Flooring was all tile with king beds in both bedrooms and a sofabed in the living room. Showers were large. Only one sink in the bathrooms, but the surface was very large. Kitchen was upgraded with granite countertops and stainless steel refrigerator. The best thing about this resort is the peace and quiet. No road, airplane, jetski or barking dog (I believe they are not allowed) noise, just the sound of the ocean and wind in the palms (very windy). My wife and I will be back, Given some of the negative reviews, we will request a gold villa. One negative was the food at the Honolua store. We had breakfast there and it was not good. Just warmed over buffet food. We bought groceries at the Safeway in Lahaina and ate in our dining room most of the time. One note about some of the recommended casual restaurants (Maui taco, Leilani's beachside grill, Aloha mixed plate), they are bad. French fries at Leilani's were the worst I have ever had. Main courese were fair to average and all the side dishes were awful. We went to these places because of the grandchildren. When we go back, we will either eat at the villa or go to the higher end restaurants. Maui is the closest place to paradise I have ever been. Nothing in the continental states can compare. Regardless of where you stay on the island, go as soon as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort, a shame about the rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Marshy1981
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from my honeymoon, we went to Las Vegas then Ohau and then on to Maui for a week of relaxation. We rented a car from enterprise as the drive from the main airport is about an hour. The drive is beautiful, when we were picking up our rental car our bus driver mentioned beach 14 (named beach 14 because it is opposite the mile 14 mark on route 30), as a good spot to go to as it is very calm to swim in the sea and the reef is nearby to look at any sealife. We unfortunately did not have time to do this, but I thought it may be helpful. When we got to Kapalua Resort the sign posts are unclear and we ended up going up and down the main road a few times before we saw the sign for the office. We checked in with a lady who was busy rushing through telling us everything at a million miles per hour, and did not want to listen to any questions we had. I asked if we had an ocean view room and she snapped of course. We asked if my handwritten hotel pass could be put in my married name. I was told that we had booked it over six months ago in my maiden name, so "tough luck" it would be in my maiden name. This I felt was rude, in every hotel we had gone to, the check in staff had at least congratulated us on getting married. She did not care that we were on our honeymoon and made no effort to welcome us. The couple next to us who were checking in at the same time were getting a much warmer reception and that was because they had previously been on the treetop trial. Our travel agent had rung every hotel we were going to, to remind them we were on our honeymoon, this message had either been ignored or they felt in was beneath them to acknowledge this. We got a better reception at the Honolua Store After the check-in staff had made me cry we then went to our villa, we were staying on the ridge. Our Villa was fantastic, we had an amazing view, really spacious villa, de-core was a little dated but this may be due to the people that own the villa rather than the actual resort. The maids come daily, sometimes they bring you new coffee and sometimes they don't. It was hard to determine what time they would come, being on our honeymoon we did not appreciate the two mornings they came at 9am. We tried locking the door and they would ring the bell constantly until you answered. There was no privacy door sign as stated in the handbook. In the handbook it also states that there are computers to use in the Kapalua Resort by concierge, this is part of your room surcharge ( as was the daily coffee), when we asked at reception they said they no longer had the computers and that we could use the Ritz Carlton Business Centre. So we popped down to the Ritz Cartton to use there facilities, as it was out of business hours there was no one to ask. They asked for a pin or you could pay by credit card. As we were being charged for internet access on daily basis we assumed we must have free internet access there, so up to reception we went. Kapalua Resort reception asked if there was a code we needed for the computer, we were told we had to pay. At this point my husband got a little angry as in the handbook and their website is clearly states guests have access to the internet in their villas and at the resort office. The staff member we spoke to said they were fully aware that it still stated this and that yes they should change this. They did offer any e-mails that we needed could be sent to them but we would need to forward them, when asked how exactly we would forward e-mails on to them they replied log on your e-mail account. The wifi in our villa could not be accessed by our i phone, not even when we turned it on and off again. On a positive note towels and sun beds on the beach were a good touch and the guy that ran the beach hut recognized us after day one. For my husbands birthday we went to Merrimans, we used the shuttle, no problems there. The restaurant was fantastic, the service was amazing and the food was melt in the mouth. No need to dress up, but do book as it was rammed when we went. We charged our meal to our room. When check out occurred we checked the charges, noticed the meal was missing we mentioned this to the lady, obviously not listening told us to sign it and then disappeared. We have since had an e-mail from the hotel telling us off and they have charge it to us. Over all if you can avoid coming in to contact with the resort staff then you will have a lovely time, if not I would book the Ritz Carlton, as they seem to have preferential treatmen

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this trip and will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: ASU_Sundevils
Reviews.Content: What - Kapalua Bay VIlla - Gold - Oceanfront Who - me, wife, daughter (age 10) When - April 7-14, 2011 (7 nights) When Alaska Airlines put round-trip fares on sale between San Diego and Maui I jumped at it and grabbed three tickets for a bit over $1,000 including taxes. We had already stayed in Wailea, and had no desire to stay in Ka'anapali, so we chose Kapalua for our visit. We chose the Kapalua Villas because we liked the idea of having some meals in the room while still having access to a luxury hotel (Ritz-Carlton) if that is what we desired. I booked our unit by directly calling the Kapalua Villas. I made the reservation in December 2010 and got what I consider a good rate - $349/night plus taxes and resort fee, which ups the total to $417/night. Checking in - The Kapalua Villas office is located not too far inside the entrance to the Kapalua resort area. The check-in was very fast, the service was very friendly, and we were allowed to check-in even though it was at least two hours prior to check-in time. You are given a nice map of the resort and I recommend picking up a resort trail map when you check-in, too. A small brochure is provided upon which is your villa number and the phone number of the room. The privileges associated with staying in the villas is also described in detail. The $25 resort fee includes the following per the brochure (with my comments): - 24-hour front desk (always available and always friendly) - in-room safe - in-room coffee - self-parking (very close to our front door) - airline boarding pass print kiosk (this no longer exists but they have one you can use at the Ritz) - incoming faxes - high-speed/wireless internet - unlimited local & long-distance calls and calls to ~40 countries (there are several phones in the villa) - day use of Kapalua spa/fitness (i used it every morning; the gym is very nice) - preferred tee times (I don't golf) - preferred golf rates (ditto) - use of 18-hole putting course (fun but not in the best condition; grass could use some work) - use of Ritz-Carlton pool and towels - towels and chairs at Kapalua Bay & DT Fleming beaches (this service does not exist at DT Fleming) - use of the Kapalua tennis garden (we played every day; very nice staff) - charging privileges throughout the resort (very convenient) - on-call shuttle from 6am - 11pm (never used it but saw the shuttle all over the place) - pineapple in the room on check-in (very sweet) - Wall Street Journal (you can get the Honolulu paper at the Ritz) - robes & slippers - turn-down service (they no longer do this) Despite the fact that they need to update the brochure I felt the value was there for these services, although I would prefer if they just raised the room rate by $25/night and included this as a resort amenity. Grounds - Absolutely beautiful; we were extremely happy as we drive to the Bay VIllas, and then drove through the complex. The resort is extremely well-kept as is the Bay Villas complex. We saw landscapers and maintenance personnel all over the place. There are several nice pools in the Bay VIllas and each has a BBQ. I cooked steaks one night and would have liked to see the BBQ work better - these people are paying at least $1,000 a month in HOA fees so they should get BBQs that are in top working order. We had to call maintenance about the one at the pool nearest to us. View - Why come all the way to Hawaii not be oceanfront? The rock formations and beaches fronting our villa were amazing. From our patio it was about a 15 foot walk to the bluff, and then a quick trail down the bluff to some great tidcepools and crashingn waves (though not really good for swimming). A very short walk (2 minutes?) took you to Oneloa Bay, which was super nice to relax and play in the waves. A five minute walk in the other direction took you to Kapalua Bay, which was very nice, more crowded, and had some good snorkeling. Sitting on the patio (we deliberately chose the downstairs unit so we could have a nice open patio) afforded us amazing whale watching - it was like watching the Discovery channel every day. Villa - This is a 'Gold' villa, which means it was remodeled to very high standards. The decor is nice and modern, and fits well with the surroundings. There is one bedroom (nicely furnished) with a king bed (very comfortable), one bathroom (closet is in the bathroom), laundry closet, large living room, small dining area, and fully remodeled kitchen. There are lots of windows, and we kept things wide open all the time to enjoy the view and the breeze. Kitchen - The kitchen is well stocked with utensils, cutlery, dishes, glasses, etc. There is a good dishwasher, very nice cooktop, microwave, refrigerator, etc. We basicall ate breakfast and a very light lunch in the unit every day, and dinner a few nights. We found that we most enjoyed eating on the patio and when we come back we will eat most of our dinners in the unit. Bathroom - Good size with a great shower. The toilet area is separated from the bathroom, and there are two sinks. The bathroom amenities provided at the resort were very good. My wife is usually very critical of lotion provided at a resort but she said this stuff was very good. Cleaning service - We thought this was just OK ... we had to call a couple of times to get towels refreshed and bathroom amenities replaced. The timing of the cleaning varied from one day to the next. I would have liked to see more attention paid to cleaning the wood floors. Per the owner's instructions (and we do this anyway) we kept our shoes off while inside. After a few hours our feet were very dirty. Dining - Pineapple Grill is excellent! Merriman's might just have the best restaurant location in the world. The Honolua general store has good food and great prices. Bottom line - Why would anyone stay at the Ritz when you can stay here? This was a fantastic trip - our best vacation yet to Hawaii (our 6th visit since October 2005).

Reviews.Title: “Worth the drive”
Reviews.Author: sdewitz
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews about Kapalua Villas before going which were mixed and made me a bit hesitant about my choice. I made the right one. First, everyone talked about how rainy and windy this side of the island was in the winter/spring months. Yes, we had a little rain everday in the morning and that was it. Provided us with beautiful rainbows. Then the sun came out. I don't know of many spots on the island that weren't without wind. The breeze made it pleasant and not too hot. I am not sure where everyone was from who complained about those things, but I am from Wisconsin and 83 degrees everyday with a little rain and wind is a phenomenal break from what we're used to! Also read mixed reviews about the rooms. My suggestion there would be to make sure you get a "gold" room. Ours was beautiful and well kept up. We stayed in the golf villas and had a great view of the ocean. Many of the great beaches (Napili for swimming, Kapalua for snorkeling.) were in walking distance and the walking paths are right there too. Snorkel Bob's close by as well. Due to the fact we went during busy season, my only complaint is you have to book activities way in advance and one does not always know what they want to do until you arrive in Maui. We didn't get to go zipining at Kapalua due to that fact and the kids couldn't get into the activity they wanted at theCousteau center. Kapalua is a bit out of the way, but if you want to have a great trip away from the hustle and bustle this is where I'd stay. Also, for those of you with kids, our 8 and 12 year old were just fine without a resort that had an activity center for kids. They would have been happy to spend most of their time on the beach, pool, or on the walking paths. One last thing, if you stay here for the kitchen amenities, which was another big draw for us, make sure you get the store card if you shop at Safeway. Saved us over $160. Couldn't believe others were not using this!

Reviews.Title: “My assay of Kapalua Gold”
Reviews.Author: Missika
Reviews.Content: My review of our latest stay at the Kapalua Villas, with comments from my experience in previous stays to help with past confusing reviews. We most recently stayed in a Ridge Ocean view 1 Br Gold Kapalua Villa and loved it. The view was excellent with white water views, we spent hours just watching whales from our lanai and balcony. The inside was updated with stone and tile, with exceptionally nice bathrooms. The unit was immaculate when we arrived, but we noticed the cleaning crew doesnt return it to that level daily(The Ritz Carlton does for those interested). All the conviences of home are there, its about as good as you can hope for. The Area- Kapalua is the prettiest resort area on the island, with the Villas like a suburb. A shuttle is available for local beaches, Spa, Ritz and restaraunts. Kaanapali'Lahaina is/are an easy drive. Walking trails and the amentities of the ritz as well. The beaches all closeby- Can you ask for more? Kapalua Bay has the best snorkeling Fleming Beach- Big waves Honolua Bay- Seclusion and snorkeling(shuttle does not go there) Ironwoods- tranquil and we could walk to Napili Bay too Outrigger- I have always liked Outrigger, and have stayed at many of their properties in Hawaii. They have always been somewhere from very helpful to minimum fair(they did promise me early checkout then took it back but I forgve them) To answer some previous reviews- Yes, some units are little bit more gold than others. Ours had old screen doors, some poor woodwork and an older couch. We are picky , but it was just minor stuff, mainly it just didnt match all the beautiful updates you see on the website. Every unit Ive seen is at least a 3 star, golds are at least a 4 star Some golds are closer to 5 star, and its up to the indidual owners make that happen

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: streisd
Reviews.Content: What`s not to like! Outstanding stay in a gold 2 bedroom villa. Spacious, beautiful and quiet. The views are out of this world. We used the Kapalua spa on a daily basis, yes the men enjoyed it as much as myself! The pool at the Ritz is exceptional and so is Dt. Fleming beach, just a lovely walk down the path. I would greatly suggest booking directly with Kapalua Villas as our condo was top notch and they even upgraded us from a golf villa to the ridge villas without asking. The gold villas guarantee a standard that is fantastic from the twice daily maid service to the resort shuttle. I will be telling all of our friends to stay here. Location and weather were great too. No worries!

Reviews.Title: “A roll of the Dice”
Reviews.Author: Singlethreaded
Reviews.Content: There is a significant disparity between the resort villas that needs to be addressed. Your stay really depends on the villa that you get, and there are enough reviews reporting back about the wide variety of rooms one might get for the same price/level. The first room my family got had priceless views, but the decor was 20-30 years old, with shag rugs in the bedrooms, and a permeating musty smell. It was a ground floor villa with two bedrooms, and was dank, dark and felt like the basement apartment of a college apartment. The kitchen seemed 20-30 years old as well, and was poorly equipped. Utensils, glasses and all looked years old and really would have been difficult to use, feeling like you were camping at a log cabin on a remote island. Within minutes of arriving in the room on a late night arrival, my son's asthma started acting up which typically gets inflammed with his allergies for dog hair, dust mites, etc. Three of the other four in our party were complaining of respirator issues after the first couple hours and first night. I voiced a complaint with the front desk who indicated that they were fully booked but would look for alternatives. We had to vacate the room and find fresh air, and I spent the rest of the day surfing my iphone for alternative accomodations. Then later on the second day, we were called and told that one villa would open up that afternoon and be available for us to move in. They indicated that it was being used for a photo shoot that day. When we got to the new villa, it couldn't have been more different. While in the same category (Ocean View Gold 2 bedroom) as the previous, and while the view was not "as" priceless as the first villa, every single detail of this villa was top notch. Every fixture in the house from the beach pebble floor of the third bathroom to the palm leaf overhead fan, to every picture on the wall, to the kitchen accessories was brand new. The oven, fridge, and kitchen fixtures were all updated stainless appliances, and every draw of the kitchen was stocked with multiple bottle openners, ice cream scoops, cheese cutters, 5 styles of mug/cups, glasses for any drink imaginable. Each room was furnished with local authentic local artwork, flat screen TV's and surround sound. Both bedrooms were were masters, and a full pull-out queen from the new sectional. I doubt any of the current advertisements show anything as nice as this villa. But when you're paying $600 a night for the villa (actually $450 with the deal I got: buy 4, pay 3), you shouldn't be subject to the vagaries of the owner. Management needs to insure all rooms are upto a standard of decor, age, and cleanliness. While I ended up quite happy with the second villa, I lost a full day surfing the net for alternative accomodations, and quite easily could have found myself in an emergency room with a child with respiratory ailments. After spending thousands on flights from the US east coast, there's just too many complaints about some villas. On other notes, the sharing facilities with the RItz is top notch. The staff at the pools, and especially at the beach are terrific. The food down at the DT Fleming beach was wonderful. Consider shopping at the Honolua store on the resort. Terrific breakfast food, and fair prices, and well equipped for a small market. Prices at the normal grocery stores on Maui are outrageous. You can get basically the same prices at the Honolua store without the hassle. Rather than spending $80-100 for breakfast for a family of 5, grab a bite at Honolua. And the whales...been to Hawaii 4 times before and had never seen a whale. At this time in late February, at any one time you could look out towards Molokai and see a combination of 4 or 5 water spouts or the back/dorsal fin of a whale, and about once per minute one would breach -- all day long for 3 days. On a walk on one of the rock outcroppings down at the beach, a mother and father, and it offspring swam beachward of us and then came out within a 100 m of where we were standing. But given the crap shoot that is villa selection you end up with, I've given an overall of 3, averaging a 1 with the 5. I really could not recommend the Kapalua Villas given the uncertainty in what you would get. I would not go back unless I was guaranteed a certain quality of room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: KDVictoria
Reviews.Content: We booked a Gold suite and stayed in 22T1. It was lovely and updated with a large kitchen, two bathrooms, and a large master loft. The resort grounds are huge with lots of amenities. Kapalua Bay beach is one of the nicest I've ever been to. We had some excellent meals at the Pineapple Grill, and the upside-down pineapple cake is to die for! Housekeeping isn't great; they come in every day to change the towels but don't clean the tub and often don't vacuum. The resort is amazing but a bit far from everything so renting a car is essential.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: wileytc
Reviews.Content: Just got back to reality (home) after a week at Kapalua Ridge Villas. We (5 adults) had a three bedroom (#2023) and can't say enough about the Villa, or the whole property. The home was two stories with two bedrooms up and one down. Two of these should actually be considered masters. Full kitchen and the whole works. Seems nothing was overlooked. The views from both lanais were outstanding, with Molokai in the distance and whales clearly visible. The beaches are a short walk away and very clean. Pools are just a few doors down from this Villa and also very nice. Kapalua as a whole is at the north end of the road from all other resorts so some driving is needed to off site areas, but it's not a problem. The Ritz Carlton is on site also and has a fantastic pool area. I could go on and on but wouldn't have have enough space. The total experience was great and I would not hesitate to stay here again, and would ask for this villa specifically.

Reviews.Title: “very nice facilities”
Reviews.Author: DRT1404
Reviews.Content: All in all, we had a good ten day stay. The view was good, the villa was clean and well kept up, with daily housekeeping and a nightly check. Lots of space. There is a free shuttle which you can call to go to and from the different locations on property. Except for The Pineapple Gill, we were extremely disappointed with the quality of food on property. That includes Honolua Store (which has a kitchen) and Sansei. You also have access to the Ritz-Carlton pool and hotel which is great. We would come back. The Plantation House Restaurant on the Ritz-Carlton property was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for active families”
Reviews.Author: erikglit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at golf villas 20V2, absolutely wonderful. larger unit than expected with great amenities and a wonderful view of the golf course and ocean. Booked a two bedroom, got a three bed that more than meet our needs. The resort is just small enough that a car is not needed to get to the Honolua store, beach, or spa and fitness center, but not so big that walking takes too long. Our entire party, two adults and two teenagers were able leave the car in the parking spot and walked to dining, activities, as well as for general activities. There is a good shuttle to an arboretum, from there is a great hike down, about 6.5 miles and 2 hours (bring water, it can be hot). Views from all over resort are wonderful. Staff at the resort, including the Ritz properties, were wonderful and helpful in all interactions. Dining on site is expensive, and the quality is good to match. We dined at the Pineapple grill one night and had breakfasts at the Honolau store. The site itself is a 15 minute drive to Lahiana and other local night life spots, and is even farther from the Kahalui airport and area. Driving to the Hana region is an all day activity, which detracts from time on the beach. Kanaapali beach is closer, about 10 minutes and a great beach with good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Vio81NY
Reviews.Content: The resort was great on the outside, amenities the same but the rooms horrible, not even a 2 star...see photos attached

Reviews.Title: “Natural beauty, but stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: sdm2663
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Kapalua area yearly for the past 16 years. This area of Maui is tropical and beautiful - we love it. the location of these villas is good if you have a car - beaches are nearby as is hopping and food. BUT... This was our first time staying at the Kapalua Bay Villas. The particular villa we stayed in was unit # 28B2. I had originally booked an 'ocean view' - 'gold' unit because of the floor plan (a 2 bedroom). When we checked in we discovered we had been 'upgraded' to an 'ocean front' 2 bedroom. This unit had a an open floor plan with the master in a loft area open to the living area below - totally inappropriate for a family with teenagers - no privacy and no barriers for light or noise. I called to request a change , but was told 'everything was booked'. i appreciate an upgrade just like the next person, but this was not acceptable and not apples to apples. (by the way, the 'ocean front' view was squeezed between two other units and overlooking a landscaping shed) Here is an impressive list of what was broken, sub standard and services not performed in/for this particular unit: *electronic blinds were broken - we were unable to close them at night. management knew about this prior. *at least 4 other blinds were ripped and horribly stained. *dishwasher was broken - management knew about this, replaced it with another broken one (not nice to have repair men in unit for an afternoon!) *toaster was broken. *loft air conditioner was broken and so loud we couldn't run it. *loft carpet was buckled and stained in multiple areas and carpet was also stained on the stairway. *wireless internet in unit did not work - we used wireless from other nearby units *kitchen faucet leaked at based and flooded counter with every use (we were told "part was on order') *dryer lint filter was broken - cracked and would fit into housing. *kitchen cabinet fronts were very dirty upon arrival - greasy and food debris everywhere *we only received 3 out of 8 days of daily newspaper delivery *the shower in the lower bedroom and in the guest bath could not contain the water spray and were totally soaked everywhere after each shower - my kids had to have multiple towel layers on the floor. (the door leaked in the guest and the bedroom bath was doorless) *furniture was worn, stained and chipped. cabinets gauged, appliances dented and scraped (this is more of a judgement call, but really tired appointments/furnishings) I called management about all the repairs needed, just the dishwasher was addressed directly which resulted in no improvement. i left a long message for the manager at check out, but did not get a return call. i own a high end rental unit in a resort area. i am familiar with the need to keep units up to date and refreshened as needed. this unit is poorly cared for and very very tired. it was far from the advertised 'gold' standard. It was very far and much below our expectations. i would hesitate to recommend the kapalua villas to friends because of this experience -using this is an example of their standard, i would not. As we walked around the property we could see into beautifully furnished and maintained units - these were either private units not in the rental pool or other better maintained units. if anyone decides to rent here, make sure you know exactly what you are getting - ask for unit pictures and floor plans. we will come back to kapalua, but not the 'kapalua villas'. you can get a much better deal for your your money at many other places. at $500+/night - even the ritz hotel down the road would be better deal!! I will soon add supportive photos to this review....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KCRentz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kapalua villas for the beginning of our Maui vacation! WOW what a beautiful place! The condo was amazing with a stunning view of the water. The turn down service every night was a nice touch and the grounds were impeccable! Our villa had a full kitchen and was equipped with everything from glasses to a pasta strainer! The bed was amazingly comfortable and the villa was very clean. Overall an excellent choice for anyone looking for a place to stay in Kapalua, and much more spacious than a hotel room. Choose KV you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent golf vacation”
Reviews.Author: AlmaLee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are avid golfers and we enjoyed our stay at Kapalua tremendously. We initially booked the stay with Costco for a fairway ridge villa and upon check-in got upgraded to an partial-view golf villa 17T8. The unit was on the bay course fairway and in a loft style. I enjoyed the unit as it is perfect for a 2-some but might not be as private if it is more than 2 people. It's hard to tell how different the ridge villa is from the golf villa. I like the fact parking is right next door to us and it was easy to unload our luggage and food we bought from costco. We were told the resort fee covers unlimited international calls and free access to kapalua spa. We went straight to the spa after unpacking. The spa is brand new with jacuzzi pool/steam room/gym/swiming pool. we had a blast just unwinding after a long day. We also enjoyed the restaurants onsite including merriman's and sansei. The golf courses are gorgeous, the only downside is the plantation course is cart path only in preparation for the hyundai cup. The ladies tee is definitely challenging with some long par 3s and blind holes. I didn't play the bay course but my boyfriend said it was relatively easier and harder to lose balls. If you need a caddie, you should request them when booking the tee time. We weren't able to get one as they appeared to be highly in demand. The shuttle service inside the resort is very prompt and I used them many times to get to the spa and golf academy. I left my fleece on the shuttle once and was able to retrieve it after calling in. If you enjoy golf, I would definitely recommend going to Lanai to play the challenge and experience courses. We were able to get a great discount thru Maui Golf and the whole day trip including ferry and 2 rounds of golf came out around $300 per person. We also booked Kannapali Royal tee time thru Maui Golf and got a morning tee time for $160. Our last day, we drove to the crater around 11 am and was glad we didn't do the sunrise as the drive was quite challenging and can be dangerous in the dark. Overall, kapalua is perfect for golfers or people loving outdoor trails and family looking to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach side condos without the hustle and bustle of Kaanapalli”
Reviews.Author: crazymitian
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend the Kapalua Villas because it is located by the coast in the beautiful Kapalua community with the sea, golf courses and a bit secluded compared to the crowded Lahaina or Kaanapalli. You can also get full access to Ritz Carlton located next door without paying Ritz Carlton prices. The condo is pre-loaded with utensils and other needs to give you that cozy atmosphere. The only bummer is the $25 per day resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “This place was everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: gumpster_007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Gold Kapalua - Bay Villas - 29b3 for 9 nights. To us it was perfect. Had a condo with complete kitchen and oceanfront view. Location was great - close to Kapalua beach to the south and more beaches to the North. Best secret was the spa which was barely used - it had exercise room if I ever dreamt of doing that, and a great salt water pool and both dry and steam saunas. Great restaurants on resort which includes the use of pool and amenities at the Ritz Carleton. Not many people there during November and much less crowed than Lahaina (which is 15minutes south by car). Plantation golf course was great (didn't have chance to play Bay Course but it looked great as well). Clubs to rent were better than my own. Only downside is that it rains and is a bit windy in the north west part of Maui. Never rained long and you can plan around the rain or go for ride to south Maui where it doesn't rain as much.

Reviews.Title: “It's an experience...not just a place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: KMGIndy
Reviews.Content: My bride and I stayed here for the 2nd leg of our honeymoon. We were in awe of how amazing our villa was. We stayed in the Bay Villas, ocean front gold 1 br villa, 21 G4. It was beautiful in every way. The view over the bay was outstanding and the villa itself was immaculate and comfortable - the shower was amazing. We drank coffee on the lanai in the morning absorbing the vast views of the surf and Molokai. We then had wine in the evenings as the sun set. It was the perfect location and villa for our honeymoon time on Maui. It was wonderful to have the privacy and seclusion of the villa and yet maintain the access to all of the Ritz Carlton amenities - such as the pool and spa. Kapalua is a long way from the airport and many excursions but it's worth the drive to stay in such a wonderful place. You don't really need to leave Kapalua for anything - the food is incredible at all of the restaurants - Merrimans, Sansei sushi, etc. And the facilities at the Ritz are world class. We will be returning in the future. My only complaint would be the challenge of finding where to check in (in the Activities Center). Signage is not their strongest quality. But this is VERY MINOR in comparison to the stay. WE LOVED IT. We also understand that there is some variance in the quality of villas - we had an incredible villa with no issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure which was greater, the service or the view!!!”
Reviews.Author: bp_thegolfpro
Reviews.Content: We spent the first leg of our honeymoon at the kapalua villas, and we could not have been happier! We were greeted at check in by a delightful woman who informed us we'd been upgraded to a full ocean view gold villa, as opposed to the partial ocean view gold villa we had booked. Obviously this was the perfect way to start a honeymoon. We were put in villa 0124. The view is outstanding. Because you are on "the ridge," you are slightly further from the ocean, however this gives you a full panoramic view. Little details make this place terrific. Access to the ritz Carlton pool, as well as all of the kapalua facilities is great. The full kitchen with ice maker and filtered water seems small, but saves time and money not having to purchase them. The bathrooms are superb. The only thing that wasn't perfect was a reasonably firm mattress, so for a pair of side sleepers they weren't great. But if that's the only thing we didn't love, we considered the place ideal. We are lucky enough to be returning to Kapalua for the third leg of the honeymoon and are staying at the ritz, however, we would be more than happy to be staying at the villa! My only other comments about kapalua is that it is at the farthest point along the lahaina stretch of resorts, so be prepared to drive....a lot. However the grounds are immaculate, and the service has been spectacular, so it's worth the drive. We have travelled to all of the islands now, and if you want any suggestions, feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: teinegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Kapalua Villas. We had a one bedroom gold bay villa, room 22B4. The view was spectacular and the villa totally upgraded with definite "pride of ownership". All the staff were friendly and helpful. Yes, it is a bit windy and that is the only possible drawback. Every morning we had our coffee and breakfast on our lanai. Our view of Molokai, the beach, surf, lava rocks, etc. was magical. We visit the Hawaiian Islands every year and do prefer a condo when staying on a particular island for over four days. We have been to Maui many times over the years but never stayed in Kapalua...it was a great choice. By the way, I hate bugs and upon reading some of the reviews about cockroaches before leaving for Maui, I was a bit concerned. Never saw a bug and because of the breeze, there were no mosquitoes. We booked our reservations with Kavan at Great Hawaii Vacations. I have never used them before and I certainly will use them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity and luxury”
Reviews.Author: TervTraveler
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at Kapalua Gold Villas. We prefer this to the Bay Villas because they are completely sheltered by the strong winds. We checked out other places on the island, like Lahaina, Napili, Wailea, and Upcountry. We were glad we chose Kapalua, particularly the Gold Golf Villa. The amenities were top notch and the manager Jake from Aloha Vacation Villas was very helpful. You get $100 grocery credit upon arrival. The villas has a beautiful panoramic view of the ocean and a large lanai. The pools are clean and has gas grills. You also have access to the pools at the Ritz. The unit had a gorgeous moderen kitchen with a granite counter top. The whole unit was remodeled with tile, carpet, new showers, bathtub, AC and all the luxury of a 4 star hotel. We really enjoy the seclusion of Kapalua and the lush green well manicured majestic palm tree and tine tree line streets. I think this community is way more tastefully planned than Wailea. Besides, Wailea is hotter, a dessert with water artificially funneled from the north to make a green patch. Here is the website for the rental. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip to Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: kaiiak17
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positive things to say about our recent stay in the Kapalua Gold Golf Villas. We stayed in a one bedroom condo which overlooked the golf course and had an oceanview as well. The condo was absolutely beautiful with new stainless steel appliances, updated granite countertops, and hawaiian style furnishings. It was so nice to be able to come back from a long day at the beach and spread out in the condo. While I never considered myself a "condo" person, always staying at hotels, I found it really useful for a family of four. There was plenty of room for our toddler to run around, a great lanai for me to lie out on and read a book, and separate space with two TVs so that my teen and husband didn't have to fight over programming. Our condo was next door to the pool and bbqs, and it was nice to bbq some nights, rather than get dressed up for dinner. Having the free shuttle and being able to use all the amenities at the Ritz Carlton was also a big plus for us. Kapalua is beautiful and not overcrowded like Kaanapali, Kihei, and Wailea. You really feel like you are escaping from it all. Overall, we had a great time and are looking forward to going again, only staying longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: tuskarrock
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous, not knowing what we would get. Last time we stayed at the Ritz Carlton and fell in love with the Kapalua area. I would highly recommend the Kapalua Villas. They were very nice. The rooms were nice, the pools were nice and the location was perfect. It was so nice to have a parking spot right outside the door and a washer/dryer to keep clothes clean.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, luxurious, great amenities, inspiring views, somewhat sterile”
Reviews.Author: winecountrytravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in an enormous, luxurious and very comfortable renovated Gold Bay Villa 2 bedroom unit on two floors with beautiful ocean views. Access to Kapalua resort amenities including the Ritz Carlton Hotel facilities. There are pools scattered throughout the villa complexes that have outdoor BBQ and kitchen areas. We enjoyed our stay, but the property is somewhat sterile and lacking in character. Very, very windy at the villas and the Ritz Carlton, where we used the pool. Loved the proximity to Kapalua Beach, Napili Beach and Lahaina. Great for golfers. As much as we liked our villa and usually stay in 5 star resorts, I might opt for the Napili Kea Beach Resort next time. Try lunch there at the Sea House Restaurant. We loved the West Maui - drove from Kapalua to Kalului - it was gorgeous and gave us a different view of the island. Great snorkeling at Kapalua beach, loved DT Fleming beach and Napili Beach

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Propertys”
Reviews.Author: lopezhollister
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating a 25th wedding anniversary and after our arrival we were immediatly upgraded (at no charge) from a Gold Fairway Villa to an Oceanfront. Gorgeous 2bedroom \2bath villa. We used the Pool and spa at Kapaula Spa as well as the Ritz Carlton. We saw no cockroaches or bugs of any type in our condo which was immaculate. I could not have asked for a more effecient staff they were quick to upgrade us without us asking and help us plan our excursions. The beach outside the condo is a little windy at times but great for sunbathing. the beach near the Ritz is great for snorkeling. I would not change a thing and i am looking forward to our next trip with our family.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Condo in Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: hawaiianhopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very spacious 1 bedroom "gold" fairway view and were upgraded upon arrival--we were put in a partial ocean view "gold." The view was amazing as we were on the top floor. Being "gold" there was granite countertops, new stainless steel appliances, washer dryer, very nice furnishings and decor. We felt very comfortable here! The shuttles were great--they pick you up right outside your villa and take you where ever you want to go on the property--any of the three beaches, the Ritz, or the Bay or Plantation golf courses, Pineapple Grill, Sansei restaurant, etc. We had full-access to the Ritz pools, which was perfect for our children! We scheduled housekeeping to come at 11:00 each day, so that we could put the kids down for naps in the afternoon. That worked out well! There was a $25 daily resort fee, which was a downfall. We heard Kapalua is a little more windy than the Lahiana/Kaanapali area (a 5-10 min drive away), and were a little worried about it prior to our visit, but we were pleasantly surprised! The breeze was great with the hot July weather. Only a few days of inclimate weather, and it passed over pretty quickly. Overall, we would come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Windy side of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Kam2310
Reviews.Content: Lovely Villas Can use 3 beaches The attached hotel is nothing special - small and looks boring compared to this villas Â£25 daily fee for parking and free telephone Maui itself is a very expensive place - don't go to see the crater - waste of time and over 2hours driving Hawaii is not anywhere as exotic as the far east or caribbean Would recommend only to americans as local for them

Reviews.Title: “disorganized and the staff and manager need lessons on customer service”
Reviews.Author: mich021
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation booked on our Vancity Visa card points thru Air Canada Vacations, and stayed at The Kapalua Villas in Maui. We arrived late on the night of the 12th to find the remodeled Ocean View Villa nothing like the Villas advertised on their website. The Villa was built in the 80's with some poorly installed Ikea updates. We had called ahead to make sure that they would provide us with a crib for our 2 year old son to sleep in after his long flight, and were disappointed to find that they had given us a play pen for him. When we called the front desk they told us that "it was late and the people with the crib were on the other side of the compound" so for the first night our son slept with us. Later that night we discovered a 3" dead roach in the hallway and found another in the morning in a kitchen cupboard. The staff took us to look at other Villas, but our seemed to be the best of what we saw, so we decided to stay. Our second day didn't get better, after complaining to the front desk we were assured that we would get a crib delivered in the morning. When we arrived back in our room at 1pm for our son's nap there was no crib, but they had also taken the playpen. The crib showed up an hour later after our son's nap. We also we visited by some hotel staff who were sent to set roach traps around our kitchen, they informed me that the Villas were old and overrun with roaches and were regularly fumigated on a monthly basis. Upon hearing this and the fact that my wife refused to unpack her bags for a fear the roaches I decided to contact the general manager and played phone tag with him for the rest of the day. Our third day started with us heading to the beach to find upon our return a notice from the city that the power to the Villa had been cut off due to the owners not paying their bills. When I finally got face to face with T.J. to discuss this he mentioned that Air Canada had got me a really good rate on the room, implying that we didn't pay a lot for our room and shouldn't be complaining. We were offered a free night credited back to us and no charge for a late check out and were moved to another comparable Villa. Again we were promised that a crib would be set up when we returned from a show that evening. When we returned that night we were locked out because the staff gave us the wrong keys and the crib was not there. Fourty-five minutes later the crib arrived and I had to pull the pins and remove a door so that staff could roll it into our room. when I mentioned this to T.J. the next morning he offered us another 1 night credit. The rest of our trip seemed to go off without a hitch, but our first three days (almost half of our trip) were horrible. on top of all this the hotel charged us a resort fee of $25.00 a day that no one told us about, and is not advertised on their site.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate getaway”
Reviews.Author: Raidaz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a getaway from big crowds, Kapalua and Kapalua Villas is the ultimate paradise. The only complaint I had was the day we arrived there was a huge brush fire that closed the highway going to Kapalua and there was no other way to get there. There is another back road which the staff at Kapalua Villas recommended we stay off (that road was closed off going toward Kapalua anyway, only cars leaving Kapalua was allowed). Management at the time said they would not refund the lost night, but the next day when we checked in they said there would be no charge for the lost night which we thougnt should have been a no brainer. Other than that it was perfect. We have been on numerous island vacations and Kapalua was the best. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: winterpenny
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Kapalua and we absolutely loved it. We rented through Kapalua and as a result, we had access to the Ritz Carlton pool, the new Kapalua Spa, and other amenities. Our condo was clean and had great ocean views. The new Kapalua Spa is awesome. Use of the fitness and locker room facilities was complimentary. There were additional yoga and other fitness classes you could take for a $14/class fee. Kapalua does tend to be more windy/rainy than some of the other resort areas, but it's beauty, cleanliness, etc. makes up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Choose The Right Vacation Rental People”
Reviews.Author: NapiliBeach
Reviews.Content: Kapalua is beautiful, no matter the weather even if it could put a tamper on a particular activity or two. The worst day in Kapalua is better than the best on the main land if you love the views and ocean. I do want to say that a "deal" on a villa at Kapalua should be something (if you have never been there) to be careful about. The villas have been there a long time, and most have been kept to a 5 star standard. Remodels, etc. . The area has not been degraded in any way, and proof of this is the opening of the new Ritz Residences in the heart of the Villas. However, if you can afford a villa at Kapalua, go with a reputable vacation rental company that keeps it's standards high. "Quam Properties" will not keep any Villa in it's rental pool, and there are many, unless the quality remains to the highest of standards. Some of the others are not this way, thus the deals come around.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious-Kapalua Bay Villa-17g4-Perfect for active families”
Reviews.Author: Monument101
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Kapalua and 12 nights in the Kapalua Bay Villa complex in unit 17g4 (a ground unit). It was so easy to book through vrbo straight from the owner, who also has the management company (see listing 107826). This allows for great rates as you book direct. The owner was very responsive and helpful in giving us many ideas of how to spend our time--and graciously allowed for a late checkout as well! The keyless entry is so easy to use! Our kids loved memorizing the code and working it. Nice to not have to worry about lost keys too. Everything was as advertized in the photos and we were thrilled with the space in the condo. For a family of 4, with 2 young children, the murphy bed was perfect for the kids as we could easily pack it away during the day. The condo is very spacious and was STOCKED with everything and anything you could possibly need-beach umbrellas, coolers, picnic supplies-even a sushi roller! We could even print out our boarding passes on the wireless printer and internet worked ALL the time. It was wonderful to have a washer and dryer too! The bedding was high quality as well. There is a good view of the ocean even though it isn't ocean front (saw whales easily from the lanai-there is a back deck as well). The pools were great-the Ritz was nice to use for something different --you can use for free as a Bay Villa guest (ie. hot tub is there and not at the Bay Villas) and the beaches were gorgeous-often with few people on them! There is a great coastal trail nearby as well for walking/running and hiking at Mahana Ridge Trail too (if you like a dirt trail with high grasses with no climax-went almost 9 miles in the grass-minimal views). In terms of location, we were hesitant about where to stay on Maui and are so glad we picked the Kapalua Bay Villas--and this part of the island. The area is much less commercialized, with fewer people. If you like to walk outside your room to new restaurants and shops each night and have many tourists with loud hawaiian shirts on the streets beside you or time share salesmen trying to solicit you, this is NOT your place. If you are, however, looking for a quiet getaway within walking distance to MANY gorgeous beaches (where we saw sea turtles) -ie. DT Flemming -and within very close driving distance to Napilia, Kahana and relatively close to Kaanapali and Lahaina, this is perfect. We enjoyed finding our own deserted beaches at night to watch the sunset from. There are a few restaurants that are excellent that you can walk to as well-ie. Merriman's and Sea House-(great $5 and under "pupu's" before 5pm). Overall, this is a very safe, quiet, well maintained complex! I would definitely stay here again! A couple of highlights... -Running a local 1/2 marathon-Iao Valley to Sea-check it out if you are visiting in March next year!~ http://www.valleytotheseahalfmarathon.com/Valley_to_the_Sea_Half_Mara.php or just visit the Iao Valley State Park-it is off the beaten path and a neat place. -Picking our own pineapples -Driving further north west to see the surfers at Honolua Bay (actually saw a guy long boarding with his dog!), hiking to the blow hole and getting shaved ice at Lorraines -the chocolate covered banana bread ice cream sandwich is better sounding than tasting-(apparently shaved ice is the thing to eat in Maui)-interesting one lane road -The road to Hana--LOVED the Wai'anapanapa's black sand beach and lava caves and red sand beach (harder to find--definitely off the beaten path-off Uakae rd-where it deadends-walk back by the light poles-on the side of the community center. Not an easy path especially barefoot when your flipflop breaks. get some of Gary's coconut milk ice cream (coconut porter made from the beer or avocado pistachio)-YUM-eat it from coconut shells -Watching the surfers on the way back from Hana-Hookipa Beach Park-AMAZING! -Whale watching -Ultimate Whale watch so you are on a zodiac -as they can get closer than the big boats-go at 8:15 so you get a cheaper deal! Or- just watch whales from the beach at the villas -Maui Brewing Company-good vegetarian food/gluten free and good beer of course -Saver's thrift store on Dairy rd by the airport-great stuff! -The views were breathtaking!!!! standing on the rocks outside the Bay Villas takes your breath away. The water is soo many different shades of blue! Do know that: -Kapalua can be windy in the winter!!! If you turn the corner and head South at all it seems to really calm down. It doesn't get near as hot as Lahaina though. -In March we had to either head south or more west to see the sun set fully--you can't watch it set right in front of the complex--at least from the ground units -We love to walk so Kapalua worked well for us as we could walk to so many beaches, the Ritz and so forth. It is a hilly area though so if you do not like to walk, be prepared to drive. If you are a runner, be prepared to have some major aches and pains after running these hills! There isn't much of a shoulder to run on either but if you are brave, go past the Honolua bay to one of the red dirt roads (blocked off) past the surf parking opening and run down the coast back towards the point--completely secluded and breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “nice accomodations but bad service - staff could care less”
Reviews.Author: RMMK
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were very nice inside and out. Our spacious second floor patio looked out over a golf course, and even though I dont play golf, it was nice to walk out there in the mornings and see the quiet greens and hear the various birds singing. There are pools at two or three locations, spaced evenly between each set of villas, that my kids enjoyed immensely. If you look carefully, you can detect small chameleons hiding in the bushes as you walk along the villa walking paths, and anywhere in Maui for that matter. Unfortunately, the front desk clerk could not speak much English - despite the fact Hawaii is in an English speaking country - last time I checked. When I asked her what time the daily newspaper would be arriving, she said something like "it could to be hours..." This at 8 am. They promise a daily newspaper for visitors to their gold villas, but out of the 8 days we paid for, we only saw the newspaper twice - once it came after noon, and once after I complained to the general manager about not getting it the previous day. The other six days - nada. Those hotels in the mainland U.S. which promise a daily newspaper usually have it to your door before you wake up, without fail. Its a small thing to some people but one of those things that you really appreciate and which is an indication of a hotel's overall desire to please. Since I didnt really have to interact with the hotel staff during our stay, I might go back simply because the accomodations were very nice. However, it is not the slam dunk it could be if they only cared about their clients...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TKANDTJ
Reviews.Content: First time we have been to Hawaii and I thoroughly researched accommodations and selected full ocean view for two weeks on the Ridge. The Bay Villas are closer to ocean BUT your view is obstructed by the lower sloping 'ocean front' villas so you are looking at roof tops. The ridge is well above roof tops and has panoramic 180 of the ocean and you can still hear the surf. The whole of Kapalua is an immaculately kept community of well appointed condos - with easy access to 3 beaches and on site Golf Course (Bay) a couple of affordable restaurants and small grocery store. The management is extremely accommodating - you couldn't find nicer people. We came in at 2 am and were shown to our villa by security that happened to be touring around. We were assigned a lower level villa (ask for upper level - better view and more private). There was scaffolding on both sides of our balcony - ongoing maintenance is a mixed blessing â€“ Next day after mentioning this they offered us a beautiful Bay Villa which we checked out but passed on for reasons above. Rather than closing out discussions, Tamara (who is a wonderful hostess) offered us a two bedroom villa - a whole top floor condo for the full two weeks. They supply cleaning products, toiletries, make up your bed every day and supply clean linen every 3 days. Regular spraying to keep out the bugs (they advise you when spraying.) They supply transportation to wherever you want to go (if you havenâ€™t rented a car â€“ or even if you have) You exit the van in the middle of large 14 seater so no pressure or expectation of tip. There is a phone number and they magically appear within 5-10 minutes. I was told by the driver that they would have come pick us up at airport *even at late hours* â€“ something I was told by the reservation desk that they donâ€™t do. So two thumbs up for the accommodations. Here are some tips. Car rental at airport. They close at 11 pm. They ALL have shuttles that take you to the car rental agency. While one of you waits for the luggage â€“ the other should take the shuttle and come back with the car. What they donâ€™t tell you on the phone is that they will stay open until 3 AM if they have to to wait for reservations if plane gets in late. Give them a call let them know youâ€™re coming. We rented a subcompact from Dollar and were upgraded to a convertible for only $200 extra â€“ so instead of paying $2000 for a convertible, we got a steal for $700 for two weeks. I suspect you make these deals at the pickup time â€“ you wonâ€™t get it at booking. Convertible only way to travel in Maui. Get yourself a copy of â€˜Maui Revealedâ€™ â€“(you can order it online Wizard Publications) I wish we would have had this guide when we first started out. It has the usual recommendation of places to eat & shop with history backgrounds etc but has details on locations of attractions not mentioned in the flyers but more importantly details on how to access them - i'm talking about finding a trail past the second telephone pole after the wooden fence details. Visitors mention Costco. Wal Mart, K mart in Kahului but this is NOT practical living in Kapalua (50 minutes drive and very bad traffic) Luhaina has a Safeway for food and WallGreens has the other stuff you need (boogie boards $8 cheaper than everywhere else etc). There is a handy general store in Napili open until 11 pm and another just up the road open until 2 am â€“ avoid Kapuluaâ€™s Honolua Store for food â€“ they do have a popular take out though. The one place we went back to several times to eat was the Aloha Grill on Front Street right on the ocean (straight down from Safeway) â€“ Mai Taiâ€™s $3 in afternoon and a very tasty and well prepared mixed grill (fish,chicken,beef) for about $13. Most restaurants have entries that start at $26 so being able to both eat for under $30 is a bargain in West Maui. Order from the bar menu at the Pineapple Grill â€“ their Asian Skewers are delicious and youâ€™ll get change from a fifty. I tried all the beaches in the area. Almost drowned on all of them â€“ the problem is the slope is very steep into the ocean so the surf (5-6 footers) break close to shore and just before they break have a very strong pull into the ocean . A very dangerous combination when you have no footing below you. I suggest Fleming Beach (a three minute drive from the Villas) - you can wade out quite a way because the beach slope is gentle. The waves break quite a way out and you can safely get a good ride into shore while keeping both feet on the ocean floor. Most importantly there is a lifeguard on duty and he watches for and alerts you to rip tides. See the Blow Hole north of Kupalua â€“ you will see a small handmade sign on side of road about 15 minutes from Villas. Big surfers go to Honolua Bay (10 minutes away) great view from top cliff and breath-taking sunsets. See the Needle in Lao Valley (found that out in my book) on your way to Kahului. Along Road to Hana, the Garden of Eden is well worth the visit â€“ (watch where you park in Paâ€™ia â€“ they have spotters everywhere eager to give you a ticket).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: iliveinchicago
Reviews.Content: We come to Maui every year and have stayed pretty much all over the island and Kapalua Bay Villas was the best place condo we've ever rented. We were in unit 24 which overlooks the pool and ocean and the view was fantastic! Our two-story condo had views from almost everywhere in the unit and just a short walk down from our condo, there's a path that goes along the cliffs and beach. I highly recommend the Bay Villas. If there was a downside it would that Kapalua gets more rain and clouds but that has nothing to do with the condo itself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Langley_BC
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Kapalua Bay Villas was excellent. During check-in, I discovered we had been upgraded from "partial ocean view" to "ocean front" and the villa they gave us was outstanding! We were 6 adults staying in a single unit and the place was spacious with no one running into or over each other. Access to the beach was excellent (just walk down a few stairs). The other beaches and resort facilities were a little more removed, but not nearly the distance in walking that is implied by the maps. Loved our stay and, even though this part of Maui was one I was thinking of avoiding due to previous past experiences with sketchy weather, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just hope you have no issues if you plan to stay here...”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveller39
Reviews.Content: We booked a gold ocean front villa at this resort. I will not bore you will all the details, but will let you know that the villa was NOT ocean front and was NOT clean (some unknown substance dripping from the refrigerator and an odd smell in other areas of the unit). When I brought the issue to the attention of the front desk staff and asked for a solution, I was told that the manager was not in on the weekends and that it would be better to just stay in the unit until Monday..."Perhaps she can move you then." Now, the problem with the front desk staff being really rude about the problem was one thing, but no one around on Saturday or Sunday to help solve a problem seemed ridiculous. So, anyway...we decided to just call the Westin villas and stay there instead. I'm so glad that we did that because the several calls that I made and left messages for the manager and customer service were NEVER returned. I just think that they don't care. I suppose if your unit is fine, you might not encounter such an issue...but that's your gamble with this place. Just FYI...Keep in mind...this is a VERY windy location on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Value”
Reviews.Author: babbilu
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas in August 2009. We've rented VIlla 17B4 through Sullivan Realty. Service from Sullivan was excellent: very prompt, courteous and helpful, they even recommended a babysitter for our kids (6 and 2) and a child gear rental place. Plus their prices were much better than renting through Kapalua office. The villa itself was excellent - very clean and updated, flatscreen tv, free high-speed internet, gorgeous ocean views, all linens and towels included, washer and dryer, fully-stocked kitchen (a huge Plus, as eating out in Maui is not cheap). Even though it is a 1-bedroom villa, it was quite big - over 1200sqf. The villa owners were also very gracious to provide beach chairs, reading materials and even snorkeling gear for their guests (though we brought our own gear). We were 2 minutes walk from Oneloa beach and practically had that entire beach to ourselves. I've read other people's review regarding weather and remoteness of Kapalua: for us both were a plus. Weather in August was excellent, and the rare evening showers were warm and very welcome; we also preferrred to be out of the traditional noisy tourist areas and had a truly relaxing holiday. Had a wonderful dinner at Merriman's, would definitely recommend that place for a special occasion meal. Also had very relaxing cocktail drinks at the RItz Carlton, prices were quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - still itching!!!”
Reviews.Author: natashka5
Reviews.Content: The view from our condo was the best we ever had. The room is fantastic and is very spacious. This is where the pros of this condo end. We had bed bugs. The personnel did nothing to fix it: they did not change the matters and did not move us to another room; they did not even apologize. Also, it ALWAYS rains in Kapalua and is always super windy! So the swimming pool is a formality. Again, view is great, but we wonâ€™t stay there again because of the bed bugs and lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BigGuyGuelph
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at the "Bay" villas, and it was great! The "gold" villas, are spacious, well furnished, with large balconies for those ocean views. 5 star! As food and restaurants are expensive in Maui the villas have full kitchens so you can cook for yourself. Check out HawaiiGolfDeals.com, we booked through them and in addition to being the best deal by far that I could find, there were no surprises! As for Golf, the Plantation Course is a must and the Makena courses are worth the 50 minute drive. Hawaiigolfdeals.com packages made it all affordable

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Bay Condo - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shellhunter98
Reviews.Content: The Kapalua Bay Villas provided an ideal location for our Maui vacation. The condo gave us convenient access to beaches, golf courses and dining. We walked along the coastal trail to 4 different beaches (Kapalua, Oneloa, Napilli and D.T. Fleming), took the shuttle to golf courses (Plantation and Bay courses) and walked to dinner at Sansei, Pineapple Grill and Merrimanâ€™s. Kapalua has an open and natural feel that other resorts on Maui donâ€™t. The 23,000 acre property manages to feel both wild and manicured. Below are some of the best â€œdealsâ€� we experienced on our trip. Snorkeling: We walked to Snorkel Bobâ€™s in Napilli, rented their best gear for a week and used it almost daily in Kapalua Bay. Our 11 year old daughter couldnâ€™t get enough of it. Highlights included turtles and a snow flake moray eel sighting.
