Golf: My husband took advantage of the 5 day unlimited golf package and golfed 7 times for $499. Our daughter participated in the Junior golf program and golfed FREE (including clubs!) after 2:00PM. Food: We bought groceries at Safeway in Lahaina and grilled several meals in one of the outdoor kitchens available at the pools. We also shopped for local produce at the Saturday Swap Meet in Kahului (itâ€™s huge and a great place to buy souvenirs too). Dining: Sansei has 25% off sushi from 5:30-6:00 daily. We got there at 5:00 and waited in line. The Pineapple Grill bar menu is 50% off from 8:00-10:00 on Friday and Saturday nights. A place we would not go to again is Merrimanâ€™s. Very high prices (even by Maui standards) and small portions. My soup was essentially 2 inches of broth in the bottom of an enormous bowl. Our splurge was a fabulous lunch at Mamaâ€™s Fish House. Well worth the drive and $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Gold Villas, Kapalua Bay, Maui”
Reviews.Author: taniosu
Reviews.Content: The most amazing, spacious, luxurious condos. I don't want to stay at hotels after staying in a Gold Villa. Incredible. 5 minute drive to Ritz beach (DT Flemming), short walk down to one of several pools. Washer/dryer in room, new kitchen, two rooms is actually two full suites. Perfection on every level!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: TazG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas for 7 days recently. The complex is very large as it includes the Ritz Carlton Hotel, Ritz Carlton Residences, numerous condo units, at least 3 golf courses, pools, spa and tennis courts. Originally we had booked a gold Ridge unit which overlooks one of the golf courses, gold unit were suppose to have been upgraded with new appliances and interior updating. We were told to ask at check in if we could get an upgrade to an ocean view. When we arrive we were told that we had already been upgrade to the ocean view at no extra cost. The unit we got was ocean view but not a gold level so it did not have the upgrades or updating. That being said the unit was a very large 2 bedroom, 3 bathroom unit over 2 levels and the views were spectacular. Kapalua is in the Northwest section of Maui so a car is required to visit ofther parts of the island. The only negative comment I have was on the last night there a major storm came through, the wind was very strong and the rain was heavy so the lanai on the upper level had some rain water blow in through the bottom of the sliding glass windows. We must have used 6 or more towels mopping up all the water.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: pickyfoodie
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay at Kapalua Villas!! I was afraid of how it'd turn out, because of the reviews online (seems like Gold Villas were the only 'nice' ones). We couldn't book a "Gold" villa because Orbitz offered the best deal ($169/night, free upgrade to ocean-view, and 10% off discount w/ code found online), and they didn't have any "Gold" rooms available. I called Kapalua Villas, expressed my concerns, and they made a note that we wanted a "nice" room. I don't know if the call is what guaranteed our unit, but it was NICE! very clean, neat, nice choice of decor/furnishings, washer/dryer in the unit was awesome (they included some laundry detergent). I love that they also provided a new dishwashing detergent & scrub. They even gave us a maui pineapple! The lanai was awesome - great view, nice place to relax / enjoy a drink. we didn't want to leave our place! The best part was the ability to use the new Kapalua Spa -- the sauna, serene pool, exercise facilities were wonderful. I've never worked out so consistently in my life! The downside of Kapalua area is that it's further from restaurants my husband & I like, and it seems to be cooler/rainier. The next time we visit, we will more likely stay closer to Kihei. However, if we were to stay around Kapalua -- Villas is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families ... big rooms with Ritz-Carlton Access”
Reviews.Author: PoodleRank
Reviews.Content: Our multi-generational family stayed at the Kapalua Villas for five nights in September, Our group included a two and a half year old toddler up to great-grandparents. We booked the Gold two-bedroom, ocean-view villas. We were assigned a room in the Bay Villas section of the property. The room was a two-bedroom, three bath unit, complete with a full kitchen, and a washer-dryer in the unit. We loved our experience, and would not hesitate to return. The room was tastefully furnished and very clean. The kitchen also was very well equipped with great appliances a well as a complete collection of dishes and pots. Furthermore, they provide laundry detergent, dishwasher soap, etc... so you really don't need to worry about anything. Important when you have a small child! It's also great to be able to use the Ritz-Carlton facilities, especially the kiddie pool. Granted, you have to drive there or call the property shuttle service. I think it's important to get the GOLD room, because otherwise you aren't really sure what you are getting. It appears that a lot of the non-gold rooms are not renovated. Pro: - Room furnishings and equipment (especially the washer / dryer) - Access to Ritz-Carlton Con: - No restaurant in walking distance - Kapalua can be a bit of a drive from anywhere

Reviews.Title: “favorite place in maui”
Reviews.Author: 4hondas_9
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui, Hawaii for the 6th time this summer. Stayed at the Kapalua bay villas. It is a condo unit in kapalua bay. the condos are right next to the ritz carlton residences. they are luxury condos. 1,2, and 3 bedroom units. ours was a two bedroom units with 3 bathrooms, 2 bedrooms and a nice kitchen and living room. probably around 1900 sq feet. the gold villas are nicer than the regular villas. they all have stainless steel appliances, have been remodeled and are very luxurious. kapalua can be windy but it is very nice. the bay villas give you access to the ritz carlton hotel which is very nice as well. the pool is a nice place to hang out. the pools at the villas are nice but a bit lonely. most people hang out at the pool at the ritz. they have a shuttle that takes you back and forth. they also have a wonderful new spa that you have access to and it is free to kapalua bay villa guest. for tennis lovers, there is a tennis center that has about 10 courts that you can use for free as well. all very nice and luxurious. I would recommned them.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at Kapalua Villas”
Reviews.Author: giftshopgirl80
Reviews.Content: 1. We travelled with the baby- specifically requested a one level villa, crib and a bath tub because not all units are equipped with a tub. Upon arrival we were placed in a 2 story loft, no crib, no tub- stand up shower only. We specifically called TWICE before arrival to make sure the requests would be fulfilled and were assured they would be. Contacted the reception desk and were moved to a different villa- one level with a tub. OK. One problem solved. 2. We booked a Golf Ocean Front villa which is supposed to be equipped with the top of the line amenities. It was not clean- mildew in the bathroom, dust on the nightstand, dirty windows, no shampoo/conditioner, no dish soap. Very mediocre appliances. No crib (that was requested in advance). When we asked the receoption what happened, the lady informed us that the villa was not ready to move in. ??? Not even a remote control for the DVD and a 20" TV in the living room. Did not live up to our expectations at all. 3. Supposedly, when you book the gold villa, you are entited to a VIP check in. We waited in the reception area for 25 minutes to check in. One person assisting a group of 17 people. 4. Location- very isolated from shops and restaurants. 5. Definitely NOT a family oriented place. And yes, there is still occasional construction going on. 6. One good thing- guests are allowed to use Ritz Carlton facilities. This was a savior. The pool at Ritz was great, and the cabana service outstanding. If you are not travelling with children, stay at Ritz. Overall, pretty disappointing stay at the villas. Next time will try Wailea beach villas. Kapalua villas are NOT worth the money. 3.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: DigTravelMd
Reviews.Content: Paradise!! My husband and I and our parents stayed at an Oceanfront Bay Villa. What a BEAUTIFUL and peaceful resort!! Trails, beaches. As one reviewer said earlier, it is not a city by/at the beach (high buidlings), the villas give you a home feel. And what a serene and peaceful feeling to 'come home' to. The villas has full kitchen (saves money as Maui food is expensive, and give you flexibility), washer/dryer (you can pack light), the 2 bdrm unit had 3 full baths, and spaceous. You have everything you need (dish soap, detergent, paper towel, daily maid service etc) - each bdrm has its own balcony with oceanview. Awesome views. Excellent and courteous customer service. Have use of Ritz Carlton's fitness center. Guests have use of chairs/towels/umbrellas at the resort beaches. The only 'potential' down side is it is at the West end, not as central to other parts of Maui. But we didn't mind the drive (20 min to Lahaine, 15 min to Kaanapali). I much prefer the open, spaceous feeling of the resort to come 'home' to. The resort is just so beautiful everywhere (flowers/trails/beaches) and so peaceful. If we go to Maui again, you bet we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation you can have in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Clint1583
Reviews.Content: Just writing this before we start packing our bags for our return trip home. Another perfect vacation at Kapalua Villas. This is something like our 12th time here, we were able to book our unit for the special $199. a night rate. A GREAT deal. Our unit is 12T5 in the Golf Fairway Villas, a very nice upgraded "Gold" unit. Had a wonderful time using the new fittness center at the Spa along with hanging out at the Ritz pool. Given a choice between a big hotel or Kapalua Villas, we would always pick this place. It's the most relaxing place for a vacation. Looking forward to returning next year! Clint & Patti Mason, Petaluma CA

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous View of the Ocean and the Bay Golf Course”
Reviews.Author: Bustame2752
Reviews.Content: The Condominium's backyard is the 10th Hole of the Bay Course with a View of the ocean in the horizon. Excellent free shuttle service around the Kapalua Resort. The Bay and Plantation Courses are world class with world class service.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua - The Real Hawaii - Most Relaxing Vacatoin EVER!!! (and affordable!)”
Reviews.Author: DRGLEE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at Kapalua and it was great. The resort is amazing, nothing like overcrowded Waikiki where we have stayed previously. This was serene and peaceful, and we had great accommodations. This wasnâ€™t a city next to a beach, this was the real Hawaii! Highly recommended! Kapalua If you donâ€™t want the crowds but still want the luxury and beauty, you will like Kapalua. You can walk everywhere, or take the free shuttle available for guests. Itâ€™s a beautiful Hawaiian resort w/ everything you need. As far as dinning goes Kapalua has super high-end restaurants to cheap take-out. We ate at Marriemans for our romantic dinner, amazing food and the best view of any place we ate on Maui. For a few breakfasts and a lunch and a dinner we took advantage of the super casual Honolu Store. They have good, cheap food and a nice picnic style tables outside, or you can take it home. They have great breakfasts, pancakes and eggs and all that, and great â€œHoboâ€� lunches â€“ you must see to believe â€“ very good. The Honolu Store is where Rachael Ray visited and ate when she came to Kapalua in one of her episodes! We also saw pizzas and hamburgers as well as healthy stuff, so pretty much something for everyone. If you want to do Maui on a budget eat here â€“ and also rent a place with a kitchen! Kapalua also had tons of walking trails which we really dug cuz we love the outdoors. There are coastline trails and mountains trails and everything in between. Really cool. They also have their own zipline courses! Pretty cool if you are into that, we didnâ€™t get around to it but wish we had. And there is a resort shuttle that takes you anywhere in the resort â€“ for free. That was a nice surprise! There are nice golf courses and many tennis courts around Kapalua, but we didnâ€™t do either. We prefer the beach! Beaches The beaches at Kapalua were great, really great. Kapalua beach was the best with really great calm waters, just a super beautiful cove with all sorts of fish. Oneloa beach was super picturesque, like in a romance movie or something and then there was a beach in front of the ritz carlton hotel, donâ€™t know the name, but it was also nice and had a wave break and lifeguard. We mostly went to Kapalua beach which was also great for sunsets! And if you have kids you will want to take them there, itâ€™s a calm protected beach. Accommodations We stayed in a one bedroom, two bathroom Ridge condo with an ocean view, ac and really nice furnishings for $150 a night. We had reserved covered parking right next to our front door. Condo had everything, washer/dryer, 2 TVâ€™s including a plasma, high speed Internet and large kitchen w/ utensils. They stock it w/ lots of towels and sheets before you arrive, only thing is they donâ€™t have maid service, so we had to wash our beach towels, they also stock it w/ soaps and shampoo, but they donâ€™t resupply it during the stay, so you have to bring or buy shampoo if you are staying for a while. We bought some at the store. We picked our condo out on their website, they have really big clear virtual tours of each condo, when we walked in we felt like we had already been there! http://www.kapaluavacations.com/the_ridge.asp There are two pools at the Ridge, very nice and they had gas grills which we used twice. The place was in the middle of the resort, so it was great for walking to the beaches or the coastal trail, and the restaurants, very cool. We rented from ridge realty, very nice family, highly recommended. Their office is right next to Maui Tacos where you can buy huge $5 burritos! So again, if you are doing Maui on a budget, go to Maui Tacos as well as the Honolu Store and as well as cooking in your condo! We did these things and saved a ton over our last trip to Hawaii when we stayed on Oahu in a hotel room which was much smaller, not as nice and cost way more. Oh, and there is a Costco by Kahului Airport, across the street from Crispy Cream, if you really want to save money just buy a weekâ€™s supply of food there on your way and cook meals in your condo. In closing Kapalua is great, highly recommended! This is the real Hawaii! You can relax!

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort on Maui”
Reviews.Author: VStang
Reviews.Content: Me and my 11 family members loved everything about the Kapalua Villas Resort! They offer great customer service, beautiful and luxurious villas, wonderful restaurants, relaxing spa, great golf courses, and awesome beaches! This is definitely the best place to stay in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: henrychen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed this place. The views are pretty amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: SafariGirl28
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my first trip to Maui and absolutely loved staying at the Kapalua Villas. I went with my family so we wanted to get a condo to save on cost and someone recommended the Villas. They are fantastic. We stayed in a 2 bedroom 3 bath condo that was extrememly spacious and very well maintained (we had maid service every day). It felt more like a suite at a hotel rather than a condo. However I must say thank you to whoever wrote a review saying you need to ask for a luxury condo - that's what we did and we couldn't have been happier. And the price was still significantly cheaper than any of the hotels. Since the Villas are part of the Ritz you get every amenity available. We spent our time going between the pool at the Ritz and the various beautiful beaches. Although the Villas are spread out across the large grounds (a downside if you like walking everywhere) they have a shuttle that drops you any where you want to go on the property and we never waited more than 10 minutes for it. The service there was also amazing. The concierge was so helpful - she made dinner reservations for us and booked a great snorkel trip and helicopter ride. The only real downside to Kapalua is that it's far from the rest of the island. It's close to Kaanapali and Lahaina (where we spent most of our evenings) but far from the airport and other popular areas. We had a car so we were fine driving places but if you like to be in a more active, populated area this probably isn't for you. Kapalua is a beautiful, luxurious but quiet area of Maui that is perfect if you want to relax and recharge. I would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Stay”
Reviews.Author: QuietAndColdPlease
Reviews.Content: Assuming that you're prepared to have a self sufficient stay, this will be unforgettable. We stayed in a Gold Villa for 4 nights (with the 4th night free), and got a $100 activity voucher which we used on a kayak tour in Kapalua Bay...which was also incredible. There is a fully functional kitchen with all the tools you need to pretty much make anything you want. Pots, pans, knives, cutting board, blender, coffee maker, toaster, etc. If it's only 2-4 people, I recommend that you do your grocery shopping at the market just down the highway, and skip CostCo. The doors of the lanai literally open up to blue crashing waves just past a small green lawn. The rooms are very clean, and there is a housekeeping service that comes by daily to make the beds and clean the bathrooms. No dishes, but there is a dishwasher though. Pros: Beautiful rooms & landscape, Sensei Sushi is unreal, staff is informed and friendly, free shuttle to anywhere on the property (including the Ritz) is just a phone call away. Community BBQs by pool. Cons: Some villas are privately owned and managed, so if the security alarm starts going off all night long, there is nothing that the staff can do about it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: travelinbug7
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Kapalua Villas. We were a bit apprehensive after reading some of the previous reviews but were very pleasantly surprised with what we found. We had been upgraded to a Gold Villa with an ocean view and it was simply amazing. The villa itself was quite modern and not too "islandy." The kitchen was fully stocked and had granite countertops with stainless steel appliances. In the fridge was a golden pineapple waiting for us on arrival. The bed was comfortable and the sofa bed actually wasn't too bad either. The view everyday was just gorgeous. Housekeeping comes through twice daily and refreshes towels and tidies things up--and leave little goodies in the evenings. There isn't a fitness center but there are plenty of walking trails and easy beach access so you really don't miss it. There's free wi-fi throughout the resort if you need it. The charging system is handy--you can charge to your room from any of the shops/restaurants within the resort, including the Ritz. Guests of the villas also have access to the pool at the Ritz, which is nice. A car is definitely necessary in Maui, but if you don't have one, there is a resort shuttle that can take you around. A MUST try--the Banyan Tree at the Ritz on Wednesday nights--50% off wine bottles! Kapalua is a gem and the villas were a great find...definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Villas: Best Luxury Accommodation on Maui”
Reviews.Author: yamanote
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks in April in an upgraded Gold Villa. This is the our first re-visit to Kapalua for a few years - in the past we were turned off by the inconsistency of the villas. It seemed some owners were cheap, and provided cheap furniture and poor facilities. The Gold Villas are a complete turnaround - everything is lux. Granite counters everywhere, including bathrooms, new furniture, large plasma TV, fully equipped kitchen, and tasteful decor. My fastidious wife was completely satisfied and I think the Gold Villas are now the standard to beat. The message is that if you go to Kapalua get the Gold Villas. It seems Gold Villas are only available directly from Kapalua resort. Other critical reviewers rented from secondary realtors, which means no resort amenities like RC pool, shuttle, etc and they got the groty villas Kapalua Resort has rejected as unsatisfactory-i.e., the cheap owners. We really like the Honalua Store which feels like old Hawaii. We also very much enjoyed watching the sunset from the open deck of Merriman's Restaurant, located on the grounds of the resort, and we highly recommend this! We had no problems with weather - its was great. The free resort-wide wifi was also greatly appreciated-I was able to use my Air Mac at the pool. I am including some pics I took just below my Ridge Villa today. Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JeanAlspaugh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (along with another couple) were really looking forward to staying at this resort. Of the three resorts we stayed at in Hawaii, this was the one I was most disappointed in.... The first villa they put us in was in the middle of a construction area and the "ocean view" we paid for was over the view of a parking lot (mind you, this was one of the most expensive resorts we stayed at). When we asked to move, the did... unfortunately, the construction moved with us! Every day at 7 - 8 am, the equipment was in the street right below us. The ocean view was much better, but I guess I figure for what we paid, they should have gave us a complimentary upgrade to something away from the work zone. The floor plan was very nice -- two bedroom, two baths, kitchen, living room and dining room. The lanai was nice also, but with the trade winds, it was actually too cool to sit on the lanai. Most of the suite was clean, but there were (dead) insects on the window sills in the shower area. As for the resort itself, it's very spread out. I believe I'd have actually preferred staying at the Ritz Carlton on the resort. Without a car, you'd be at the mercy of the shuttle. We went into Lahaina most nights -- Front Street -- very nice, lots of shops, galleries, restaurants and bars. As for the golf... we were not able to play the Bay course as it was under some construction. We did play the Plantation course (Mercedes Benz tournament course) at $240 for an afternoon round. Maybe I was naive (although we had played at Turtle Bay in Oahu and Poipu in Kauai), but this was, well, ridiculous. Forget the winds, which they can't control, but the staff was not at all helpful. More like they were doing you a favor for letting you play their course. Sorry, but the layout was not that spectacular or special.... go to Poipu on Kauai or the Palmer course at Turtle Bay on Oahu. Of course, I can say (I tried) to play Kapalua now. All in all, if I were to go back to Maui, I wouldn't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Service has deteriorated”
Reviews.Author: KippyWLA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Kapalua Villas many times and returned this year for spring break. We were unpleasantly surprised by the poor service we encountered throughout the resort. I understand Kapalua recently laid off hundreds of employees and it has affected both the service levels and attitudes of their remaining workers. We had to wait a long time for a shuttle from the Kapalua airport because when we called for a pick-up we kept getting lost in an answering machine. We had to wait for a long time for our Villa to be cleaned so we could check in, so we went to the little store near the front desk for lunch. The line was long, wait time was long, and the workers were short and rude to customers. The food was not worth waiting for either. All in all a big disappointment because we have always enjoyed prompt friendly service in this place before. We will probably stay elsewhere when we return to Maui next year.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at Kapalua Villas”
Reviews.Author: LillyPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from two weeks of Hawaii where we spent nine days at the Kapalua Ridge Villas. We had a one bedroom, ocean view, upgraded villa. We were both very pleased with the condo. It was very clean, and we had maid service everyday and turndown service at night. Everyone was very helpful and pleasant. There was road construction close to our villa which began on about the third day of our stay. Management called and apologized and offered to move us to a different condo which we declined. The only problem the noise presented to us was that we did not sit on our balcony to have coffee in the mornings. By three or four in the afternoon construction had stopped and we were able to enjoy happy hour outside. Yes, Kapalua is a little off the beaten path but we knew that before we arrived. It is just a short drive to shops and restaurants in Ka'anapali and Lahaina. I will agree that the weather is a little cooler and the wind can be a little stronger at this end of the island, again this was something we already knew before booking. Families with young children might be happier with a different location. As others have the stated the pools are basic but very well kept. I rather enjoyed using the pool at the villa. At any given time there were just a few people at the pool. We did go over to the pool at the Ritz one afternoon which was very nice but probably had a 100 plus people there and lots of kids. There is that option for those who prefer that. We really enjoyed the the Pineapple Grill at Kapalua. I'm sorry some people were not happy with their stay at Kapalua. Vacation is not a time to be disappointed but to have a great time. Kapalua met our expectations and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Ted115
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here and can say with no reservation this is the best place to stay! Impecable service, spotless and as far as the rating systems goes it needs to be a 10 not a 5. If we had any concerns or questions it was responded to immediately. We used a travel agent who told us this is the only place they will book because of the way it is ran. If anyone reads complaints from other reviews read them carefully. Kapalua Villas cannot control the weather. And if people are not happy then consider that nothing in tis world will ever make these type of people satisfied no matter what is done for them. The 150.00 resort credit was nice to! Eating at the cafe had some great food and again impecable staff. As a famous general once said "I shall return!"

Reviews.Title: “Finest Property on Maui”
Reviews.Author: rj01
Reviews.Content: I have been returning to Kapalua for well over 20 years for vacation. I just returned from my annual March vacation at the property. Kapalua is one of the finest properties on the island, as I have seen its master plan unfold over the years. Anyone looking to stay at this property needs to understand the resort's layout. This is truly a residential style property with resort amenities. There is everything from affordable to very high-end condos, moderate to very high-end private homes, a Ritz-Carlton hotel, and soon to be complete a Ritz-Carlton Club timeshare complex (under construction to be completed in Summer 2009-replacing the Bay Hotel which was a gem), and two world class golf courses. Many of us that return regularly are a little unhappy with the whole timeshare concept within the property, as well are may of the "real" owners in Kapalua, but that is how development goes. There are outstanding restaurants and a general store (Honolua) on the property, as well as three spectacular beaches (snorkeling and diving), accessible and smaller quiet pools (except for the Ritz pool which has the hotel crowd and pool-side service), and stunning coastline and mountain trails. This is the complete opposite of travelers looking for hotel complexes in groups like Wailea or Ka'anapali that are sited beach front. Again, do your research as to what you are looking for. The new project is adding a spa to the property for those that are interested. The grounds are stunning and well manicured, the villas range from oceanfront, to oceanview, ridge and golf (fairway) accomodations. As the villas are privately owned as condos, they are available through different real estate groups. You need to do your research and also know how the owner has kept their villa updated and who manages it for them. This makes a world of difference on the interior amenities, quality and cleanliness. The exteriors are all consistent, with the exception of views and location within the property. Once you have stayed on the property, it is much easier to understand, as the overall Kapalua "property" covers 20,000+ acres, some of the finest on Maui. You can rent everything from a one-bedroom villa all the way up to a 10,000+ private home. Again, it is all in what you want for amenities. I have stayed in several units over the years and have my favorites, some are stunning and can be like a home away from home. I prefer the Bay VIllas as I like to be near the water. Others prefer the ridge or golf villas to be nearer the courses. Many villas have been upgraded. but many have not, again at the choice of the villa owner. The Kapalua Villa rentals on property have a generic "gold" standard (recently upgraded) that owners must meet to be in that price range, otherwise if you go with a standard unit, the interior could be original (approx. 25 years old). There are several owners that do not rent, some live on property and several who use other real estate companies off-site as other reviews have stated. The very particular owners with nicer units will do that, but they are also careful on renting to protect their investment, of which I can not say I blame them. I have done both, and have the best results with the off-property agents, as they work for individual owners, where the on-site rental agency puts their condos into a pool, and it is a draw on arrivals as to what unit you get, availability, and the "upgraded" condition of that unit. The property tends to be more on the exclusive side, a little pricey, away from the "touristy" parts of Maui, but well worth the money spent. There are some good deals for Kapalua, just do your homework. There are several smaller shopping areas nearby, a post office, and the main West side town of Lahaina all within 5-15 minutes of the property. Kapalua is the real Hawaii if you want to see the beauty and have a true break from the hustle of everyday life. If you like being in the middle of the tourist craze, Kapalua may not be for you. It is an elegant, beautiful location where at times you almost need not leave the location, unless you want to. The main airport is less than 40 minutes across the island, but well worth the drive along the water as you head up the West coast of Maui, as that is the Leeward side of the island where the sun sets, whales linger and rainbows abide. If a traveler has had a bad villa experience, again I highly recommend doing the research. The reviews I have seen here that are not favorable are clearly units not well maintained and some are more than likely poorly maintained on the interior. For those of us who return regularly, and there are many many of us that do, as I have made friends at Kapalua over the years, it is truly a great vacation destination. If you are looking to stay in a hotel with glamorous lobbies, limited view, fancy room service, lavish pools and a small room with four walls, look elsewhere. If you are looking for accomodations with privacy and quiet, almost like being at home, Kapalua is a true gem. The accomodations work for my taste, but may not for someone else. The villas are decorated and upgraded to the owner's taste, and some of them are truly exquisite, but also hard to get availability for obvious reasons. Just know what you are renting, and who you are renting it through. A couple of good reminders......respect the residents and locals here and they will respect you. If folks are rude, then rude is what you will get back. Things move a little slower and gentler on Maui, and recognizing that goes a long way! Kapalua is 5-star, very provate and one of the nicest locations I have traveled to around the world. Best of luck and enjoy. Aloha and Mahalo! "I am not moving slowly, I am just on Maui time."

Reviews.Title: “What happened to this place?!?”
Reviews.Author: Bystedt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Kapalua Villas a dozen or so times over the last 20 years and I have been going back mainly because the good value on the golf packages. However, on my last visit there - my first one since 2003 - I was deeply disappointed with the experience. The villas themselves are nice enough with nice, if inconsistent, decor. The locations are convenient, although you do need a car (or take the free shuttle bus) to get around the resort. The shopping is also pretty far away. Now, here are the problems: 1. The staff is incompetent and rude. I was defrauded for almost $2000 by the staff at Kapalua due to failure by them to properly acknowledge the return of my rental car. I spent numerous weeks writing emails and making expensive international phonecalls to sort out the mess. After it was all said and done, I got no formal apology, no compensation and no admission of the error from their side. Nice. 2. The room was not cleaned properly. It was dusty and dirty when we came in the cleaning crew only give at very cursory cleaning each time they came in. 3. The old Kapalua Bay Hotel is now gone and there is a big construction site there now. The old hotel with a large open-air foyer was a great focal point for the resort but now it doesn't have the same "cohesion". The Ritz-Carlton hotel is too luxurious and "closed" to make it a good replacement. 4. The prices have gone up considerably and the golf rates for resort guests are outrageous. If you are a Hawaii resident (my friend is) then you pay less than a third of the normal fee. If you are a resort guest you only get a 20% or so discount. Despite the poor economy, they've jacked up the rates even higher in 2009. The Plantation Course green fee is now $298! Considering the amount of money it costs to get there for most people they really need to make their golf rates more reasonable. 5. They closed the third course, The Village Course. This was a great course and a big draw for those of us who used to stay for two weeks and wanted some variety in our golf games. Bottom line is, the only reason to stay here is if you really love the Plantation or the Bay Golf Courses and you can't afford to stay at the Ritz-Carlton (which is very good, btw). I'd love to go back to Kapalua but I'm unlikely to stay at the Kapalua Villas ever again.

Reviews.Title: “has its problem(s)”
Reviews.Author: Zoeycat
Reviews.Content: First, I should preface this review by saying the weather was horrible the entire time we were on Maui. We spent 5 days in Kapalua and 6 days in the Kaanapali area. Weather was cold, rainy and VERY windy. We've been to Maui many times, mostly in the winter and have never experienced this. Kind of puts a damper on the whole trip. We arrived at Kapalua Villas around 11pm... it had been raining since the plane landed. We were taken to our Bay Villa (gold) and settled in. Found several small cockroaches and quickly dispatched them. I've lived in Tucson....these Hawaiian guys are pretty wimpy in comparison. The villa was absolutely gorgeous. Huge windows both in the bedroom upstairs and in the living room -- incredible views. Beautifully decorated, granite kitchen. Problem was, the windows and the lanai faced the bay. We saw humongous waves, surfers and kite-surfers (very cool) -- but we were there to see the whales. No whales in the bay. But then it had been waaay too cold, rainy and windy to spend a lot of time looking. The next night we cooked a Costco pizza, took a couple pieces in to eat while watching TV, came back into the kitchen to get another piece and those little cockroaches had invited all their friends over for pizza. It was truly disgusting. We asked to move, trying not to make a huge thing out of the bugs... Hawaii has bugs, I know that. I'm not phobic about them but the pizza thing was too much even for me. They moved us into another Bay Villa which was also supposedly "gold" but it was nowhere near as nice as the first. We now had a view of the whales (at least we would have if the weather would have cooperated -- its tough to spot them in an ocean of whitecaps), the bedroom lanai overlooked the parking lot, only one bathroom and quite cheaply done, as compared to the first villa. However, not one bug. Kapalua is a beautiful area. The grounds are immaculate. Will be REALLY nice when the construction is done (we didn't hear a peep from them). According to the locals, its usually around 5 degrees cooler up there than in places south, like Lahaina. That could be good in the summer. We'll have to try it again then, and hope the bug problem has been eliminated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: TracyWood1972
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one week stay at Kapalua Village in Maui on December 28th. We rented through www.westmauivacactionproperties.com. We stayed in an ocean front bay villa with fantastic views of the ocean from both our bedroom and living room. We stayed in unit 25-B3 and everything seemed brand new and very clean and we spent plenty of time relaxing and eating on the patio off our bedroom and the patio on the main level. The suite was a one bedroom suite but had two bathrooms and a fold out couch in the living room area. The kitchen has everything you need to cook a great meal; there is also a barbecue at the pool area. There are two flat screen TVs - one in the living room and one in the bedroom(just in case you get bored staring at the ocean? :) - as well as wireless internet. We were very pleased at check out when we realized the phone calls that we had been making back to the mainland were actually free of charge. We enjoyed pools at the villas as well as the pool at the nearby Ritz Carlton (poolside drinks too Yeah!) but the beach was by far the best part of the entire trip, we spent most of our days at KapaluaBay (a five minute walk) and OneloaBay snorkeling and swimming. Very relaxing trip, would recommend to anyone needing to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life and looking for a great value. Also would be a great place for a honeymoon.h

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: dusty1196
Reviews.Content: Nothing negative too say on this at all. When you look at $250-$270 for a large villa like this and compare it to a $350-$400 hotel 'room' to me it ends up being a no-brainer. Large kitchen which served our needs (plus a grill across the sidewalk at the pool). Nice seating area and loft bedroom. Villa had wireless internet but didn't use. Bedroom had LCD TV which was a very nice touch. The only minor faults were that the villas reception desk is sorely understaffed (and possibly undertrained as I had to wait 10-15 minutes for a supervisor to "explain" my information packet which was bad!). Also, didn't replenish toiletries like a hotel would have, but that's a minor thing. A great perk is that when stay at a villa you get free golf club rental and since you have to pay $50 to the airline to carry your own clubs, this is a tremendous perk. Many great activites to be found in the Kapalua area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, peaceful, clean, quiet, and overall perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: ChefNat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Kapalua Villa 19V2 managed by Partners In Paradise (www.mauicondovacation.net)... (we did not rent through the Kapalua Villas rental program) but through Gary directly, which was a great move. He was very attentive in answering questions and helping us with a few things when we arrived. The villa was not new, and had a bit of normal wear, but it was so very peaceful and clean in a wonderful, beautiful, tranquil location. For the price you cannot find better on Maui. Sure there are flash resorts that are brand new, but for 3 times the price! Also, the maintenance people are great... arrived within a few hours to replace the overhead kitchen lights that were pretty dim. I am a chef, and although the kitchen was not a chef's kitchen, I made do really well, which saved us heaps of money over going out. We wish we had stayed around the villa and golfing area and beach within walking distance more, rather than go out and about on the island each day. The best of the island is right there... seriously! We will recommend this to family in the future and if we are able to come back stay right here again. Thank you Gary so much! -The Happy Sanders couple

Reviews.Title: “Just back. What a Paradise We Can Still Afford, thanks to your Tip!”
Reviews.Author: alexcleveland
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Kapalua. Unforgettable time swimming, diving, peaceful, ocean views and great beauty at a great price! Last year we had stayed in Kapalua and loved it . We stayed in the Villa Program in a Gold Upgrade one bedroom at the Bay . Great views but we thought it was way too expensive. WE JUST RETURNED FROM KAPALAU this week end and stayed at Kapalua again but in the Ridge Villas, just above & no bugs. Same paradise, great views but Also great price!. We had searched this out after reviews here on the TripAdvisor and booked through Ridge Realty (kapaluavacations.com) instead of the Villas Program. Excellent advice! Thank you Trip Advisor. We had a great view facing northwest , Two levels -two lanais, ocean views-all things and more. We did need so much furniture and marble tops as in the Gold program -not worth the extra $250 a night to us. This year our unit had fine new furniture, no marble or heavy dark furniture, well stocked kitchen , nice new bedspreads, new couch etc and fully loaded with amenities and the same gorgeous, drop dead ocean views for half the price!- we even had a telescope facing the ocean and lots of mirrors all around the bedroom so that ocean was 360degrees. We were a little concerned before we got there about the difference in cost between the two rent organizations The Villa and The Ridge- that we would not get something nice, but boy were we pleased!. It turned out great. Our unit was perfect and half the price of last year!!! We had a slight problem with a faucet and the management (Bill) who lives in one of the neighboring Villas was there in a flash. Couldn't have had better servicing. We have booked the same unit for next year as well as another one for daughter and her husband and children. We can still offer this to our children because of the price differential. Two for the price of one. Nice to still be able to afford to offer this vacation site to our CAlifornia based children & grandchildren. The prices were truly amazing and now thanks to the tip at Tripadvisor we can live like we did before the credit crunch! So nice to know we can all come back . I just put a picture of the view from the living room as my screen saver.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: alohasam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay @ the Kapalua golf villas. only down side, the trip was too short. stayed @ unit 20 V1. great 1 br.unit with a very up graded kitchen. worked :) :) the Kapalua LPGA Classic for 3 days and were just off the 10th fairway. most definetlly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Saw A Bug”
Reviews.Author: primo51
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Bay Villas while on a business trip. After reading the reviews I was a little apprehensive, especially the part about the cockroaches. I couldn't have been more pleased. The condo was clean, spacious, comfortable, and quiet.....and I never saw a bug in the three days I was there. The view of the ocean was spectacular, and I enjoyed relaxing on the lanai watching the palm trees sway in the breeze. The staff was extremely courteous and the shuttle drivers were all very personable and helpful. I would definitely return with my family and friends, and I would certainly recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Good Stay At All”
Reviews.Author: yellowplumeria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kapalua Gold Villa's. It's the first time we rented a villa and were kind of nervous about it. We are definitely hotel people, but thought we would give it a try. The villa was very nice and updated. We had an oceanfront unit. They said they had daily housekeeping for the gold units, so I was happy about that. As soon as we walked into the villa we noticed it had a moldy, musty smell. I have allergies, but thought once the windows were opened up it would be fine. It didn't go away, so we called for maintenance to come and change the AC filter. He came, took the filter, said he would be right back and never showed up again. The AC also didn't work well in the bedroom. It was so stuffy in there and smelled bad. I had such a headache and was so stuffed up that I couldn't wait until we left there. That's no way to feel in paradise. The next day housekeeping came, pulled the covers up on the bed, left new towels and emptied the trash. She then took a dirty rag and wiped the table and the counters down with it. That grossed me out. The table was all smeared and filmy. I asked if she could get us some windex or the like and she said she would drop someoff for us. We never saw it. The floor was so sticky from the salt spray that I had to wear my slippah's. My feet turned black because the floors were dirty. We know they don't wash the floors in between guests because we found a ring from a coffee cup on the floor in the water closet. It had the coffee stain stuck to the floor. I guess a previous guest like to drink coffee while taking care of business. The housekeepers were in and out in less than ten minutes. The commode was never cleaned and the sinks wern't wiped out. The floors wern't vacuumed either because my husband spilled some powder on the rug and it was still there when we left five days later. The livingroom rug was all stained and we found two baby cockroaches in the bathroom sink. People always say, but it's the tropics and you will have cockroaches. I have never had a cockroach in any other place I have stayed at on the islands, so that doesn't hold water as far as I am concerned. Where there's baby cockroaches, theres a mama not far behind and perhaps a few hundred siblings too! We saw the exterminator spraying a unit a few doors down from us that they were rehabing, so I know that they have them there. I don't know if they do regular spraying, but perhaps they should start. Oh I lied, we did have a huge cockroach once at the Hyatt Kauai. This was eight years ago on our first trip to the islands. I had never seen a cockroach before, so when we checked in there I went out on the lanai to see our view. It was nightime so I couldn't see so well. I saw this huge bug on the ceiling of the lanai and showed my husband the cute, big bug. I must have left the lanai door open and the big, cute bug got in and was crawling on my husban's neck at 2:00AM. We called security and the security man told us it was a cockroach. I was beside myself but got over it. I had let him in by accident. He wasn't already in there like at the Bay Villa's. I went out and bought some cleaning supplies and cleaned it myself. I do have to say that the view was breathtaking, but it was so windy that we couldn't sit out on the lanai much. We sat out on another small lanai off the bedroom that faced the parking lot. If you need lots of space, have a large family, don't mind cleaning the villa yourself and like crawly critters then this may be the place for you. It's too bad that the houskeeping was so bad because they used high end cabinets, granite conters and top of the line appliances in these gold villa's. They should take care of them better for the money put into them.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Villa Paradise”
Reviews.Author: nwlywed13
Reviews.Content: Our trip to this location was wonderful! We were a little scared because this location was booked for my new husband and I for our honeymoon by my parents. We hadn't heard of these Villas before, so we weren't sure what we were getting ourselves into! When we arrived, check in was courteous and very prompt! We even recieved a free upgrade for our honeymoon with a full ocean view. The villa was spacious and clean...airconditioning worked perfectly! We had a privacy notice hung on our door for most of the trip, but the house keeping staff called daily just to check and see if there was anything that we might need...just incase. The grounds were very well kept, it was beautiful! The three beaches on the grounds were relaxing; only downfall was that you had to drive to get to each one of them. For $18 a day extra, you have full access to the Ritz Carlton right next door; pool, restaurants, spas, etc.. One thing that I guess was a LITTLE bit of a nuisance... though the Kapalua Villas are in a pretty quiet and uncrowded area, it would have been nice not to be about 15-20 minutes away from the majority of restaurants and shopping in Ka'anapali and Lahaina. Other than that, it was perfect! We will be returning! :)

Reviews.Title: “Bay Villa Unit 15B4 Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: convert94
Reviews.Content: Two of us spent 9 nights in KBV's Unit # 15B4. This is a one bedroom. Tile floors, huge bathroom with two separate wash basins and giant shower. Living Room room has sectional that converts to bed for two more. Other amentities in this gorgeous condo are: CalKing TempurPedic mattress 2 HDTV's (LRoom/Bedroom) Cable with hundreds of channels Free Local & nationwide phone calls Wire and wireless internet w/router DVD Player All kitchen supplies/utensils. Mr. Coffee Blender George Foreman Grill Granite countertops Cube/water in-door SS fridge New elec range, microwave Diswasher Disposal Dining room seating for 6 Two leather recliners (Breathtaking views, see pics) Table, 4 chairs on deck Community pool steps away. Secluded, undiscovered 1,600 foot beach 10 minutes away Parking is right outside the entrance of the condo or in the parking lot directly below it by the pool which is right outside and down a few steps. The beach is very difficult to access for the general public but only a less than 10 minute walk from the unit thru the property. The condo is very tastefully decorated in Island style with lots of pictures, artwork on walls and island themed furniture throughout. We loved the condo, the views and the close proximity to pool and beach. We cooked breakfast and lunch and went out to very casual places for dinner. This condo is beautiful and in a perfect location among the Bay Villa's. We highly recommend it and found it through Quam Properties on their web site. It was $269 a night and worth every cent. Kapalua Bay Villas are in a very prestigeous and exclusive enclave. Not a hotel/condo but individually owned and not all rented out. Extremely quiet and off the beaten path. Ten miles to Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time! Heaven”
Reviews.Author: hankDarianConn
Reviews.Content: We just came back from first trip to Kapalua- All We Hoped For ! I had read the reviews on the TripAdvisor Website and was interested in what Tricia had written regarding her experience staying through the Ridge Realty(www.kapaluaVacationms.com) as opposed to staying with the Kapalua Villa Program. We researched and booked thru Ridge Realty and stayed in a unit right next door to a villa run by the Villa Program. We paid $200 less a night with the same views, but not daily maid service. We had a great unit -I asked at booking to have the unit townhouse (upstairs and downstairs with two lanais and a telescope). It was great and it also had a special wonderful fully mirrored bedroom! Super for anyone-parents or honeymooners!. I never wanted to leave the bedroom with its expansive views of the ocean. Close enough to see and hear the waves lapping the shore. We faced north and saw and heard no constuction. It was ideal. This was a great vacation and not so expensive. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Romantic Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: MaisieNewYork
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Oahu (see separate review) and Maui for my birthday. This was my first visit to Maui and after debating Kapalua vs. Wailea, were were pleased we stayed in Kapalua. Again, after debating hotel vs. villa, we were impressed with our choice of the Kapalua Villas. First let me say that I was sure I wanted to stay at the Four Seasons Wailea. But my boyfriend is an incurable romantic and insisted on Kapalua. I certainly am happy that I listened to him. Wailea reminded me of an upscale suburban vacation community transplanted onto the beach in anywhere, USA. Walking down the path along the beach, you can turn up into any of the resorts lining it--sort of like wandering into different hotels on the Vegas strip. And the beach is so crowded--but not in a Waikiki way, with international tourists and surfers. I don't know really how to describe it more accurately except to say that it surely didn't feel like the secluded tropical paradise you think of when you imagine Maui. But Kapalua was its own quiet, verdant enclave of pines and a golf course with the Ritz Carlton at the far end on DT Fleming beach (a beautiful state beach park) and the Kapalua villas lining the hills and the bay. We had an ocean view 'gold' villa. I must admit I was a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews here. However, it was all for naught. Our villa was private and beautiful, with marble floors, a brand new kitchen, and a palatial marble bathroom. We both gasped when we walked in the door--we had floor to ceiling views of the ocean. Every morning as we ate breakfast on our lanai, we watched whales frolic in the ocean right in front of us! The other bonus staying here was that we had use of the Ritz Carleton pool. Although the villas have their own dedicated pools (one per complex), they are small and rather isolated--nothing to write home about. We never used our pool, preferring to relax at the Ritz and enjoy poolside service. Then at the end of a daily we'd return to the privacy of our very own beach home! Finally, the service at the villa was like that of a hotel--twice daily, with turndown service and bottled water at night. They even augmented the laundry detergent suplly daily. I feel bad for the people who posted complaints about cockroaches and old, dirty villas. That couldn't have been further from our experience! It was nearly perfect. My only complaint is that every day on the way down to our villa, we drove past active construction sites which reminded you--paradise is being continuously tucked into and developed. We would definitely stay in a Kapalua gold villa again over any of the other resorts in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Romance & Relaxation in Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: BireRider56
Reviews.Content: We had the best relaxing and romantic vacation ever. Originally planned for mid-winter we had to put it off until summer, but the wait was worth it. We were very happy with our villa and Kapalua. The villa was totally remodeled, both baths had granite/marble and the kitchen was equally stunning and had what looked like new high end appliances. We never used the kitchen to make dinner, too many great places to eat out. As for the bathrooms, the guest bathroom had a shower with multiple water jets in the sides and the master had a large bathtub, good for relaxing after a long day of enjoying Maui. The villa had two lanais, one off the bedroom which overlooked a garden and another looking out towards the ocean. We have stayed in villas in Oahu and The Big Island and The Ridge was our best experience. The landscaping is lush tropical, there are very few people and it is very quiet. We had neighbors on one side but never heard a thing. There were also two very nice pools at the Ridge. The Kapalua area is the high end of Maui, once you turn into Kapalua you can tell you are in Kapalua, we would never go anywhere else now. Kapalua is very green and all the landscaping is highly manicured. Kapalua has incredible walking trails, both in the resort and above the resort in the mountains. What was nice is we had beaches and mountain trails and amazing restaurants, all in one place. I uploaded photos and a video of our villa. It was #924 at The Ridge and we rented through Ridge Rentals (great people!). We paid $200 a night and with their summer special we got our 7th night free. If you want romance and relaxation go to Kapalua!

Reviews.Title: “Bay Villas Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BGTwinson
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four who just returned from a stay in the Bay Villas at the Kapalua Villas. We rented a two-bedroom ocean view villa through the hotel web site (Kapalua.com). To cut to the chase right away, I was expecting, as per the web site description "Sweeping ocean views of the beautiful Pacific Ocean..." from our villa. Instead, we had sweeping views of other condos and an extremely limited peek view of the ocean from the dining nook of our ground level unit. I was so shocked by the lack of view that I called the front desk to say we must have been put in a partial ocean view unit by mistake. The manager indicated the Bay Villas are their "top of the line units" and yes we did indeed have an ocean view unit. I asked to be moved to a unit with an unobstructed ocean view and he said all two-bedroom units were booked and we couldn't be moved. So, this was one big disappointment. As for the unit itself, it was very spacious with two-bedrooms and three bathrooms. But, it was an outdated, luxury wanna-be accomodation. The dresser in the kid's room was completely unusable with drawers that tilted precariously and threatened to fall on bare feet if used - the slides were partially broken and there were no drawer stops. Two of the three sink stoppers did not work. The kitchen knives were low quality and some basic knives - like a bread knife - were missing. There was no cutting board to slice fruit or cut bread for sandwiches. The bath towels were small. Although I must say that the two main bathrooms themselves were beautiful with the showers in a large tiled area surrounded by wood. The closet in one of the bathrooms had folding doors that kinked the wrong way and were difficult to open. Good things about the unit included a washer and dryer with soap, full kitchen with dishwasher and soap, air conditioning (although it was too loud to use during the night), lots of closet space, and plenty of room to spread out. Overall, the area is beautiful although it was quite windy every day we were there. The kids swam at the D.T. Fleming beach and Kapalua Bay and preferred Kapalua Bay for the clearer water that was good for snorkeling. The Ritz pool was available to us (there is an $18/day resort charge) and the kids enjoyed that also although it is difficult to find a chair out of the sun unless you rent one with a shade. We took a shuttle to the Maunalei Arboretum Trail and enjoyed the walk so much that our group was motivated to hike all the way back to the resort (about 6 miles). I recommend doing this in the morning while the day is cool. We had lunch at the Honolua Store which has a great selection of breakfast and lunch items that I recommend highly - you order at a counter and eat at tables outside. For general info, there is a Safeway in Lahaina to stock up on groceries and a Costco near the airport where someone in our group said they stop at to get snorkeling gear. The kids really enjoyed the stay but I would be extremely hesitant to return to the Kapalua Villas. Maybe it works better if you book a Gold Villa - another family in our group booked a Gold ocean view unit and had a wonderful view and a more luxury feel. At a minimum, maybe you should always specify a top floor unit to at least have a fighting chance of getting a view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect View of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl5555
Reviews.Content: We rented unit 30 B-1 of the Bay Villas through vrbo.com and just got back to reality after a week in paradise. This unit was an oceanfront 1BR unit on the 2nd floor and had the most incredible view. Even though this unit was on the 2nd floor, it was level to the parking lot, so we didn't have to drag anything up and down a flight of stairs. After reading other reviews,weI was very nervous about renting here, but we were able to see many pictures of the actual unit we would be staying in at vrbo.com. The unit was being managed by a property management company and we got fresh towels and linens once during our one week stay. The property management company was a pleasure to deal with, met us at the unit and even helped us with printing out boarding passes. The unit was clean with an updated kitchen , new carpet in the living room, new flat screen TV and an enormous bathroom. Everything was working and in tip top shape. Our child slept in the sleeper sofa overlooking the ocean every day. One concern we had when renting was the ongoing construction. We never heard any construction, even though it was quite close. The construction did prevent walking access to Kapalua Bay Beach, but they have a nice public lot to access that beach nearby. We could access Oneola beach fairly easily (a walk down a path). The reason we loved this location was that it was close to Lahaina, yet it was quiet and peaceful. If you're looking for a spot to party all night, perhaps Kapalua isn't for you. This location was a bit windy, but it was really welcome on those 90 degree days when it was unbearable in Lahaina. The property was beautifully landscaped and maintained. We had 2 pools nearby and one pool had recent extensive renovations which included a grill. This unit is for sale on the Market. We must be a Mega Millions ticket to buy this incredible place. The view was worth every penny. The only thing we regret was leaving!

Reviews.Title: “Ridge Condos - Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: ILStockman
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all those who have written reviews here. Based on reviews we rented a 2 bedroom 3 bathroom condo at Kapalua in the Ridge complex with Ridge Realty Rentals. The location could not have been better! We had a very great wide ocean view. We could see the islands of Molokai and Lanai and the sunset. FYI it was villa 2614. We ate on our lanai most nights and watched the sunset while the kids played in the grass, it was amazing. We paid $375. The villa was surprisingly large, much larger than it looked online. The three bathrooms and the kitchen had not been remodeled but were high quality and much nicer than a remodeled condo we once stayed in at Kaanapali five years ago. The furnishings in the bedrooms and the living room looked new, and were very nice. (check out the pictures). All the kitchen appliances were new, which was great because we are a family (six people including our kidâ€™s friends) and we cooked almost every night. For $375 I think we got a great place. We met a honeymoon couple at the pool that paid over $400 for a 1 bedroom gold condo with the Kapalua Villa Program. They could not believe what we paid. The service was also great. The Ridge people were very nice and helpful. The condo had air conditioning, but we didnâ€™t use it. We are environmentalists and we donâ€™t like to waste energy, plus you donâ€™t need air conditioning in Kapalua. The weather in Kapalua is the best in all of Maui. There was a constant trade wind breeze that kept us cool. The villa was also close to the Ridge pool, which was nice for the kids. If you have kids I recommend Kapalua, another great thing for kids is the free shuttle. You just call it and it comes to your condo and takes you anywhere in Kapalua at no cost. Our kids and their friends used it a couple times to get lunch at a place called the Honuloa Store. The food is cheap there (compared to the rest of Maui, ha!) and really good. I recommend the Honuloa Store too. FYI everything is expensive in Maui so stop at Costco next to the airport when you first get there and stock upâ€¦ especially if you have kids! I hope this review helps others as reviews on here really helped our family to have the best vacation we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Week at Kapalua!”
Reviews.Author: BillU
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent 8 night spent at the Kapalua Villas. On Memorial Day, we checked in to our Golf Villa, which was perfectly located on the property. We had a partial ocean view off our lanai, which saw the Island of Lanai in addition to the ocean, the Bay Course golf course, and several of the Golf Villas. The architecture of the buildings on site are either quaint (churches, stores, little schoolhouse) or easily blended into environment - no garish high-rises here, like down in Kaanapali. We were struck with awe in looking at all the Cook Pines on the property. They really define the resort better than any other landscape element here. We were greeted at check-in with a nice glass of pineapple juice and a thorough description of services provided. We were provided with covered parking near our villa, and when we unlocked the door and walked in, we were quite revlieved with what we saw. Our two-bedroom Gold Villa was well-appointed with granite countertops in the kitchen and bathrooms. Appliances, fixtures, furniture and carpeting met the level of luxury expected from the room rate, and all were clean and relatively new. The Honolua Store on property has everything you may need, though perhaps a bit expensive. Costco or Safeway elsewhere on the island will be better for your staples, but the Honolua Store is an excellent option for forgotten items, or delicious prepared foods. The Kapalua Activity Center (and Logo Store) also is a nice place for breakfast or lunch. The concierges there were more than happy to arrange our sunset catamaran sail, ziplining, and horseback riding. One amenity that was well worth the $18/day resort fee (which also covered wireless internet in the villa, parking, and a few other things) was the access to the pool and charging priveleges at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. The pool and pool service there are second only to the Four Seasons Hualalai on the Big Island. I also enjoyed several of the restaurants, including Sansei for sushi (and Karaoke on weekend nights), Pineapple Grill, and Plantation (at the Plantation Golf Course Clubhouse). O yes, the golfing is outstanding also! Two courses, one hosts a PGA event, and the other hosts an LPGA event. I wholeheartedly recommend the Kapalua Villas for anyone considering going to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Always Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: patgil
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Kapalua -we were delighted with our stay in the Ridge villas (booked through Ridge Realty).. After reading some of the reviews here, we were concerned but as always it was really great despite the construction at Kapalua Bay. We had asked Ridge Realty (office in Naplil) for a unit that was two levels assuring us of terraces overlooking the ocean from our bedroom and our living room and also facing northwest away from Kapalua Bay. We had a super view looking north west to Dt Fleming and Honoloau. It was quiet and our unit was really fine. The bedroom had a mirror above the bed so you could almost view the ocean 360 degrees! Wow you could see and hear the waves lap the shore. Also sunrise was spectacular from the bed -beautiful pinks and violets! The furniture was absolutely fine, with some nice items & touches by the owners - We were delighted and also delighted with the price. It was $200 a night. Why anyone would stay at the Ritz at $360 or more for one room and no ocean view escapes us. We used all the facilities, including the shuttle when we did not use our car. . There was a minor problem and because the Rdige Realty group lives right there in in one of the units it was fixed immediately! Couldn't ask for more, especially in these times of escalating costs! glad to know that paradise is still in our reach and will be in the future. Why would anyone go elsewhere and pay so much more for the same or less!

Reviews.Title: “VERY windy- Nice unit - Older grounds”
Reviews.Author: MrsSandman
Reviews.Content: We recently rented a super upgraded unit The Ridge at Kapalua Villas. The inside of the unit was recently redone- nicely. However, we felt that the Villas themselves are very out-dated. Basically the unit is updated but the bones of the villas are very old. The pool is horrible- basically a square with old chairs and a BBQ grill. Not very updated- very basic. For the price you pay, we suggest another- newer condo. The one thing to keep in mind is that this area of the island is ALWAYS windy. That was very disappointing to us. There is little point in sitting on the deck due to the wind. Maui in general is very "touristy". The restaurant at Kapalua called Sansei - sushi and service is GREAT!!!! We were very unhappy with all meals until we at here. It is so good. Mama's Fish House is good food but not worth the price at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good over Bad”
Reviews.Author: BillfromPhila
Reviews.Content: The Bad We just returned from staying in Kapalua and wish to share the good, bad and ugly. We had a three bedroom Golf Gold Villa which was an outstanding unit. Problem, the A/c did not work even though the maintenance person told us otherwise. After 2 days, we where give a two separate units for an even to sleep in until the unit could be fixed (we where told Sat or Sunday by maint) Sunday morning the Villa manager informed us that we would not have to wait until Monday. Explain that would not be acceptable, the manger took us on a tour of several units (Bay View) until we found something suitable. Even though we had to take two separate units (1 1 Bedroom and 1-2 bedroom close to each other) it was not a Gold unit, but I guest the view was to make up the difference. The staff was outstanding to try and help us, but since we had planned on a 3 bedroom, anything beyond that wound is a disappointment. The Good We did have some great meals in the units. We hired an outstanding Chef that made meals that in the end would have cost us over $2,000 if we had eaten out. Add in meals at the Pineapple Restaurant, Sea House, The Ritz and you get the picture of Outstanding or the good part. The ugly........ Nothing found nor were we looking for anything in this category. I will be posting picture shortly and if anyone wants information about the Chef, please let me know. If you can fly into Maui direct from the mainland that would be my suggestion. If you fly into Honolulu and then plan to fly onto Kapalua, try flying into West Maui Airport, rental cars are near buy and its less of a hassle driving across the island. Traffic can be a real challenge. Over all, we had a great time, but we will do somethingâ€™s a little differently next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding Location EVER”
Reviews.Author: carnalicia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Kapalua Villas, where we and our guests stayed for our wedding on 4/28. My wife and I were in Bay Villa 23 G1 for 6 nights and were VERY reluctant to leave. So many positives, and very few negatives. I'll try to separate out my comments by category: Villa: Our 1BR/1 1/2 BATH villa was very well-appointed, modern, and spacious. Overall, solid 4-star accommodations. We had a great view of the ocean and enjoyed the sound of the waves lulling us to sleep each night. The bed was fairly soft and comfortable. The master bath featured a stone tub with shower. As others have mentioned, it is quite important to do research and request specific units when booking this property, as the standard villas vary considerably from one another. On the other hand, the Gold-level villas are all very nice and feature premium appliances/furniture/cabinetry/fixtures. However, our guests stayed in both Gold and standard villas and were very satisfied. As an additional note, some villas are only available directly through the owner. Prices through that channel may be lower than through the Villas office. Although renting from the owner means that the resort amenities (housekeeping, shuttle, Ritz access) are not included, these may or may not be worth an extra 50-100 per day for some. Amenities: Housekeeping- Extremely discreet, quiet, and flexible. We kept irregular hours, and they were still able to get the job done without approaching us repeatedly. They basically do light work only (make bed, take out garbage, run dishwasher). Shuttle- Variable, but generally good service. They typically arrived within 0-15 min of our target pickup time, which was perfectly adequate most days (we used our rental car on wedding day to be safe). They will take you anywhere on the property, and drivers are generally polite and accommodating. On one occasion, I was asked to "please wait outside" by the operator when I called for a shuttle, which I thought was rather rude. On every other occasion, the driver gave a knock on our door when he arrived. Resort Priviliges- All residents of the Villas can access the pool and have charging priviliges at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. Since we had our wedding ceremony at the Ritz, these extras came in handy for some of our friends and family. The Ritz pool is very nice. Check-In/Out: Efficient and pleasant front desk staff. One charge was inaccurate on our bill, but was quickly remedied. The error was understandable, since approximately 20 people were staying at the resort who had the same first name, last name, or both! Location: We like the natural beauty and stunning views offered at this resort. In contrast, the resort "complex" of Kaanapali to the south seemed more crowded and artificial when we visited friends staying there. From our oceanfront villa, it was a 2-minute walk to a small but pretty beach and rock pools. Two other larger beaches were accessible via shuttle. Kapalua is about an hour from the airport and 20-30 min from Lahaina. We highly recommend this resort as a wedding site (see also our review of the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua coming soon). Please feel free to contact us with any questions not answered in this long (sorry!) review.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mdsdevon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Maui after staying at the Kapalua Ridge for 6 days. It is hard to understand why some reviewers state that this place is dated??? Our condo was rented through Ridge Realty and was more than we expected. The view was to die for and the condo itself was just beautiful. There was nothing missed with this condo. The upstairs view from the bed was beautiful. The bathrooms were beyond clean and not dated at all. Again the owners thought of everything. The kitchen had top of the line appliances and the furnishings were beautiful. I would recommend this resort to anyone who wants to get away from it all. We would go to Lahaina at night to eat and it was always great to get back to the peace and quiet of Kapalua. Yes, there was construction going on but to be honest I never noticed it and our view was not obstructed by it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family vacation”
Reviews.Author: kona
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Kapalua Villas April 2nd. Stayed two weeks in The Ridge and rented direct through Ridge Realty. This was a family trip with 15 people so we rented three 2 bedroom condos. Each one in a different part of the resort. Everyone was very happy with the resort, the location and the views. This was our second time in the Kapalua Villas and it is still terrific. The RItz still allows use of the pool, even though half has been converted to condos, and the Fleming Beach is just as good as always. Kapalua Bay Beach is still easily accessbile and the construction going on for the new Residences at the Ritz (former Kapalua Bay Hotel location) is not obtrusive at all. One of our three condos overlooked the construction site and it was a great view, great unit and no noise. Anyone that would complain about the noise is being completely unreasonable. This is still the best condo complex in Maui in our opinion. We also stayed in Wailea/Makena on the same trip and still prefer Kapalua over all other areas on the island. I welcome questions if you are about to go there or in the process of planning a trip. Kapalua is one of our favorite places to go and our kids and extended family all feel the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Boring and dated!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Richardson
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and 2 teenagers, 17&15) stayed here for a week in March. What a boring place!!! The unit was so dated it was unbelievable. Blue carpet, sunshine ceiling, no fan over the range.....and a beige microwave with a dial, all screemed 70's. And the bugs.....big as my thumb.....so at least they were easy to catch and dispose of. The units come in three different levels. V level being the top floor, T level being the middle floor and P level is the ground floor that is almost like going into a grotto although it walks out onto the course. You can't get any air flow going at night (I hate leaving the air conditioner on) because the one evening I left the windo open to get some fresh air, the people in the unit beside ours (that shares our grotto-like stairway out) stared right into our bedroom as they were leaving. Even being right on the golf course was boring and we only saw 3 groups of golfers on it the full week we were there. The pools were nice but small. And there are signs up all over the place...no motorcycles, no mopeds, no skateboards, no rollerblades. They really don't want teenagers. Everyone we met at the pool was a senior. The beaches were better, but you have to drive to them. And then if you go to Honolua Beach, where the snorkeling is good, there is no parking as the other hotels/condos park there overnight. So you have to park way back at the tennis courts and hike over. Or you go off to DT Fleming Beach which has great huge waves, terriffic for boogie boarding, the wind is wicked, so you have to sit on everything you own so it doesn't blow away. But lunch at the Ritz-Carlton Beachhouse was great, terrific atmosphere right there on the beach, but they charge $12.00 for dacquiris or $9.00 for fruit smoothies with every dish on the menu between $14 - 18. Lunch was a little expensive for 4. We have always stayed in Kihei in our 20 years of going to Maui. We landed up in Kapalua as FunSun Vacations had a last minute disagreement with the condo we normally stay at. So they offerred us Kapalua and we tried it for a new adventure. Never again. You have to drive everywhere. Nothing is close enough to walk to. And no Lapperts Ice Cream!!! Back to Kihei next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CharlesM1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kapalua Villas with my parents and my friend in April of 2007. This review comes a year too late, but I was thinking about my amazing vacation and I realized I owe it to future travelers to share my experience, just as those before me had done.
