This website is very helpful in getting real life reviews. I loved Maui and being in the Kapalua area. It is close to Lahaina (about 1/2 hour drive, if that) and lots of great surf and snorkel spots. The villas are located in the Kapalua resort area, which also includes a Ritz Carlton hotel, to which we had pool facility privileges (fancy) (though the pool by our villa was nice,simple and convenient). We truly spent most of our time at the gorgeous on site beach, which is even nicer than the one @ the Ritz. I am under the impression that the villas are individually owned. I believe this is why some people had great experiences and others did not. I believe there are four different villa complexes: Ocean Front, Ocean View, Ridge, and Fairway. The Ocean Front Villas are as there name implies, ocean front. Behind them are the Ocean View Villas (keep in mind, it is on a hill, so although the Ocean View Villas are behind the Ocean Front Villas, they are also above.) Above and behind those are the Ridge villas. The Fairway villas are on the golf course. I don't think they have ocean views, but are great for golfers. We lucked out and had an amazing villa, I believe at the Ocean View Villas (Email me and I will TRY to find the exact unit #, it was a year ago). We were downstairs in a two unit villa. It was very quiet and relaxing. We had a great view of the water. The decor was up to date (very Tommy Bahama) and extremely clean. We had a modern kitchen with all the usual appliances. The beds were very comfortable. Both bedrooms had private bathrooms. Very luxe! I highly recommend the Kapalua Villas, but I also recommend being very thorough about knowing exactly what your unit will be. I believe this can make a huge difference. Also when we were there, construction was going on. It was not near us (I THINK it was the Ridge villas), so we didn't care, but beware and make sure not to get a villa near there, unless the construction is done. DO YOUR RESEARCH!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSchnitzel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days in February, in an Ocean view villa. The first one they gave us didn't have the right amount of beds so they gave us a cot until they were able to put us somewhere else the next day. The second villa was nice, the view was amazing, but slightly obstructed by all the construction going on in front of it. The best part was sitting out on the deck and watching the whales jump. It seemed at any given time between sun up and sun down there was a whale somewhere between us and the horizon. it was amazing. the restaurants on the resport were very good but VERY pricey. You're better off going to Lahaina for a good meal, cute town too. The beaches and pool at Kapalu were very nice as well. The only real downside was how far it was from everything else, made even worse by the daily traffic jams. Yes, hawaii has traffic problems, i was shocked.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the villas”
Reviews.Author: DBalke
Reviews.Content: Was at the villas in Sept. I have been to Maui many times, usually staying at resorts. I booked through Ridge realty and got a super-upgraded 1 bedroom condo for 250.00 per night, which I was able to see and select beforehand. I was completely satisfied. It was immaculate with a great kitchen,flat screen T.V., and was wonderfully furnished with a nice ocean view. Upon arrival I called the rental agent and they met me at the clubhouse, led us to the condo,showed us around and made sure we were comfortable and happy with everything. Totally top notch all the way around. I would not hesitate to go back again or recommend it to my friends or relatives.

Reviews.Title: “We had 3 nights of misery here at Kapalua Villas in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Vacationeerhere
Reviews.Content: Hello , We booked a 6 night stay at the Kapalua Villas. We stayed in condo room 22T8. The first night was okay because the condo owners upstairs were not at home. The view was very nice. I was sick and had to stay in. The condo above us was being renovated it seemed . The noise was horrible.That night the condo owners came back and the noise upstairs above us was like a elephant stomping back and forth accross the floor pacing it seeemed almost constantly with no consideration or repect for the vacationeers { us } below. This guy paced al night long and our vacation was turning into a nightmare. We called security and they came out the next day and talked with one of the owners. The lady admitted her husband was on a conferance call and was pacing all night. The security guy told us. The next night it seemed was retaliation night for us vacatineers. The guy was banging , pacing , slamming the toilet seat down at 3 o clock in the morning. We got no sleep. I called the security again and they did nothing. We later found out through the talking with the condo homeowners management that the homeowners had the right to make as miuch noise as they wish. We contacted the Kapalua Villa vacation manager and told her what the other condo homeowners association manager had said. A Mr Bill Green. She said she would look into it and finally moved us to another unit which was alot better . We requested a credit for 2 nights vacation we were having here with no sleep for 3 nights. We have not seen the outcome yet. I do not recommend anyone to stay at these Kapalua Villas , at least in room 22T8. We were exhausted from moving again with no sleep. This homeowner above us went out of his way to makes us feel very un-wanted there. Bill Green the homeowner association manager told us basically the owners have all the rights and can stay up as long as they want and he admitted the flooring was like a bass drum above us when people walked. Horrible for us as we found out. We will never return again to Kapalua Villas. Buy the way the two restarants food was way over priced and mc Donalds would have been a better choice comparing ythe quality of the food. Kapalua has little to offer us then maybe a golf course and we don't golf.

Reviews.Title: “One miserable night”
Reviews.Author: BosRedSx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our honeymoon through a travel agent requesting a budget friendly, nice honeymoon location. Having been to Maui before I was really looking forward to having a great time there. We arrived to Kapalua villas and checked in. We were staying in the Golf Villas. Our villa was villa #11. From the outside the "villa" looks like anyone's condominium home. On the inside it was horrible. The one bedroom, one floor villa looked like it hadn't been updated since 1975. The furnishings were old and stained. The kitchen was worn and the bathrooms were hideous. On one bright side, the surroundings outside were beautiful, the golf course and the ocean and island of Molokai could all be seen from the lanai. Kapalua villas gives you the right to use any of the facilities at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. However, the hotel was a very far walk and I can usually walk anywhere. Apparently there is some kind of shuttle service. The beaches were not within walking distance either. All of the restaurants in this area are extremely expensive. We didn't even want to attempt to cook on the stove in the kitchen we had. It looked dangerous. Upon checking out the next morning, the desk people asked if we enjoyed our stay. My husband told them all of our complaints and they were unapologetic and not nice. We booked a new hotel in Wailea, the Marriott. We checked in there and proceeded to have the best honeymoon we could have asked for. In short, if you are looking for a romantic time in Maui, stay in Wailea. The weather is consistently beautiful here, it's convenient and close to all the major activities and sights, and there are some very affordable hotels and properties here that would satisfy everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront Bay Villa - wow!”
Reviews.Author: water7996
Reviews.Content: We rented one of the oceanfront Kapalua Bay Villas through VRBO, contacted the owner (a real estate agent in Kona) directly and she mailed us the key. We were a bit nervous because you get what you get when you do this; if we didn't like the place we couldn't just go to the front desk and request a different condo. Plus we got a really good rate ($299/nite for min 5 nites) - if you rent through the local agencies there, you will pay at least $100 more per nite. But we were pleasantly surprised, the place was great. Beautiful view of crashing surf and Molokai, a short walk to a small, somewhat private beach (Ironwood?) and about a six minute walk to beautiful Kapalua Bay, IMO the best beach on Maui. The Bay Villas are showing their age, but you can't beat the million dollar view. Our condo had been somewhat updated with newer furniture and appliances, but the tile was old, there were some ants and mold, and there was no A/C. This area of Kapalua seems to be windy all the time, but just a few minutes south at Kapalua Bay it was calm and much warmer. The whole Kapalua area is under construction and that was kind of annoying, lots of traffic delays, noise and construction debris...it was hard to find our way to the beach because the path goes right in front of what used to be the Kapalua Bay Hotel. Hawaii is all about these new time-share condos now and it looks like that is what they are building here. Too bad - the old hotel was a classic. I'd stay here again, though. Love the view, the weather, the beaches up north. Great local food at Honolua General Store.

Reviews.Title: “Construction and age”
Reviews.Author: DPEC
Reviews.Content: The straight facts: I am here right now Ridge Villa ocean view 1BR Sunday morning Beeping from Ritz construction trucks Trucks passing on road below unit from 7:30AM... The construction noise is a problem even though we specifically requested a unit away from the site of the new Ritz property. We hear the beeping from our bed. No quiet breakfast on the lanai without trucks rumbling by. I had to ask my son to repeat himself the other day because a truck went by and that's all we could hear. Also, it's worth noting that the construction site is on the north end of Kapalua Bay Beach. You can watch the work being done as you relax on the beach. You can see the giant cranes looming over everything. And best of all, you can hear the trucks beeping and backing up while you snorkel. That's a real bummer. The unit itself is way past its prime for this price of rental--we rent properties regularly in varied locations around the country and world. This place needs much updating. Primarily in the kitchen. In fact, only two burners (old electric range) work. We are Kapalua beach fans, and we would be fine here, regardless of updating issues, but the construction noise is a real issue. On a Sunday morning, no less. The price is too high. Should be $250-$300 per night. Book your resort restaurant reservations very early.

Reviews.Title: “Best Thanksgiving ever!”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover89
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in unit 30B 3,4 which is an ocean front gold bay villa. The unit was totally remodeled a couple of years ago and the veiws are amazing. Because this unit is so close to the water you feel like you are on a ship on the ocean. Muddeling through the construction was a big of a drag but once you are at the condo you do not hear or see any construction at all. All you see is the beautiful blue ocean! Every unit is individually owned so the decor varies. This unit is beautiful and also very very private. Will be back next year and will request this unit again!!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad...”
Reviews.Author: Kricket07
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending Thanksgiving at the Kapalua Villas. We stayed in a Gold Villa ( 23 G2) Ocean Front. The Villa was very nice. Nicely furnished, beautiful huge bathroom, nice kitchen with all the stuff we needed to cook. We had a beautiful view and were close to the pool. The pool was pretty cold, however, so we didnt swim a whole lot. The service here is lacking. For a property that calls itself the "Pinnacle of Luxury" we were disappointed. Our phone didnt work and the maintenance guy came twice but never actually fixed it. When I called the concierge said she'd call me back and I never heard from her again. Essentially, once you check in you are on your own with the exception of the towel service. For what we paid ( over 500/night) we were expecting more from this place. Also, with all the construction going on it was difficult to get around. We have small children and from the bay villas you couldn't walk anywhere with a stroller because of the construction. Sansei restaurant is excellent. The plantation house has beautiful views and nice food as well. I think if the Ritz hadn't been closed for remodeling we would have had a better experience, because we could have had their restaurants and amenities. I would not return until the construction is completed. If you have never been, keep in mind that Kapalua is the windy and rainiest part of Maui. We drove south the Kaanapali for better weather.If you are looking to get away from everything, this is a good spot, because there really isn't anything around here. But if you are looking for a more luxurious experience, or more action at your doorstep, I would suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo and property, but beware of rain & construction”
Reviews.Author: TeamJK
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Kapalua Villas in early October 2007; we have a 2 year old son, and we are 5 months pregnant. We booked the condo for three reasons - 1) proximity to Kapalua Bay; 2) we wanted a quiet place to stay and 3) we like the convenience of a condo for the space and the kitchen. Of the three reasons, two worked out - the quiet area and the very nice condo. However, it rained a number of days in Kapalua and we weren't able to snorkel in the bay most days, so we wound up driving down to Kaanapali Beach often, where it was always sunny. Had the weather held up, we probably would have spent a lot of time at Kapalua Bay, it's a great beach. The condo itself was nice, great views and roomy, with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was great, but the shower itself was a bit awkward. So most of our showers were taken in the second bathroom, that had a regular, very nice shower. It was very quiet, which we enjoyed. Note the kitchen had a slight mildew smell. It was a Bay villa. The location is about a 20 minute drive from Lahaina, and about 10 minutes from Kaanapali. We like Kaanapali a little better (and have spent much time there before), as there is a nice walkway along the beach, there's a lot of shops and restaurants, and Black Rock is our favorite place to beach & snorkel. It's a little more touristy, but I have to say it's quite pleasant and convenient. However, depending on your preferences, you might like Kapalua if you don't want to go anywhere else; it's beautiful and quiet. Keep in mind the Ritz is closed for construction, and that limits the number of close dining choices. One other thing to note - the property gave us the opportunity to pick from three villas, and we picked one away from the construction going on near the beach, which was a good choice. There's plenty of villas where you can't see any of it, so just be sure to pick one of those. Stuff to do - we highly recommend Kimo's in Lahaina, the luau at the Hyatt was very nice if you like that sort of thing (pay the extra for the VIP tix), and if you do the road to Hana, take a tour bus - it's worth it. We will definitely return to Maui, but we'll probably wind up staying at a condo on Kaanapali for the location & convenience, such as The Whaler, where we've stayed before and enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: portlanddecorator
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhâ€¦ Maui was nice! I hope this report helps people as reports on here helped us. After many hours on the Internet researching we decided to rent at the ridge in Kapalua with Ridge Realty. Primary reasons were we could see the villa we were going to be in on their website (however, they did tell us it was possible, but unlikely we would be moved in the case of something breaking, someone starting a remodel next door or other major things) and they were much cheaper then renting from Kapalua Villas. The villa number was 1722 and it was $250 a night. It was what they call an ocean view upgraded. The villa was amazing. It had a high up panoramic ocean view. We could see all the way up the coast to Honolua Bay (where we took a great snorkeling trip). There was absolutely no noise from the construction of the new hotel. Donâ€™t even worry about construction noise if you stay at the Ridge. One thing we really liked about Kapalua is how lush and manicured it is, all of it, especially the Ridge grounds. The landscaping is really upper class stuff you would expect to see in Beverly Hills or something. Another cool thing, there was an actual coconut tree outside our condo with coconuts on it that you could just reach up and pick (we didnâ€™t, but could have it was so short) and one condo over there was a banana tree with bananas that were almost ripe, it was so neat! The condo had a remodeled kitchen and one of the bathrooms had been remodeled, also the furniture was really nice and there was the biggest plasma tv I had ever seen in my life. There was also broadband Internet in the condo. The best part was waking up every morning to the great view. I took a picture from the bed but it is really much better in person. Again, the villa number was 1722 at the Ridge. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “great trip to kapalua-september”
Reviews.Author: Tricia1351
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and just spent 10 days at Kapalua Villas. It was great. This was our first time and we stayed on the Ridge. After reading in the forum on TripAdvisor we contacted Ridge Realty instead of going to the Villas since they were the same . We had a unit with a telescope and it was amazing . Two floors direct on the ocean view. Lots of helpful hints from the private owners of the unit as well as beach stuff for us to use. It was great. We did talk with the people two units down from us who were with the Villas program and they were paying more than $200 more a night . Great to save the difference and use it on all the activities in Maui as well as those restaurants. With the difference we figured we could eat at Roys and other great spots as well as sign up for a dive certification course! Can't wait to go back next year. We already booked the trip. They were so nice at the Ridge REalty group they asked only for a modest deposit unlike the snobby reaction we got when we stopped in at the Villas Registration office

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: longing4maui
Reviews.Content: Aloha, My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Kapalua Villas #22-G4 which is an ocean front gold villa. The villa was absolutely gorgeous with a great location. The folks at the Reception Center were very helpful even a week before our scheduled arrival, had a welcome basket on our dining room table for our anniversary and a picture frame as a gift for my birthday. This extra touch was courtesy of an extremely nice lady by the name of Darice, the reservations manager. The villas and the grounds are well maintained and housekeeping came by every day to see if we needed anything which was unexpected after reading other reviews on this site. We had 2 swimming pools within a 2 minute walk from our villa, the beach was 2 villas down, and Kapalua Bay was just a short distance away. This was our first trip to Maui and we couldn't have asked for a better vacation. We both agree that it takes first place among all of our other vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in a Kapalua Gold Villa!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous078
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay in one of the 2br/2ba Fairway Gold Villas at Kapalua and we couldn't have asked for anything better!!! Given the mixed reviews on this site, I was honestly a bit nervous about the quality of our villa prior to arrival. However, all my concerns immediatly disappeared as soon as I entered the unit and saw the beautifully renovated, very spacious space. Our unit was tastefully decorated in an "island" motif, and the furniture (couches, beds, tables, etc.) was not only beautiful, but comfortable as well. Both of the bathrooms had been recently upgraded (the master bathroom housed a very large shower with one of those waterfall-type shower heads, while the other bathroom had a deep marble tub) and the kitchen looked brand new and came with shiny appliances (coffee maker, toaster, blender, fridge, oven & range, microwave etc). Another great thing about the kitchen was that it was equipped with all the utensils, flatware, glasswear and silverwear one would ever need (and more). We were on the ground floor (which, I actually prefer to the second floor) so you could walk straight from our lanai onto the beautiful fairway of the Bay Golf Course's 10th hole. Other highlights: a washer/dryer in the unit, flat screen televisions in the living room and both bedrooms, free high speed internet access, and twice-daily housekeeping service and towel replenishment. If you're the type of person who wants to be in the middle of the action and nightlife of Maui, then Kapalua probably isn't the place for you since, unlike say Kaanapaali, there isn't much to do around Kapalua other than relax. But if quiet and peaceful is what you're looking for, then I highly recommend staying here. Note on construction: We did see quite a bit of construction going on at the resort, but it's all pretty much concentrated in one area near the water. I don't know what it's like in the Bay Villas or Ridge Villas, but from our unit, you could neither see nor hear any of the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss if not a Gold Villa”
Reviews.Author: myvicisslow
Reviews.Content: After reading rave reviews of this place, I didn't hesitate to request a unit here with my travel agent. We didn't book the Gold Villas but the reviews I looked over for the regular villas were also good. However, upon arriving at our unit 27-12 in the Ridge Villas, my wife and I were extremely disappointed. The first thing that we noticed was the obstructed oceanview. Half of our view from the living room was the construction. The next thing were the amenities. This place looked like it was stuck in the 70's. I complained to the front desk about our obstructed view but the only other unit available was right next door with similar amenities... wonderful. We decided not to let this ruin our day and went along with our day. When we returned at night to shower and sleep we found more displeasing things. The curtain in the bedroom doesn't cover the entire sliding door. This means no complete privacy and we were on the ground floor. The shower and countertops in the masterbath weren't clean either. I found some hair on the sink counter. The towels they provided also had small stains and one of their beach towels had leaves on it. It's like the maid dropped it on the floor outdoors, patted it off, and placed it in the closet. Despite this, we still stayed the night here because we were just too tired to deal with it. The next morning, I awoke with a dead bug on my back. Then we found multiple dead bugs around the villa. At that point, I was willing to fork out the extra money for a Gold Villa. Unfortunately, none were available. The only available unit was not a Gold Villa but an oceanfront unit. Despite our expressed displeasure with our unit, they still wanted us to pay the difference for the oceanfront if we wanted it. We decided to check it out because we thought it couldn't have been worse. We weren't wrong but that unit wasn't any better. The only thing going for it was the oceanfront. The construction was very close although not visible from that unit. No wonder this unit was available! It had the same feel to it and also looked like it was stuckin the 70's. At this point we were approaching check out time and we needed a new home. Our travel agent was able to find availability at the Wailea Marriott and we booked it. The best decision I made while at Maui. The Kapalua Villas only charged us for the night we stayed there plus the service charge. They offered no other compensation because their policy was a 2 night minimum and we were "fortunate" that they waived it for us... Our travel agent was also extremely displeased as they are listed as a 4 1/2 star accommodation. I guess if we booked the Gold Villas it may have been a different story. But accommodations in the same development should not differ that dramatically. I will say that the Ridge Villa section was very quiet for the one day we were there. The Honolua Store is conveniently located across from the Reception Center. Napili Bay is also just a short drive away and it's a great beach. It's also a short drive to Kaanapali and Lahaina. These were the original reasons I decided to stay here to begin with. It's unfortunate things didn't work out.

Reviews.Title: “We go back every year”
Reviews.Author: walkdaearth
Reviews.Content: A bit of a delayed review... My family goes back to Maui nearly every year, and each time we return to Kapalua Villas. The location is peaceful and gorgeous, away from the noise and crowds of Lahaina and Kaanapali. If you enjoy golf, this is your place, but even if you don't, the grounds are greener and more spacious because of the golf courses all around. The individual condo units do vary a lot in quality and decor, so ask to check out the place when you get there. Don't be afraid to ask to switch if something is really wrong. We once checked into a 2 bedroom unit which was infested with ants, rundown...I even found a small roach by the patio door and then a gigantic one inside my bedspread (which nearly caused me to have a coronary event). Once we alerted the property managers, they switched us to a beautiful, clean 2 bedroom with dizzying views. So keep in mind that no two units are alike here, as each is individually owned by private individuals. The pool areas, barbeques, access to Ritz Carlton facilities and Kapalua Bay beaches are what make this an excellent vacation experience (better than staying at hotels). It gives you the flexibility of going out to Napili Market and getting groceries and drinks, etc. when you have grown tired of eating out. Likewise, it is nice to be able to do a load of laundry during your vacation. Be sure to eat at least one meal at Sansei! (for us it is more likely to be two or three). Snorkeling at Kapalua Bay is usually excellent (better than you might even see at more advertised areas, because the shallow warm waters are almost a nursery for fish, eels, etc.) You are likely to see a bigger variety of fish there in that little bay than even some trips to Molokini. When you want the pampering of the hotel experience (umbrella drinks while lounging on the beach or by the pool), just head over to the Ritz Carlton, where Kapalua Villa residents have guest privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views!”
Reviews.Author: poohneller
Reviews.Content: My extended family just returned from a two week trip which included a five night stay at Kapalua in Maui. The villas are absolutely gorgeous, with breathtaking views. My sister and I stayed in the Ridge villas which are a little higher up the mountain, but the views were better (we felt) than the Bay villas where my parents and brother stayed. We slept with our screen door open each night and had great breeze - no need for AC! The ocean sounds were great. Our unit was not a "gold" unit as promised, but Kapalua graciously took away the resort fees for us to make up for the mix up. I'm not accustomed to maid service (and turn-down service) in a condominium, so that was an added bonus. The units also had washer/dryer and were well-equipped and very spacious. All four of the one bedroom units we rented had sofa beds, and three had two full baths. If that is an issue, be sure to request two FULL baths! We went on the Refer a Friend program and received $250 vouchers to be used at the resort, so they guys basically got a free round of golf on the Plantation course (where the Mercedes Benz classic is held). We also got the 5th night free, so it was really a deal! The Ritz is on the propery, and you can use their facilities. However, they closed 7/1/07 for renovations until 12/07, so that was not available to us. The restaurants we tried on property (Pineapple Grill, Sanshei, and Plantation House) were all great but a bit pricey (as all of Maui is). The Honolua Shop on property has some good prices considering it is on a resort. There is some new construction going on down on the coast (Bay villas) - new condo units. Be aware of that. It was a great trip, and we'd highly recommend Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: lawyerlee
Reviews.Content: We booked a two BR, three bath condo through Sullivan Properties and stayed in unit B24B2. I can't say enough good things about our experience. The Bay Villas are a hop, skip, and a jump from Kapalua Beach, which has fantastic snorkeling and nice calm waters for swimming and relaxing. This beach would be perfect for children, too. The condo itself was stunning. We were so incredibly comfortable there that I'm not sure I can capture how much we loved it in this review. We had high speed internet access, DVD players, a laundry room, fans, a fully outfitted kitchen, and the most fantastic lanai. There were balconies off each bedroom and each also had an attached bath. When we needed an extra fan, a Sullivan staff member dropped one off within an hour of our call. Talk about prompt service! The pool area was pristine and wonderfully relaxing. I highly, highly recommend the Bay Villas and would love to stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie”
Reviews.Author: metrocritic
Reviews.Content: We visited Maui twice in 2006 and stayed at the Villas. What a remarkable place for the value. First time we had to share a one bedroom condo with another couple but it was a last minute trip during the Mercedes Championship Tournament. We were thrilled with the accomodations. Shuttle bus service was provided to the golf courses and tourney. The area pool was a bit chilly but warmed up as the sun came out. Housekeeping dept was exceptional!!! The second time shared a 2 bedroom condo with another couple which was even better! The decor was older but was clean. The views of the golf course and ocean are breathtaking. Would highly recommend to couples and families!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the UGLY”
Reviews.Author: jpledg
Reviews.Content: The Good - The Kapalua area is beautiful, with great golf courses and access to Lahaina. The Ritz Carlton property is nearby and the golf courses are great. Our golf villa in the Ridge area of the property had great views and was clean and well equipped. The checkin staff was courteous and efficient. The Bad - Security really sucks. Our villa was burglarized at night while we were there and two laptop computers and other property was stolen. For such a high class area, apparently management does not care enough to have sufficient security to protect the residents. There were three breakins on this same night. The Maui Police were efficient and responded promptly to take the report. The Ugly - We sincerely believe that this was an "inside job" and that entry was made through the front door with a magnetic key. Management promised to send our claim to their insurance company. After two calls and followup emails, I gave up and claimed it on my homeowner's insurance. Management could not care less that we were victimized by crime in their property. We will not be going back to stay in this property. I hope that Management improves, since this is a beautiful place and provides reasonable value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the quiet Ridge villas and wonderful Kapalua!”
Reviews.Author: Jim1956
Reviews.Content: After having to cancel a previously planned trip there, we just got back from Kapalua and it was great! We rented a 'super upgraded' from Ridge Realty. It cost $250 a night. When I priced the trip a one bedroom ocean view Kapalua Villas 'gold' villa would have cost us well over $400, I think we got a much better deal and just as good if not better villa. We had an ocean view and everything was top of the line, including the service. We feared construction noise from the hotel after reading reviews but there was none, we couldn't even see the construction site from where we were. The construction is by the bay villas and coconut villas far away, it is not close to the ridge villas. We walked past the bay and coconut villas and you could hear construction noise, but not at the ridge villas. It looks like there are only two or three buildings at the ridge villas that can even see the construction, and that is from a distance. So if you are worried about construction noise, stay at the ridge villas. The villa was perfect. I had looked at pictures on their website but the pictures didn't do it justice. Our villa had upgraded/new everything, tile floors, marble countertops, amazing bathrooms, new kitchen appliances, flat screen televisions, a surround sound system and Internet. The Kapalua area of Maui is great. Things we enjoyed the most were walking the miles of beautiful designated walking trails, snorkeling and sunbathing at Kapalua bay beach and eating at Sansei and Pineapple Grill (must try places!) There is a free shuttle that picks you up at your door, we only used it to go to dinner once, because we prefer to walk, but it was a nice service. Outside Kapalua we also enjoyed biking down Haleakala and our boat trip to Molokini. We also loved E&O Trading Company at the Lahaina Cannery Mall, it was fantastic, and the Old Lahaina Luau was great. We highly, highly recommend Maui, Kapalua, and the Ridge villas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Ridges at Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: Islandgolfers
Reviews.Content: After 4 days in Honolulu we flew into Maui. It was a by owner rental, The Ridge Villas 14-22. Although this unit is handled by Sullivan Properties on Maui. Everyone there was personable and helpful and Laurel who booked our excursions was a fountain of information even about items she neednâ€™t /couldn't book. We stopped at the Safeway grocery in Lahanai on the way to Kapalua. Tip: Get a savings card at the front desk. Thereâ€™s n\c and on $189 food bill we saved $52. Made our way to the ridge. It was raining hard and dark yet still found our unit ok. We LOVED the unit. Didn't see the view until we woke up. OMG. Bay villas are closer but the panorama view nicer from the ridge. The 8th hole a par 3 of the Bay Course was out our back door. It really felt like our home for the week. My wife LOVES to cook. She said she really enjoyed cooking then looking up to see the view of the bay then back to cooking. We had neighbors on every side and never heard them. It was VERY relaxing and comfortable. We saw whales in the bay on a few occasions and a school of Dolphins once from the lani. I plugged in the Broadband and 3 clicks later I was online. The Bathroom was a little on the older side but still nice while the Kitchen had been upgraded. I'll agree with other reviews that say windier and rainier. That's because the winds get pushed to Kapalua from the West Mountains while Lahanai is south of the West Mountain and better protected. We had showers everyday but they never interfered with our golf. Shuttle great, beaches great. Pineapple Grill Pricy but Fabulous. Your house key works the Pool Gate. The Gazebo was fun and the coconut "syrup" on the pancakes was...we bought a bottle to use back at the Villa on my wife's peach cinnamon french toast! Played golf 5 times on Maui. The Plantation was the best. The unit doesnâ€™t have A/C but we found with the constant breezes we never needed it. There was a double rainbow I hr before we left. For the price we would recommend this unit to anyone that would ask. Would Listen. Could hold down and tell.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Bay Villas....Loved our villa, loved the beauty”
Reviews.Author: Santyclaws1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bay Villas [--] #88704. When I entered the villa, I just squealed in delight! The views, OMG, the views are just amazing from every room. 3 lanais, 3 baths, 2 bedrooms, and a pull out couch. If we wanted to see whales, we just had to look out our windows! New furnishings, tasteful decor, comfortable beds, quality linens and incredible beauty made for one of our best vacations ever. Yes, it did rain here, and yes it was windy. Was it enough that we wouldn't come back to stay next time? Apparently not because this was our second stay in Kapalua. If it's raining, just start driving south!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: ALS514
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful week in Maui. It was our first trip to Hawaii and our extended family of 10 rented 2 Gold Golf Villas. They were truly amazing...Beautiful interiors and magnificent views of the ocean. Daily maid service, complimentary USA Today, dish and laundry detergent, and evening turn-down service complete with a weather forecast for the next day were provided. The villa pools were extremely clean and equipped with a nice grill for BBQs. We especially enjoyed the proximity to the Ritz Carlton and the many amenities that were available to us (pool, beach, restaurants, etc). The Kapalua Villas shuttle service is outstanding in providing transportation within the complex and usually arrived within 10 minutes of our request. We had a foursome play The Plantation Course and they found each hole to be simply breathtaking. We will definitely return to this beautiful area and stay at The Kapalua Villas again!

Reviews.Title: “Rock star lodging on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: brianbaroo
Reviews.Content: Our unit in Bldg. 37 was the nicest rental I've ever stayed in on Maui -- and probably anywhere else, for that matter. Everything seemed brand new and it slept 4 comfortably (it was a 1 bedroom, but the den had two pullout couches). Plus, every unit in the complex seemed to have an ocean view. If you stay here, you'll automatically save yourself $40 a person on whale watching trips -- we saw more whales from our lanai than the boat! Plus, Kapalua Bay has some of the best snorkeling on the island, and it's a 5 minute walk from the condos. Also, I'd like to respectfully counter a few of the "cons" pointed out in the previous posting from the Oakland reviewer: -Winter weather is fantastic here -- I saw more rain in Lahaina than I did here. We stayed at Kapalua Feb. 10-17 (the heart of the winter season) and saw daytime rain for all of 10 minutes during 7 days. The bulk of the showers -- which are almost always quick -- seemed to happen overnight. As for the wind, I never noticed it being appreciably stronger in Kapalua than Lahaina. -The construction is actually a plus when striking a rental deal. I suspect our very reasonable rate was a result of the unit being right next to the very large construction of new Ritz-Carlton condos. However, the cranes made absolutely NO noise (and we were close enough to be able to wave to the operator from our patio). The only thing I heard was the occasional safety beep of a truck in reverse. We, too, experienced power outages, but I doubt these were due to the construction. The island has periodic brown-outs; the day we arrived, there was no power at the airport. -Don't worry about renting directly from an owner. We did, and when we did have a housekeeping concern, we were able to phone the concierge just like anyone else. I suspect they would have replaced the bbq gas if they'd been alerted. If anything, the one downside to the villas is their proximity from Lahaina and a lot of the other attractions. We ended up spending a lot of time in the Jeep shuttling back and forth from town -- and I say that as someone who lives in LA, where is a way of life. However, there are supermarkets nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Awful at the same time”
Reviews.Author: Becky-in-Oakland
Reviews.Content: I have mixed emotions as I write this review. We booked directly from the owner of this Bay Villa unit and not through the Kapalua Villas management, so our experience may be somewhat different than those booking through the service. There were many positives that made our trip amazing; however, there were a couple of negatives as well that colored our experience. Pros - The unit (in building 12) was absolutely, fabulously beautiful with a view unlike any other we've experienced in our many trips to Hawaii - The grounds were well manicured, lush, and very pretty - The proximity to Napili Bay and Kapalua Bay (in my opinion the best swimming areas on the island) - Proximity to the Ritz-Carlton, and other dining options in Napili and Kapalua - Watching the whales breach from our bedroom in the morning Cons - The weather in Kapalua in the winter, especially during our vacation, is awful. We woke up every morning to the sound of 30+ mph winds and torrential downpours. To be fair, there was a high pressure front approaching the islands so we expected less-than-stellar weather, but it seems that Kapalua received the brunt of the storm. Down the road in Lahaina, the weather would be gorgeous, while it was ugly and wet in Kapalua. - One of the pools in the Bay Villas complex is completely out of commission - empty and going through construction - The other pool is therefore used by everyone staying in the area and was a bit dirty - The grill in this pool area ran out of gas and there was no one who could help - Area construction: Kapalua is in the process of adding a number of luxury units to the area and there are many cranes and other construction vehicles working during the day. We couldn't hear them, but upon approaching the Bay Villas entrance, it is definitely a construction zone (we actually thought we were in the wrong place). Also, due to the construction, our power went out one morning and there was really nothing to be done about it. - If there are jacuzzis anywhere, I couldn't find them (and I looked!) All in all, our stay at the Bay Villas was nice, but not as peaceful or relaxing as I had hoped, and there were some things that should have been noted to us before we paid to stay there (pool, construction, lack of jacuzzis). I don't want to deter anyone from staying at the Kapalua Bay Villas b/c I feel like some of the issues we faced were because we booked directly with the owner (not a Maui resident), but if you are interested, I would strongly recommend you stay there in the summer when the weather is more predictable and mild.

Reviews.Title: “First of Many”
Reviews.Author: FukuBonsaiPlant
Reviews.Content: Three of us came to Maui for golf and relaxation, We stayed in the Golf Villas and played " The Bay Course" and "The Planation", Everything at Kapalua was outstanding, The Villa ,(Very well decorated and clean, on 11th fairway) Golf courses, Pro shops, Morning Buffet at "The Ritz" , Beaches and all the pools. The price for the two bedroom villa was reasonable considering that we were staying on the best island in the world. The town of "Lahaina" was fun and not far away. We also spent a day golfing on the island of "Lanai". "The Experience, and The Challenge". A must for any golf fan. We plan to return in 2009 and we will stay at "Kapalua Villas" Ten out of Ten is the best way to decribe it and if you disagree your plain spoiled.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Absolutely Lovely”
Reviews.Author: TXskibunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas for the second time this past year - first time we were in the Fairway view and this time oceanFRONT! SOOOO great - super customer service - great maid service, great conceirge, the condo was fabulous - nice clean kitchen, the furniture was darling! Huge bathroom, comfy bed - the location as always is superb. I cant say enough nice things - it felt like we were the only ones in the resort - even though obviously there are tons of guests - the Ritz ammenities were key - the pool there is a blast, all the great beaches - so so fun. We are planning on coming back this spring break, Kapalua junkies :) The prices are so reasonable considering what you get for the $, relaxing place of your "own" - love it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ridge Villas”
Reviews.Author: xanderjoon
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Kapalua for years and our most recent trip was in November of 2006. At first, we have stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas but when we discovered the Ridge Villas, we prefered to stay there. Though the Bay Villas are closer to the ocean, some of the units at the Ridge have more of a panoramic view because they sit higher up on a hill. They are spacious and have a home away from home feel. Some of the units are a bit outdated, but they also have some nicer, remodelled villas. For the last two years, we rented though Ridge Realty Rentals. We disagree with some of the negative reviews they received. From our experience with all the rental companies that operate in Kapalua, they have consistently been the most friendly and helpful staff of all. There is some construction going on right now near the Kapalua Bay Beach, which is our favorite beach for snorkelling. Snorkelling is still good but we can see some cranes from the beach. All in all, Kapalua is still a place of magnificent beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: isletraveler
Reviews.Content: Who we are: 30 somethings with no kids What we like: Ritz, Four Seasons, Marriotts, Hiltons, Hyatts, etc. During our 2nd visit to Maui in December 2006, we stayed at these Kapalua Villas. (Our first visit to Maui in April 2005, we stayed at the neighboring Ritz Carlton...also excellent!). We were here for a wedding, so we also got to see other guests accomodations...since it's a condo-type resort, the decor in most villas are different. Ours (see pictures) was 'island style', with wicker type furniture and floral fabrics. Our villa could have used some updating, but the Villas really can't be beat. It was so nice to have a separate bedroom, a full kitchen, 2 bathrooms and a huge lanai. You have priveleges at the Ritz (pool, spa, workouts, etc), so it was nice to go there for some things, but come back to your very clean, manicured, spacious condo to relax. The Villas are cleaned every day, and your linens are changed. If you want updated decor, ask for the 'gold villas'...they have more modern decor like granite kitchen countertops, etc. The Kapalua area of Maui, to us, is the best. Kaanapali, Lahaina, Wailea...all are too crowded and not as peaceful or pretty. You can rent a car and go visit the crowds, but it's so nice to come back to Kapalua when you've had your fill. There is a 'general store' within walking distance where you can buy food, drinks, etc. They have cheap and delicious breakfasts and lunches ($5 - $10). Rent a jeep and explore the island and beaches...you'll like Kapalua. When we return to Maui, we will pick the Kapalua Villas over staying in a hotel room at the Ritz...just more relaxing. Full service is nice, but the extra room and homey feel is unbeatable. For best Lunch or Sunset & Cocktails: Kimo's in Lahaina For excellent Dinner Local: Roy's Kapaula For excellent Dinner 45 min drive (but WORTH it): Mamma's Fish House, past Paia. Good beach, okay snorkeling: Kapalua Bay Night Spot: Hyatt in Kaanapali Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Villas, Ridge Realty - The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryMoMo
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 month old son and I went to Maui in September 2006 and stayed in Kapalua Ridge Villa 9-14. We booked through Ridge Realty, after the many recommendations found here, but upon arrival were disappointed with our unit as we were told at the time of booking that we would be getting an upgraded unit. Instead, our unit looked like something from the set of Three's Company with extremely stained and tattered carpet. It was not the upgraded unit we were promised. That's the bad. Fortunately we had an incredible view which made us quickly forget how old and outdated our unit was. While Diane at Ridge Realty reluctantly offered us another unit, it did not have much of a view and so we decided to stick with the original unit. I'm not sure that I would book through Ridge Realty again. Now, to get to the good. Our unit was 1300 sq.ft. all on one level which we found very convenient plus it had a large grassy area in front of the lanai which made our lanai space seem much larger than it was. The villas are beautifully landscaped and it seemed like the landscapers work 24/7 to keep it that way. It was always a pleasure to return to the Kapalua area after a day spent exploring other parts of the island. There was no air conditioning in our unit and there was absolutely no need for it. The trade winds kept our unit so comfortable that we both slept like babies the entire trip. There was a pool area very close to our unit which we used a couple of times. It was quiet and again, beautifully maintained and manicured. We used the barbecue areas only a couple of times but found them to be very clean. Groceries are very expensive on Maui so we didn't cook as often as we originally planned. Kapalua beach is fantastic. The snorkelling is great and the beach very serene, despite the construction happening nearby. It's funny how quickly you can tune it out. We'd definitely return to the Kapalua area when we visit Maui again. We were there in September which is one of the hottest and driest months so we never experienced the bad weather others have posted. We found it very pleasant to return to the coolness of Kapalua after spending time in Lahaina or Kaanapali. But I think if you are travelling during the wetter months, staying further south might be the better plan. So, all in all, I definitely recommend Kapalua and the ridge villas. Just be aware that each unit is different, depending on the degree to which the owners have renovated their units. It's a stunning area, very peaceful and prestigious.

Reviews.Title: “not for kids, better weather everywhere else”
Reviews.Author: jah39a
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a Bay Villa at Kapalua Dec 1 to 15. Though we found the unit quite nice, I didnâ€™t do a very good job researching our choice, and hope that the following will help others pick the right place. The reason we chose a condo over a hotel is to get a full kitchen and laundry, to make family travel easier. This worked out fine, but beyond that, Kapalua Villas has little to offer families with young kids. There are small, residential sized pools scattered throughout the complex. The pools are surprisingly deep, and our 5 year old could only touch bottom at the steps. The Ritz Carlton pool allows access to Villa guests, but it lacks a shallow area, kids pool, slide, or other child friendly features. It is heated, unlike the condo pools. There is no playground at the villas, and the Ritz playground consists of one rickety wooden swing set. There is no childrenâ€™s activity program at the Villas, and the Ritz Kids program is strictly off limits to villa guests. The independent Kapalua Art School on the grounds offers full and half day art and activity programs for kids. Our daughter enjoyed the arts and crafts, but she was the only one enrolled and felt a bit lonely and only went once. (they donâ€™t usually run programs for only 1 child; we got in because there had been another child signed up who cancelled.) OK fine, you donâ€™t have kids so it should be great, right? Not exactly. There isnâ€™t any workout room at all in this vast complex, (I was told that there was) and the Ritz fitness center is only available if you book a spa treatment, meaning each workout would set you back well over $100! The Bay Villas are adjacent to a huge construction site (through 2008) and noise is constant 6 days a week, 7am to 5pm. The Ridge and Golf villas are farther from construction and quieter. Looking at a map, it appears you have easy access to 3 beaches. Not so easy, since the construction site blocks the footpath to Kapalua beach, and the steps down to Honolua beach are washed out, so in both cases you need to drive to public parking areas (if youâ€™re not hauling beach gear with kids in tow, you might enjoy the long walk). Fleming beach is easily accessible from the Ritz, but too far to walk from the villas. Fleming and Honolua beach are far too rough, at least in winter, for all but serious swimmers or surfers. Kapalua beach was slightly calmer but couldnâ€™t compare with Kaanipali or Wailea beaches. (If you want peace and quiet, Kapalua Ridge or Golf villas are a good choice compared to those areas, however.) Kapalua has a reputation for windier, rainier weather than any other Maui resort area (A Ritz employee confirmed this-when my wife commented on the weather, he advised us to go south because its always better weatherâ€¦) Granted, December is the rainiest month, but on several days when we had gale force winds and rain, it was gorgeous weather just 15 minutes south in Kaanapali. Every day, the weather was better elsewhere no matter where we went on Maui. There seems to be a vortex of especially lousy weather at the Ritz pool; even when the weather was fine 1/4 of a mile away, there was wind and clouds over the pool with people covering themselves with towels for warmth! I began to wonder if Kapalua meant cloudy in Hawaiian! I overheard several golfers who were in love with Kapaluaâ€™s courses, so if golf is your thing stay here. Otherwise, either the weather or the lack of recreational facilities for both kids and adults will disappoint you. We spent a lot of time in our car, getting away from Kapalua weather. Non golfers and those with kids should save the gas, stay in Kaanapali or Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: The-Martinez-Bunch
Reviews.Content: After spending months researching on the web we finally selected Kapalua Villas because it had some very nice pictures on the website. We rented through Ridge Realty headed by a lady named Diane. They promised us a "super-upgraded" condo with granite counters and remodled bathrooms. What we got was a 1970 version that had not been touched in years and smelled of raw sewage and mold. Which probably explains the cockroaches..... Both of the bathroom sinks leaked everywhere and the coffee pot was broken and spilled all over the counter on our first morning there. The view was good but not worth staying for. We checked out 3 days early. In addition, when we called to complain about all of these problems the manager Diane never even apoligized for any of it and sounded as rude and annoyed as she possibly could. We vacation several times every year and have traveled world wide. This place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great 10th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: donkndan
Reviews.Content: Aloha- My husband and I just spent 2 fabulous weeks in Maui. The reviews I read before we went really helped me get the most for my $ especially since we went for two weeks and Maui is definately not cheap. I booked our condo through The Ridge Realty -Had a beautiful one bdrm condo completely upgraded at $200 a night and the 7th night free. Even the 6.7 earthquake could not wreck this vacation. The place was clean comfortable and had everthing a chef could want. The next week we had friends so booked a 2 bdrm condo through Sullivan properties as the ridge was full paid $270 a night was not as nice as the first condo but wow was the view from the BAY Villas worth the move, and the space we had to move around was great. I would highly recommend both companies. Sullivan actually mailed me the key before we left home, was a nice treat to go straight to the condo. The ridge you had to check in then they meet you at the condo- but they were cheaper and nicer rooms., But not as good view and far from the pool. P.S. The shuttle will take you anywhere in the resort for free, free WI FI internet at both, you may use the Ritz pool for free we never paid the $15 other people said they paid. Restaurants We loved Vino, Pineapple Grill, Sansei-great sushi, Roys and David Pauls. Safeway is good but Stars market had more variety and just as good of food sales. We will not stay anywhere else besides Kapalua again it was absolutely beautiful the grounds were lovely with easy beach access . Do remember it is the tropics there are rainstorms always but the sun will emerge and there are bugs you can't help it. Hope my review helps Enjoy your vacation . Mahalo you can see pics of rooms at both web sights.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: JennyWC
Reviews.Content: The property at Kapulua is beautiful. However, our villa was just OK. The villia itself was clean, but the furniture and decor definitely needed to be updated. The furniture was old, stained, and had a smell to it. We only stayed for 3 nights, if we would have stayed longer, I would have requested a new room. Renter beware - these are independently owned villas, and some are just not up to snuff.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessofVacation
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, pools and snorkelling. I absolutely loved the fact that I could sit on the lanai with my dad and watch the whales while eating breakfast. There was only one incident with some cockroaches in the bathtub, but the concierge immediately changed us to a different room. Loved it! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Tiphni
Reviews.Content: We stayed our last 2 nights at a beautiful Golf Villa. They are very roomy and nicely decorated. There was a huge cockroach in our room, which was a bummer along with the $15 per day serivce fee, which we never used.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nonfat-Chai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kapalua Villas the week of September 24, 2006. Recommendations on Trip Advisor were so helpful to me in my preparation for Maui that I thought I'd pass along my experiences as well. We reserved a gold ocean front villa and assigned into building 29 the first night. I was very disappointed because 29 in my opinion is NOT ocean front. It is slightly pushed back and the ocean view is limited by two other villas on each side. I was too tired the night of check-in to argue, but when I woke up I resolved the issue at the front desk with no problem at all. I expressed that I would prefer an ocean front over high quality furnishings. I was allowed to borrow the keys to a couple of other villas. Ladies, I did this before my boyfriend woke up because frankly I don't think he would have had the patience for my pickiness. I did, however, find the perfect vacation spot - building 21 - G5. It is a two-story, one bedroom, two bathroom, villa. It was a deluxe not gold villa (which is a downgrade) but I found it much more beautiful than our gold. Nice furniture, granite tops, ocean views from living room and bedroom, W/D, full kitchen. Stairs leading to beach directly in front of villa. One drawback - no AC downstairs, but the AC in the bedroom upstairs is fully functional. We kept the patio door downstairs open the whole time because of the constant fresh breezes. I would recommend Kapalua Villas to any couple wanting a romantic Hawaiian experience!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Honeymoon location”
Reviews.Author: Alekia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kapalua Bay Villas from Sept. 10-23 for our Honeymoon and it was fantastic. We stayed in villa B-1 35, which was the highest end one bedroom villa directly overlooking the Ocean. The villa was large with an incredible bathroom and great kitchen. We loved our days that we spent just hanging around Kapalua, not leaving the resort. We enjoyed the Plantation House for Breakfast, loved watching all the golfers on the 18th hole. Vino's at the Village course was great, a tapas style restaurant. Great boogie Boarding at Napili Bay, you have to be strong the waves can be big. Our best day was spent getting up at 2am and being taken to the top of an inactive volcano for the sunrise and then biking 38 miles down the side of the crater, just spectacular. Kapalua is an expensive resort but worth the money for a peace of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Once great Kapalua Villas a thing of the past”
Reviews.Author: SolomonandRiva
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been a visitor to Kapalua on numerous occasion. We visit the resort for its golf and relaxing on the beach. Our last visit was 2 years ago and to my extreme dissapointment the Kapalua Villas has lost much of its lustre. The resort is under construction and the trucks and noise were NOT communicated to us at the time of our reservation. We had inquired how long this had been going on and while the front desk staff was cordial they apparently were not at all informed or were properly trained to give us an honest response. We had asked to speak to the General Manager and he agent said he was in a meeting and he would give us a call in regard to our questions. We had never received a call from the General Manager. The golf courses were dried out and lacking the manicured look as the past. While we do not mind paying the price for the rooms and golf.. I do not feel Kapalua has been keeping up with the prices they are charging. In speaking with some of the staff at the resort , golf courses and restaurants. it seems that the new management has taken an attitude to nickel and dime its guests and raise prices with out upgrading accomodations, services etc. The resort lacks amenitiies and does not warrnt the prices it is charging nowadays. I am very sad the management has let the resort rundown to this level. An open letter to the General Manager. I would not have been so critical if you had at least had the simple courtesy to return our phone calls. We will not be returning. I would avoid the resort until the construction is completed or at least ask about the inconveniences , noise and conditions when you make your reservations....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved Kapalua Bay Villas”
Reviews.Author: JoMoCo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas from 9/5/06 - 9/11/06, Unit 22 G4, which is a 1 bedroom ocean front. The furniture and appliances are all brand new (brushed metal) and the unit itself is very well maintained. The place has a washer and dryer so we left with clean clothes. The kitchen aplliances are fairly new so I didn't mind using them and also their kitchenware (I'm very particular when it comes to using someone else's silverware). I love their spacious, clean bathroom. My favorite part of this unit is the lanai....we had a great view of the ocean and we are within walking distance to the beach, which isn't crowded at all. I would definitely stay here again! Please note, when I booked the room through Orbitz, I had booked a 1 bedroom ocean view. I was initially assigned to the Gold Villa which has some view of the ocean but nothing compared to the Bay Villas. The Bay Villas was an upgrade (extra 100 day) but it was well worth it. One tip, call the Kapalua office before you leave for your trip and request this room so they can have it in their system before you arrive. They of course, cannot guarantee that you get the room that you ask for but they will try to find you a similar one (I inquired about unit 21 G4 but got Unit 22 G4 which are similar). Another unit that came highly recommended in tripadvisor is unit 21 G4. Also, as mentioned in some of the reviews, beware of the Ridge Villas. The Ridge Villas are far away from the ocean so if you are looking for units that are "walk to the beach" the Bay Villas is the place for you. Restaurant reviews: We went to Fish and Poi, which is located in Napili Bay area on our first night. The food was delicious and moderately priced. I highly recommend their pan seared ahi tuna with wasabi sauce dish. Their mix drinks (luv the mango martini) are yummy. David Paul's in Lahaina is excellent for fine dining. My husband and I ordered their "A Taste of Chef Selections" where each person got a sampling of their 3 famous appetizer, 3 intermezze, 3 dinner and 3 dessert samples. We were so full by the time we got to the dinner part that we had get our dessert to go. We also went to Pacific'O and Rusty Harpoon's restaurant and both are ok. Roy's came highly recommended but we didn't get to go.

Reviews.Title: “A little tardy”
Reviews.Author: aj_stl
Reviews.Content: Just now getting around to posting this review from a stay in March of 2005. This is a perfect, perfect place for families that want to stay in one unit (versus two rooms in a hotel). The only snafu for us was that they had overbooked their 3br condos (of which there are very few). They called us a few days before our arrival to notify us. It was only going to be for one night and they offered us two-2br condos for our first noght and then an upgraded ocean-view 3br for the remainder of our stay (6 nights). We thought this was pretty fair. We had our 3 kids with us, ages 17, 15, and 11. They all had lots of room and privacy when they wanted it. The unit was beautiful, the kitchen fully equipped and the views from our lanai were stunning. We were also a little miffed at the $25 daily charge for the Ritz's gym. We decided walks on the beach and grounds would suffice. We all thought this was a great place for a family vacation that was removed a little from the more crowded areas of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the Bay Villas”
Reviews.Author: DASmith5
Reviews.Content: The Kapalua Bay Villas were not our first choice. Our original plans had been "accidentally" cancelled so our agency scrambled to get us into the Kapalua Bay Villas. I was pleasantly surprised by our experience with the front office, concierge, and all other support staff. Artcharlynn (Art Charlynn) was an exceptional example of what the front office can be to a traveler. Tom, in concierge was professional with a warmth and kid glove service.Excellent service. We stayed in two different Villas. 12G4 and 15B4. Each was beautiful (12G4 was completely remodeled and has lawn access from the deck) but I preferred the view and other amenities (sand chairs, coolers, a library of books to read, Hawaiian music CD's, a new Boise system - added a wonderful touch, and no stairs to climb) in 15B4. One review I read questioned staying at the Kapalua Bay Villas because the Kapalua Bay Hotel (next door) is being demolished. We were half a football field away and didn't hear a sound. The Bay Villas are closer to the ocean (for convenient walks down to tide-pools or Oneloa Beach) and worth every penny. Due to the obvious freight expense that all mainland supplies carry I suggest taking a few items with you. Example: A soft cooler, sandwich bags, and large storage bags. We used these things daily. Everything else was furnished: as much tide and dishwashing soap as we needed, plus when something went wrong (the ice machine broke) the maintenance department came right away. We suggest you experience the pineapple plantation tour - Your guide, Joe, is terrific and we received pineapples to take home. The cultural program at the Ritz-Carlton is wonderful (We made tuberose, carnation, and orchid Leis and traditional bark and raffia bracelets. The film "And Then There Were None" is a must see.) The Gazebo restaurant, Napili Bay, is a hoot with great food, The Sea House restaurant, Napili Bay, has a delicious macadamia nut crusted shrimp appetizer and is a beatuiful place to watch the sunset. We stayed July 31st to August 10th, 2006 and enjoyed every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views; Indifferent staff; Incomplete Information”
Reviews.Author: Plumeria_Lover
Reviews.Content: We returned five days ago, and while we ended up sharing a beautiful ocean-view condo (17 G 4) with f riends, this was not our plan. For two couples, we booked two one-bedroom condos, one which was nice and the other which had the smell of dead fish in the refrigerator and kitchen, holes in the carpet, and a bedroom that was about 95 degrees (no air conditioning). We called the front desk, and we were told there were no other options, so we opted to stay on the Murphy bed in our friends condo (how 's this for your 35th wedding anniversary?). We had to call back to our travel agent and spend extensive time on the phone over several days with the front desk to get three of the four days reimbursed. For the fourth day, we were given, at our request, a small reimbursement on activities fees. In addition, we had been told on check-in that we would be able to use the Ritz-Carlton's gym and pool facilities. What we were not told was that there would be a $25 charge per person for the gym use, which we learned when we tried to use the gym. (In addition, the Ritz staff said that the use of the gym was no longer going to be available to Bay Villa guests.) This took place on day three of our five-day stay. We spoke with the front desk again, and they were uninterested in our concerns. We asked to talk with the desk manager, and he/she was not available. Sometime later, we received a phone message that we never returned. We were not interested in making one more phone call or one more trip to the front desk. Linen service was sloppy and we had trouble getting face cloths and hand towels. While beach towels were supplied, the only way to get a dry, clean towel was to call the front desk and wait for towel delivery. The housecleaners did not speak English well, so it was difficult to have our towel requests understood. Further, there was a different set of housekeepers each day. Our condo was not well-equipped for cooking. Make sure you bring your own salt and pepper as well as measuring cups. On the last day, we were able to get a one hour extension on check-out to 12 PM, as our flight was late in the evening. We were told to go over to one of the golf clubs for changing facilities. The best part of our stay was the Ritz spa and gym, which we ultimately ended up using. The staff there were courteous, helpful and the massages were fantastic! I would return to Kapalua, but I would opt for the Ritz rather than the Bay Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paradise (As close as possible)”
Reviews.Author: Fans361
Reviews.Content: I just completed a six-night stay at the Kapalua Villa with my family. We found the hotel at a last-minue, which included a free sixth-night and a rental car. For the most part, the experience was very smooth. We flew into the Kapalua airport (JHM) and the shuttle van picked us up promptly. At check-in we had a few problems with the rental car and ended up getting downgraded, but it was ok. Now with all the good parts. We stayed at the Ridge Villas which have a gorgeous view of the Bay Course and a partial ocean view. The villa almost seemed like a bargain at $379 a night compared to everything else in Maui. Our villa had two bedrooms, three full baths , a good-size kitchen, a comfortable living room with space for a computer, and multiple lanais. Unlike other villas, there was maid service every day that was just fine. The views from the villa and the surrondings were incredible especially around sunset. The weather was close to perfect with only a few minutes of rain in almost a week. As guests of the Kapalua Villas, you are allowed to use any of the Ritz-Carlton's facilities, some of which have a fee. Each sections of villas has pools, but the ones at the Ritz are much nicer. You will be charged a $15 a day usage fee for the Ritz, so it would be wise to use their facilities. They have a beautiful three-tiered pool, a nine-hole putting course, a bocce lawn, and many other things to do. We did not eat at the Ritz since the prices were through the roof. At the Kapalua resort, there are some good restaurants including the Pineapple Grill, which is a very good Asian-Hawaiian restaurant. There is so much to do in Maui that you don't spend that much time in the villa, but the time spent there is enjoyable. Another thing is that if you don't feel like eating out, the pools have Weber Grills and with supermarkets nearby, dining in is always an option. The Kapalua resort has a shuttle that will pick you up at your villa and take you anywhere inside the resort. This was nice since parking can be hard to find at the Ritz. Kapalua has world-class golf, tennis, and beaches that there is little-more to ask for in a resort.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: highbrowed
Reviews.Content: kapalua villas: quiet, big rooms, private pool, you can park your car in front of the villa, kitchen fully equiped, clean, wonderful flowers all around, fantastic view over the golf course and see. lovely beaches within walking distance (snorkling and scuba diving possible), wale watching, short walk to the ritz you can use-awesome pool there. surprisingly we were the only guys with an american flag on the car. hang loose:-) couple from poland

Reviews.Title: “We hated to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: whitenackers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kapalua golf villas for the second week of our Hawaiian honeymoon. We flew into the Kapalua airport from Oahu and the shuttle picked us up 5 minutes after we called. We arrived before the check-in but the room became ready during our orientation so we were able to get in about 3 hours early. Our Hertz rental car was waiting for us there at the check-in office. The villa was wonderful, well maintained and clean. There are beach chairs and beach towels for us to use. The room had a DVD/VCR player and variety of books to read. The kitchen had everything you would need to cook a meal. There are grills at the pool that were very clean. They had a washer and dryer and the maids left detergent for us to use each day. We went on the â€œtennis for lifeâ€� package, which is a great package, but there is a major disconnect between the front office and the tennis center. They didnâ€™t give us the correct vouchers so we had to return to the office and they still didnâ€™t understand what to do. The tennis center people were WONDERFUL and made us feel like celebrities. The public beach across from Kapalua is not bad. We snorkeled there and they have a little shop that will rent you equipment and sells stuff like overpriced sunscreen and underwater cameras. This was a very quiet vacation spot. We rarely saw anyone at the villas and only one other family was ever at the pool that is shared by 6 or so villas. There is a small store next to check-in, but we got most of our supplies/groceries at Napili Plaza a few miles down the road. We had a wonderful time and would love to return next time we go to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “spacious floorplan, needs to be remodeled”
Reviews.Author: number1mommyJ
Reviews.Content: We just got home from spending a week in the Ridge Villas. Our Unit (4-14) was very roomy with 3 full baths and 2 bedrooms. Also included was a sofa sleeper, the sofa was very dirty, the top cushions were visably dirty and actually felt "slimey", we actually put beach towels over it so we wouldn't see or smell the dirty areas where things had been spilled. The views from the condo were incredible and the location is gorgeous and very quiet. There were several things missing or broken in the unit we stayed in and we had to keep calling housekeeping to fix or bring things that we needed. The kitchen was very basic and lacked a lot of basics (like serving bowls!). I would stay at Kapalua again but I think I would insist on seeing pictures of the villa before reserving it!

Reviews.Title: “If staying at Kapalua Villas- book with Ridge Realty”
Reviews.Author: Golfdud
Reviews.Content: After seeing many positive reviews, and reviewing their website, we decided to book our stay in Kapalua through Ridge Realty. I HIGHLY recommend going through them. The Ridge staff was exceptionally helpful. The unit we were in was spectacular. High on the Ridge overlooking Kapalua Bay on one side and the Kapalua Bay course on the other. The unit was a very large 1 bedroom, 2 bath with a nice sized lanai and a complete kitchen. My wife and I went with our 2 children (ages 2 and 4) and had a wonderful trip. We will definately use Ridge Realty on our next trip to Kapaula.

Reviews.Title: “If staying at Kapalua Villas- book with Ridge Realty”
Reviews.Author: Golfdud
Reviews.Content: After seeing many positive reviews, and reviewing their website, we decided to book our stay in Kapalua through Ridge Realty. I HIGHLY recommend going through them. The Ridge staff was exceptionally helpful. The unit we were in was spectacular. High on the Ridge overlooking Kapalua Bay on one side and the Kapalua Bay course on the other. The unit was a very large 1 bedroom, 2 bath with a nice sized lanai and a complete kitchen. My wife and I went with our 2 children (ages 2 and 4) and had a wonderful trip. We will definately use Ridge Realty on our next trip to Kapaula.

Reviews.Title: “We wished we could've stayed there longer... Great villa!”
Reviews.Author: Mikgirl
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Maui happened unexpectedly, and had to plan everything within a week. Kapalua Villas was one of the few hotels that was still available at the last minute. We thought it was the same hotel as the one we stayed before (Kapalua Bay hotel... I think it's converted into a condo), so we picked this one. We didn't get there til almost 10PM. Because we thought it was Kapalua Bay hotel, we got lost finding the hotel. We called the reception, and the lady "Summer" pleasantly helped us find the reception area. We still hadn't eaten dinner, and Summer helped us once again to get a call-in menus from restaurants around the area. The actual villas were a little further than the reception area, and you have to get there by driving. After the check-in, we once again got lost to find the actually villa! To get to the area, we had to go through this "scary road" - just trees, no light, and it looked like we were driving on the cliff (which we found out next morning it was just a golf course...). We were too scared to go and get lost in the woods (that's what it looked like...), so we once again called Summer to make sure... and it was the road we needed to take. It only lasted about a minute until we saw the villas (Golf Villas). When we entered our unit, we all just said "woooooooooowwwww!!!!!!" Since we were expecting a small hotel room, it was a nice surprise to see a place with kitchen, living room, dining area, and a separate bedroom. We actually called back Summer about twice to make sure that we had a right hotel, and the right price. It just looked too nice for what we paid for. My favorite was the bathroom in the master bedroom. The bathroom had the tub and shower separate, and the tub was very deep. Even though it was almost midnight, I had to take a nice bath. Next morning, we woke up and got to see the surrounding area in the light. There was a big balcony surrounding the living room and bedroom, and a great ocean view ahead of us. We all had a breakfast in the balcony. The check-out was at 11AM, and we were still far from Kapalua, so we called the reception to see if we can check out a little later. Although they told us that there will be a reservation for that day, they gave us some more time until the check out. The only regret we had was that we were always on the go, and didn't stay in the room as much. We now know where to go next time we go to Maui! Great villa!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Scenary, Sullen staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
