Reviews.Content: Checking in to the Villa's was not exactly "Aloha". Sullen and disinterested staff. The first night our AC and jacuzzi tub was not working. The humidity was stifling. We stopped at the reception center and was treated like an annoyance. We were asked to consider a different villa which was actually a downgrade from what we had reserved, was shabby and scheduled for an open house. Sheets are suppose to be changed every 3 days, ours got changed on day 5 after calling housekeeping. Check out was the same sullen , passive-aggressive treatment. There were four staff members sitting, talking and checking messages. We were the only customers waiting. My husband finally approached a staff member who was idling at her desk for help. We received more gracious and friendly service from the parking attendant at the Whalers's mall down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Things started out rough, but recovered pretty well.....”
Reviews.Author: jr0777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I scheduled a two night stay in the Golf Villas a few weeks ago in June 2006. The plan was to spend two nights at the Villas and then two nights in Wailea at the Four Seasons. I have a separate review pending of the Four Seasons as soon as I can get the time to catch up on the reviews.... We checked in on a Thursday at the Villas Reception which is a small red building that looks like a converted former house (complete with sliding glass door as an entrance) earlier than the normal check in time. We knew that going in and still wanted to do the preliminary check in so that we could drop off our bag and head out for lunch (we had rented a Jeep Wrangler with a soft top and only wanted to carry smaller bags with us until the full check in was ready). The staff was accommodating and pleasant, we were told we would be upgraded on the spot to a two bedroom ocean view Ridge Villa which was a great surprise. Needless to say we were happy as we went to lunch. After lunch up at the Plantation Course clubhouse (which was very good especially with a small table near the open window looking out over the 18th green toward the ocean) we went to get some dinner at the local Napili market to have at the Villa before returning at 3.10 pm (we were told to return after 3 pm) to get our Villa keys. At this point things started to go sour. We had been bumped from the original 2 bedroom ocean view into a two bedroom fairway view Ridge Villa. My wife was a little unhappy but I was still ok with it seeing as how I didn't expect to be in one of the Ridge units and it was still a two bedroom. So we took the keys and our bag and went to the Villa for a look around. It was nice, certainly better than my view back home. Considering I paid for a fairway view unit, anything better would have been well appreciated, but this was just fine. We left for about an hour to scout the Ritz Carlton and the beach for the next day's plans. Upon returning, we noticed a car parked in the spot designated for our unit. The people in the car were just leaving as we pulled in and as we went upstairs we noticed our keys no longer worked. So I got back in the Jeep and returned to the Villa Reception building to see if they could re-program the keys. It turned out that after they had moved us to the 2 bedroom fairway view Villa, they (within that short period of time after we had left to look around) had given our unit to someone else. So, naturally that other party went into the unit, saw our things already in there and were also on their way back to the Reception area to straighten things out. With me also returning immediately, we were all there in the reception area together -- while I recognized them as they were leaving the parking spot, I'm not sure they had recognized me. As the staff was dealing with the other party, I simply asked for another staff member to reprogram the keys so that we could get into our unit, which they did. I drove back to the unit, and my wife was already back in the unit because they had sent security to find out why someone was in a unit already given to the other party. We had to explain to them that they put us in the unit first. After seeing what they had done, we were finally left alone at which point my wife and I went back to the deck to relax with a couple of beers and some snacks. No sooner did we sit down than we noticed ants. On the table, on the rail, on the porch. Further examination also showed them on the counter in the kitchen in a couple of spots we hadn't looked when we first got into the unit. By this time we were pretty fed up. My wife called and asked to talk to the Manager at the Reception area, by the name of Gin (or "Jin" maybe, not positive on the spelling) and this is where the redemption started. After acknowledging the mistakes and our concerns with all of the issues including perfect strangers being in our Villa and the ants, Gin asked if she could call us right back. Upon her call back, she moved us into a 1 bedroom ocean view Ridge unit (which was perfectly fine with us) with a magnificent view of Molokai straight ahead and Lanai to the left and a great spot for catching the sunset which by then was rapidly approaching. The unit was in the # 21 group (can't remember if it was #2115 or 2116 but it was on the ground floor) and it was clean, neat, perfect in size for us and well kept. Best of all we could walk right out the sliding glass door, sit on the lanai and watch the sunsets in peace (no ants). On top of that we received a $100 gift certificate on the spot for dinner or lunch at the Pineapple Grill on the Kapalua property. We used it the second night and dinner was very good. What started out as a disaster was recovered by Gin. If you are going to be checking in anytime soon there I would suggest trying to go directly to her. The rest of the staff was pleasant to us as well, but being moved around like we were (and having two parties assigned to the same unit) raises questions about whether one person knows what the other person is doing. It may be best just to cut through that and go to the manager. PROS: 1. Organized, concerted effort by the Manager to "save" this experience from disaster. 2. Quiet (at least where we ended up) location with great views. 3. Clean, modern unit. CONS: 1. The intial disorganization and run around. I doubt many people would be as patient with them as we had been but then we only flew over that morning from another island where we were staying with family. Taking a nonstop flight into Kahului from the mainland may have put us in a different frame of mind when all of these mistakes came up. Shouldn't their internal room management system prevent these kinds of things? 2. Kapalua Bay beach overcrowding. Very good snorkeling here especially along the left hand side rocks when you are standing on the beach. Clear, not much swell, good fish variety and even an ulua or honu will make an appearance. But if you wait past 10 am to get there, be ready to walk a little to get an open spot and to have to walk or swim back to the left hand side rocks as that is the first part of the beach that fills up (closest to the parking lot). It's not a big beach, but if you want to snorkel you will need to go here versus the Ritz beach. That's mostly a sandbar-type beach and a good place for boogie boarding and also a bigger beach. All in all, based on the recovery made by Gin I would consider staying here again if I could be sure that caliber of Management response would take place in case the frontline personnel or systems couldn't get it coordinated (in other words if I could be assured of dealing with her). With the amount of other resorts nearby it's up to the individual traveler to decide if the Kapalua Villas are worth the expense unless things like using the Ritz Carlton's facilities (which Villas guests get to use) and preferential tee times at the Kapalua courses are important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great for group/families; not for couples”
Reviews.Author: chizzoy
Reviews.Content: Kapalua Villas was very nice and quiet (we were at the golf villas). If you prefer to stay away from high volume tourist areas such as Kaanappalli, Kapalua is the spot for you. It nice to have the condo-like atmosphere if you intend to cook and have a large family travelling. Kitchen had the basic pans/pots/dishes/utensils and best place to shop for groceries is nearby Napilli Market for groceries. My wife and I only cooked once during our four night stay and would probably stay at the Ritz (again, we did last year) instead since we didnt make too much use of all the space. Beware of the addtl $15/day resort fee which know one notifies you about until you check out. As usual, Kapalua is a very scenic community and very serene. Though most of our activities took place down the hill, it was nice to head back "home." We thought we'd get the best of both worlds since we had full access to Ritz ammendities; but probably would've preferred getting direct service from Ritz. Only issue I had is the fact that there were a couple of cockroaches that I had to kill on our first day. Other than that, housekeeping did a good job of taking care of the unit while we were out.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return to Kapalua Villas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for her best friend's wedding and our first anniversary. She booked the trip and made all the plans so I had no idea what to expect since it was our first trip to Hawaii. I was very happy with her choice. We stayed in the Kapalua Villas. We had originally reserved a golf villa but they moved us to a Bay Villa with a spectacular view. It was a one bedroom, 2 bath, level entry but a two story with a huge glass great room and master bedroom. It has a full kitchen, dinette and a sleeper sofa which we didn't use. We also made use of the washer and dryer. A car rental is a must and we rented a convertible which I really enjoyed. We stopped by a grocery store before we checked in and bought a lot of snacks and food for the week. We were a short drive to the beach, pool or the golf club houses. I played the Bay and Village course and brought my own clubs, the views were amazing. I can't wait to return. We were 15 minutes to Lahaina and about 45 minutes from the airport. Also a nice feature is that you have full use and charging privillages at the Ritz Carlton and it's restaurants and pool, Kapalua Golf Club House restaraunt, golf, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Kapalua Villas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Villas the beginnning of May for 5 nights and loved it. We have stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua (2004) and the Kapalua Bay Hotel (1999) and this was the best time we had! Our condo was in the Golf Villas and was great - we had an upstairs unit and had a lovely view of the ocean although it was no OCEAN FRONT! The place is a bit dated but very nice - our kitchen and bath looked like they were recently redone and the bed was VERY comfortable. Huge shower. Our unit had tons of kitchen supplies to cook with, beach chairs, beach umbrellas, furniture on the back deck, and even books to read on the beach! We had access to Ritz pool, etc. and also the Tennis Garden. The shuttle would take you where you wanted to go but we rented a car and took ourselves everywhere. There was also a really nice private pool right next to our condo that we could use. The grounds are perfectly maintained and was breathtaking to look at. We will definitely return and either return to Golf villas or pay a bit more for the Bay villas (oceanfront) but the in between units (the Ridge) were no better than the Golf Villas and didn't look worth any more money! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing in Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: valor155
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1BD condo in the Ridge Villas. I must say, I was immediately impressed with our villa. It was spacious and clean and felt so nice. Wonderful ocean view -- THIS IS A MUST! Pleasant, cool breezes. This place is so relaxing! Kapalua seems to be a great place to "get away from it all". Three great beaches. Awesome -- yup, better than Molokini -- snorkeling at Kapalua Bay. Save your cash as you'll see a larger variety of fish in Kapalua Bay than at Molokini. I'd say guest services is only so-so. Housekeeping never came at the same time of day, and the front desk seems a bit distant. We did see a couple of roaches Day 1 -- which astonished us considering how clean and nice the condo was -- and we told the front desk and a few hours later a guy came to spray. That took care of the only real issue we had with the place. I'm always a little leery of a place that charges a daily resort fee ($15 here). It seems like a cheapskate move to me, but, since we booked with Travelocity and their packages include all fees, we didn't have to pay it when we brought it up. BTW, we got a fantastic deal with Travelocity. It is awesome to stay in a 1.5M dollar condo for the rate we paid. Even though Kapalua Villas' service is so-so, the condo was so nice and our stay so pleasant (super comfy beds, too!) that I have to give it an Excellent rating. I definitely would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “4th time not a charm...”
Reviews.Author: Dinkali
Reviews.Content: Fourth time staying at the Villas...and the last. I had read some negative reviews and didn't give them much thought. Unfortunately, we found many of the reviews to be true. This visit we decided to upgrade to Ocean Front and stay at the Bay Villas for seven nights on the Golfer's Holiday Package. Even from the moment of registration...we knew things weren't as good as they were from our past visits. Before, we had been treated to pineapple juice and cool clothes/pineapple soap upon arrival. This time...we were just directed to a chair...waited for the six attempts from the receptionist to spell our name and find our reservation. Upon arrival at our villa, we thought things were looking up! The unit was beautiful and clean. (We weren't even bothered by all the little ants). We did miss the welcome back basket that had been waiting for us in the past. The bedding was very comfortable and pretty. The only complaint was the unit was next to the pool and we had to listen to kids playing instead of waves crashing for most of the day. Things were going pretty good until about the fourth day. The water heater went out. We understand that things break...it's just that when you're on vacation...you don't want to have to deal with problems. It would have been nice if the Villa's had taken care of it, but it was really hard for them. First, the maintenance guy (who was nice) couldn't find the hot water heater (we showed him). Next, we pointed out that the breaker had tripped...he insinuated we had flipped the switch. We had to use a messy and not so clean unit to finish showering in until they could figure out what to do. It goes on and on...the point being that we had to make all the phone calls, we had to ask for another unit, etc. We were finally moved to another unit, we were told that this was an upgraded unit and should be compensation for our trouble. The unit was the same, simply a mirror image of our original unit...our original unit was nicer. Enough about the Villas...on to the golf. Golf is always great...even on a bad day! However, the Golfer's Holiday package is not as great a value as it has been in the past. The price is about the same as in the past. Previously, it had been seven days unlimited golf and $100 merchandise voucher for any ProShop. Now they've gone to five rounds of golf...$25.00 for a replay on same day...and no merchandise vouchers (we were told it was still seven rounds unlimited golf when I made the reservation). Kudos to the The Plantation House and Roy's (for dinner). They surpassed our expectations as usual. The Kapalua Villas...world-class resort...unfortunately, not this time.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Villas were incredible”
Reviews.Author: august18
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a family trip to Hawaii. We spent our first week in Maui. We were travelling as a group of 6... 3 adults and 3 children. Trying to find accomodations for us that would be comfortable was challenging. We wanted something beautiful, convenient, confortable with lots of space to move around. The Kapalua Villas were all that and more. As previously mentioned in other posts, the way to ensure a beautiful upgraded villa such as the one we stayed in you must request the gold program. You will pay a slightly higher price but it is well worth it. The huge 2 bedroom villa had 2 master bedrooms each with its own ensuite bathroom, walk-in closet and large flat screen television. One bedroom had a lanai right off of it. The other had a washer and dryer (less glamorous but necessary). The kitchen had brand new stainless appliances and top of the line pots, pans, knives, stemware, flatware, etc... It was amazing! The dining area had a big glass table and there was also a dining table on the lanai off of the living room area. The living room had a pullout sofa and a flat screen television as well as some chairs, a coffee table, etc... The furnishings were tasteful and luxurious. The staff there were so accomodating, helpful in every way that they could be. They were kind, patient and always went the extra mile to please us. I highly, highly recommend this resort to anyone. We were all delighted and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of the Ridge Villas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ...agoodday
Reviews.Content: If you must stay at Kapalua Villas, insist on a Golf Villa. While staying in a Ridge Villa, our condo was broken into while we slept and we were robbed. Fortunately, we were not physically harmed. Management was -- shall we say -- less than helpful -- we even had to ASK to be moved to another condo(which turned out to be smaller with fewer upgrades)in a safer location in one of the Golf Villas. I would not recommend Kapalua Villas due to the poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff, okay digs”
Reviews.Author: uptowntravels
Reviews.Content: While the view was great the staff was AWFUL. They were not helpful at all (and we are not high maintence) They changed the locks while we were there. While they gave us a letter saying that MAY happen, they never informed us the night before as the letter stated. When we brought this up, we were rudely told more than once that they gave us a letter. A manager was finally brought out and gave us a minimal sorry. This was at check out. Prior to that we heard a word from no one - it was the maintence guys who got us the new card key - no one called to apologize, nothing! A roadside motel would have handled it better. To have spent 350+ a nite - deplorable. There were other things but...just don't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ridge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ridge Villas for 2 weeks late February. It was very nice and spacious. Ocean View was great for sitting on the patio and watching the whales. The use of the Ritz Carlton Pools was nice. Three beautiful beaches to choose from all within walking distance. There is more of a breeze at Kapulua but it makes it nice to cool off the Villa by opening the windows. A short 15 min drive to Kanapali to tour another great set of beaches and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Our Only Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wouldn't stay anywhere else on Maui because we love this location. It's out of the traffic crawl and so close to the amenities of the Ritz Carlton where we treat ourselves for dinner now and then. The unit we rented was in Villa 21 and was impeccably clean. High speed internet is a requisite for us ---- no problem there. We like golf -- no problem. We like hiking and snorkeling --we use the Maui Trailblazer guide to get around -- no problem. We like it quiet -- again, everyone there respected that, at least when we were there. The ocean view from our unit was to die for and the whales were especially frisky almost every morning. We never used the air conditioning, just used the screens to ventilate because we wanted to hear the ocean. Try to rent an end unit so you're not sandwiched in. We hung out at the Ritz Carlton Beach when we weren't hiking. Gorgeous! We will always return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation at Kapalua Villas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at the Bay Villas in Kapalua. We stayed in unit 29 B3, a 2-story 1-bedroom unit. It was beautiful. The living room had a sectional with a sofabed. The kitchen was remodeled with granite counter tops and was very well equiped, even with a rice cooker. The full bath and master was upstairs and the view was spectacular. Mattress could have been a little cushier and I would have preferred upgraded bedding. The pool near the unit was small, but comfortable and very clean. There was a gas grill by the pool that was very clean and easy to use. My 17 year old and I had facials at the spa at the Ritz. Pricey, but very nice. One of the nice features at the Kapalua resort is that you can charge things at the Kapalua Bay Hotel, and the Ritz Carlton to your room. Also used the pool at the Ritz Carlton and the Kapalua Bay Hotel, but we spent most of our time at Kapalua Bay. It's beautiful and very sheltered so the snorkeling was great, even for our 12 year old. The $15/day resort fee included free high speed internet access and free telephone, including long distance and parking of course. We would definitely return to this unit. The views were fantastic. Saw whales right out front. Kapalua is a little windier than places further south so it was windy on the lanai, but the view was worth it. The villas are quiet and peaceful and not the place to be if you want a lot of activity and hustle and bustle. On the other hand, if you want someplace beautiful, luxurious and peaceful I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Love affair-Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: CTraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay at Kapalua. I cannot say enough good things about this resort. We stay at the Golf Villas for the value (under 400/ night). However, you can use the entire resort's facilities; including the Ritz and the Bay Hotel, the latter about to undergo a major reconstruction. The Villas offer their own pools; we had 2 afternoons there without a another soul insight...and a view that is breathtaking. You must visit the Plantation course, and the clubhouse-simply stunning. The resort staff are always friendly and accomodating. Maui is expensive, so budget acccordingly. But with these views and weather, who cares? The Ritz pool is a particular favorite-tropical drinks and attentive staff and 3 tiers of warm, crystal water...Kapalua is only 15 mins from Whaler's village (huge night life) and another 5 mins to Lahaina. You will not be dissappointed... I have, luckily, been too many places, and Kapalua is in my top 3. Going back in Sept!

Reviews.Title: “We Love Kapalua!”
Reviews.Author: Miney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a fantastic week in a one bedroom oceanfront Kapalua Bay villa (unit #21B3), rented through VRBO. It offered a commanding view of the ocean, Molokai, both the Bay and Plantation golf courses, and the west Maui mountains. We saw incredible sunrises from bed every morning. This specific unit was 2-story with a lanai outside both the living (lower) and bedroom (upper level). It had updated furniture and a newer, well equipped kitchen. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The only real weakness was the bathroom... while serviceable it was not updated (25+ years old I think) and would have benefited from new fixtures and better lighting. Also, there was no A/C, but strong trade winds kept the unit relatively cool. Oneloa Bay was a minute's walk from our front door. Beautiful to look at and nice to stroll, but IMO not a good snorkeling or swimming beach thanks to wind and surf conditions. It was only a short 7 minute walk to Kapalua Bay, where the sunning, swimming and snorkeling is fabulous. Several other great snorkeling beaches were nearby as well. A very nice swimming pool was just a 100 or so feet away. With several wonderful restaurants on the property, plus Kaanapali and Lahaina only a 15 minute drive away, there are countless dining (and shopping) alternatives. One last comment on the Villas: I agree with other reviews regarding the variability of the units, and highly recommend you perform a good deal of research before selecting a unit. If money is not a big deal, next time I would rent from Kapalua Realty and reserve a unit from their "Gold Program" (Google "Kapalua Gold" for more info). There was one next door to us that I got to tour, and it was first class. Also, if an unobstructed view is important to you, be advised that not all of the Bay units are truly oceanfront; many view other units. In summary, Kapalua is a wonderful destination and in our opinion this unit represented an excellent value for the money. If you do your homework, we think you will love Kapalua too!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: nzhang94404
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Golf Villas Unit 15-V-1 with our two young children (2 and 5 years old). This is a one bed-room unit looking out onto the golf course and ocean (in the distance). What we liked: 1)They are good with details: detergents are provides so you can run your washing machine, dish washer, or simply just wash your dished in the sink 2)There are 1 and 1/2 bathroom in the unit, making it easy to have privacy; the shower was great, kids love playing in the shower 3)The unit was BIG. Kids have space to run around or hang out on the porch 4)Service was friendly - they say housekeeping is twice a week but they change towels everyday and if we put all our dishes in the washer they run it for us everyday! 5)Our drive to these great places take less than 2 minutes: the beautiful Kapalua beach, the exclusinve pools and beach in Ritz Carlton, Napili beach (very nice and full of people if you get a little lonely in the secluded villas), the serene Kapalua bay Hotel 6)All phone calls are free incuding long-distance Here are a few reality checks: 1) The king bed was not as comfortable as those in upscale hotels (e.g.,regular hotel blanket rather than plush comforters) 2)The pool in the property is small - we just use the pools at Ritz 3)It is more secluded so if you like to see a lot of people and make friends with other travelers this might not be your kinda of place Overall we thought this was a wonderful vacation spot for us. Next time we might check out Napili Kai Resort because it looks like a fun area wth more people to interact with and walking distance to the beach Best reagards, A traveler from California

Reviews.Title: “Villas were great!”
Reviews.Author: KarenKearney
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights at the Kapalua golf villas. We have been to Hawaii 6 times and this is our favorite place yet. The Kapalua community consists of 3 golf courses, use of 2 hotel pools and beaches, shuttle service, great restaurants and more. We chose the ocean view villa and it was great! The Ritz had a great pool and lawn games that the kids enjoyed like shuffleboard, mini golf and bochee(?) They have a shuttle to take you down to the beach where the waves are rough. My daughter broke her foot bodysurfing in the 8 foot waves. One day the beach was closed because of the conditions. Don't eat at the Ritz though. The hamburgers at the pool bar were $15 and a soda was $5. Thanksgiving buffet was $90 per person! The Plantation House and Pineapple Grill had great lunches. They are on the golf courses. Enjoyed the golf. You get a nice discount on green fees for staying there. There was daily maid service and they even gave you 2 boxes of Tide detergent for laundry daily. It was very nice to have the washer and dryer. We had 2 lanais in our villa. The main one was so large with chaise lounges and table and chairs. The community pools were close and peaceful. They had nice gas grills for your use. Next time I would grill a couple of nights. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the Unit--Stay away from Villa 20 G5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with several previous reviewers--it completely depends on the villa you rent. We wanted ocean front, and the first unit we checked into (#21 G4)was phenomenal, gorgeous upgrades, great views. Unfortunately, we found out our second day that the unit above us was under construction, and rather than listen to the hammering, sawing, and conversation of the work crew, we asked to be moved to a new villa. The staff was more than accomodating and moved us that day. To our dismay, the new unit was nothing like the first. Cheap and old furnishings, bed like a brick (my lower back is still aching), no sliding doors to lanai, overall not up to the $350/night price tag. Both units were very clean and neat however, so no complaints there. I would stay here again because the location is awesome, you have full use of the amenities at the Ritz and Kapalua Bay Hotel, and the private beaches are practically deserted in November. Just don't stay in Villa #20 G5. Request to stay in Villa 21 G4 (the first villa we were in) and you will be more than pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic !!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Kapalua to celebrate out 25th Wedding Anniversary. I was a little hesitant about reserving a villa but that quickly changed. From the moment we arrived we were very pleased with everything. The condo was beautiful!! It was upgraded to everything you needed and looked fabulous. The view was superb and the people were very friendly and accomodating. My wife and I played golf on all three of the championship courses where the scenic views were unbelievable. We used the Kapalua Bay beach all the time and the snorkeling was great. The restrauants were excellent and the on-site grocery store was very good. It had everything you would need when talking about staple items, sunblock, souvenirs etc. The grounds were landscaped and kept up beautifully. Even though Kapalua is the northwestern most resort on the island it was still only 15 - 20 minutes from Lahaina. Overall, it was a fantastic experience / vacation / anniversary and if we do ever get a chance to go to Maui again I would definitley stay at the Kapalua Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in unit 29-G-5. The decor has not changed from our visit in 1989. The same kitchen/bathrooms; however new appliances and countertops and OK furnishings. The view for our Bay villa was terrible. We paid a premium to look right into the side of the unit next to us. Rather than a glimpse of the ocean when you looked 60 degrees to the left, we saw the guy next door in his undershirt at his kitchen sink. As a result, we kept the blinds closed most of the time. Better do the ridge or the golf villas for less money when all you look at is the Hunter/Douglas Duet shades anyway! By renting through the Villas, we had use of the Bay Hotel and Ritz Carlton facilities. Well worth it!!! The Bay Hotel pool, while slightly less spectacular than the Ritz, had a wonderful ocean front setting and ambiance that made it our favorite. The golf package made golf reasonably affordable. While they messed up the layout of our previous favorite, The Village Course, when they added the new practice/lesson facility, (it now has a par three as hole number one and a par three as hole number 18!) golf here is still fabulous. (Even considering they had just aerated the greens of the Bay Course). 4 hour rounds (except for a weekend round on The Plantation Course) and great staff made golf very enjoyable. The location, while at the far end of Maui is supurb. Don't stay here if you want night life and lots of excitement. Stay here if you want great accomodations, great food and great golf. It's laid back and luxurious! The views are wonderful. Vino, the restaurant at the Village Course Clubhouse, was a treat - good food in tapas portions and a nice wine list. The Plantation House has great fish specials and spectacular sunset views and The Ritz Carlton was divine! We have visited four times in 15 years. We'll be back, but next time at a Ridge Villa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but ...”
Reviews.Author: yankeedave
Reviews.Content: First, the location is not the greatest. They're at the western tip of Maui, where the paved road ends, so anytime you want to go anywhere, you've got a drive ahead of you. Not that's a bad drive, but it can get a bit tiresome, and if you want to see sights on the eastern side of the island, like Hana, you'd better start early. As for the villas - when we got there, the place looked great, we had an ocean view - terrific. Until we saw the ants. LOTS of them. Little ants in every room. The guy came and said he found where they were coming from and sprayed but there were still a lot of them in the place. We called the office and they were able to relocate us to another villa overlooking the golf course. From then on it was great. Very nice accomodations, clean, spacious, everything you could want. A supermarket and restaurants were a short drive down the road. If I went back, though, I think I'd look for a more central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our vacation in Maui staying in a golf villa (T-22-4) at the Kapalua Resort. We were so pleased!!!! After reading the reviews on this website and learning about Ridge Realty, we booked our vacation through Ridge Realty. Ridge Realty was outstanding! The condo was newly renovated and beautifully decorated. We had a problem with our TV in the master bedroom and after placing a call to Ridge Realty they brought us a brand new TV within a few minutes. We were extremely pleased with their service. As far as the resort, we loved it!!! We were looking for a place that was secluded and not crowded. We saw less than 5 people in the entire golf villa area during the entire week. The golf at Kapalua is tough with a lot of winds, however the views are gorgeous!! We snorkeled in the Kapalua Bay Beach and saw many fish as well as sea turtles. If you are looking for a resort that is close to alot of activities and restaurants, this resort is not for you. However, if you are looking for a resort that is a quiet nice peaceful getaway then I highly recommend this resort. My husband and I are planning our return visit after having such a wonderful week!!

Reviews.Title: “We were upgraded to a villa and it was amazing”
Reviews.Author: choudie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Maui for the last part of our honeymoon and it was amazing. The hotel upgraded us from a garden view to a villa with an ocean view and pretty much a private beach. It was simply amazing. The view was amazing and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “terrific room and view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults and 2 kids) stayed at the Ridge villas Aug 13-20, 2005. Kapalua villas are grouped into golf, ridge and bay villas. The ridge units are on a ridge and every unit has an awesome ocean view and a large balcony. Our unit was very nicely renovated, with granite kitchen and bathrooms. Our 1 bedroom, 2 bath unit was about 1200 sq ft, roughly the size of the first floor of our home, and even has a washer and dryer! They provided everything, including laundry and dishwasher detergents. This condo truly is as convenient as a fully equipped home. We booked through Costco travel. I must say that there are probably a few units that are not as well maintained as each unit is individually owned and maintained. But you can always ask for a different unit if you're not happy. Be advised that you pay $10/day resort fee which includes parking, shuttle service, and most importantly, FREE long distance phone use pretty much anywhere in the world. That's right, we called relatives in China and the Philippines and talked as long as we wanted to. For those who love Japanese food, the famous Sansei Japanese restaurant is a 5 to 10 minute walk from the ridge villas. The best Japanese food I've had is still at Nobu Matsuhisa's original restaurant, Matsuhisa in Beverly Hills, but Sansei comes close, for less money. We also tried Plantation restaurant, which has a great view but the food was not as inspiring. The restaurant at the Kapalua Bay Hotel, Gardenia Court, served mediocre food. We went on a snorkel trip on the Four Winds II, to the Molokini crator, which is billed as a must-see for snorkeling. I feel it's way overrated. Even if you don't get sea sick on the 1 hr 15 min trip, the variety of fish and coral is underwhelming. I had a better experience snorkeling around Black Rock in Kaanapali, which is free. You just park at the Whaler Village, walk up to the beach next to the Sheraton, and snorkel around the Black Rock. It was amazing, as good as anything I've seen in Kauai and the Big Island. I even swam next to a big turtle, which can usually be found if you venture a bit to the deeper waters. Let's see. My wife and her mom went to the Luau at the Marriot, and thought that it was the most entertaining luau she has seen (we've been to 2 others on the other Hawaiian islands). In summary, I highly recommend the beautiful, spacious ridge villas, which have ocean views to die for. The weather in Kapalua was supposed to be in the high 80's when we were there, but it felt 10 degrees cooler because of the constant breeze. Very pleasant. The wind was never too strong. Even though our unit had AC, we never used it because the breeze and ceiling fan made it so pleasant. The attached picture was taken from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: 2sunflowers
Reviews.Content: I don't know how the Kapalua Villas Maui, HI get to be one of the top places to stay. They have poor service, the people just don't care and don't do their job. My husband and I were told in a joking manner not to call them if I had a problem. They have very poor security. We had an attempted break in the first night there. Nothing was taken than GOD! Security came but were not competent. No one called the next day to see if we were alright. There was no airconditioning in the master bedroom. They never fixed it, as it was the wrong voltage for the wiring. Mind you they knew 6 months prior that we would be staying at the Villas and we wanted a newly rennovated, King Size, Ocean Front Room with airconditioning and paid in advance. The unit we received as I said had no airconditioning in the master bedroom, the rennovations were cheap home depot rennovations. They had bugs and salomandars. The units are old, attract bugs if you leave food out like cereal. The safe was not working, cheap too and could easily be broken into. They charge extra $10.40 a day for maid service. This is not an option they will charge your credit card. For $307.00 a night I expected more. You can use the pool at the Ritz but they don't like it. They know you are from the Villas and you don't get the same quality of service. They will ask you to bring your own towels, like they did us. The reception at the Villa said we could use the pool and towels at the Ritz at no charge. We received poor service at the pool because they know you are not staying at the Ritz. How do they know. You won't have one of those Pineapple bags or the Ritz lounge cover. When we asked for one they said they were out of them. Not more than a minute, someone with the pineapple bag asked for one--not only did they get a terry cloth cover for their lounge but they received a towel and got escorted to a lounge of their choice. It was cloudy, rainy and windy on this part of the island. There are much better places to stay than here. DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Villas are a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dutchy49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kapalua Viilas from July 13-19. My wife and I, plus our three adult children, stayed at the Golf Villas, Building 11, Villa T-2. Based upon past reviews, we requested, and received, a recently renovated unit that was also non-smoking. We did book through a travel agency but they used the Kapalua Villas main office to make all the arrangements. The unit was great, with spectacular views of Kapalua Bay while overlooking the golf course. The only negative was that the refrigerator broke down after our second night. We called, but a repair person didn't come out until the next day. We did have ice cream melt and some of our food spoiled but management did give us a credit when we checked out. Hey, those things happen. The unit was very well stocked, as previously described by others. A toaster oven would have made a good addition but we got by with all the other appliances. The only bug we encountered inside was a dead roach in one closet. There were many cute birds that visited us every day on our spacious lanai and lots of small lizards running around outside. Maid service was nice but they only did a thorough job of housecleaning every third day. It was an extremely spacious two bedroom unit, with a really nice twin shower in the master bedroom. Lots of closet space in both bedrooms. The sleeper sofa was really not that good but most of them usually aren't. Since only one of our children used it, he found that it was actually better to leave the sofa unopened since the sofa itself was very long and was quite comfortable as a single bed. There are several pools around the complex and we did use one of the gas grills provided at the pool nearest to our unit. It was really clean. It was another pleasant plus. Pools at the Ritz and Kapalua Bay are nice but were a bit crowded. Snorkeling off of Kapalua Bay is great. Just rent equipment from one of the local companies which are close by or through either hotel, but check out rates first and what quality of mask is provided. Oh, the Kapalua Villas also provide a free (just tip the poor driver) shuttle to any of the other hotels, door to door. That's also a big plus. Staying at the Villas provided the best of all worlds for a family. The money we saved on meals that we prepared while in our unit allowed us to go to better places to eat when we did eat out. Prices on Maui are high for everything, even the food stores (at least twice as expensive as New Jersey prices), but you know it before you go there. That's part of the price of paradise. Staying at the Villas allowed us to squeeze more out of our vacation funds.

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back from The Ridge”
Reviews.Author: furgboutit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an ocean view 2 bedroom/3 bath Ridge unit during our Maui stay for 2 weeks and were quite pleased with the experience - this was our first time in a rented condo and we had some anxiety since we are typically hotel people on vacations. Kapalua is a beautful, somewhat isolated area on the northern part of Maui and is very lush - lots of pine trees, grass, and hills. The Kapalua Villas appealed to us because we were getting a pretty large living area, 2 bedrooms and the ability to cook whenever we didnt feel like going to a restaurant. However, since the Ritz Carlton (a five minute drive or 10 minute walk within the Kapalua resort area) allows the guests of the Ridge/Kapalua Villas to use their pool and recreational facilities without a charge, we felt like we were getting many of the benefits of staying at a luxury resort while getting the value of a condo. The unit itself was pretty nice, although it could probably use a bit of a facelift some time soon (kitchen was a bit dated). Everything was very clean and worked fine upon arrival. We sprang for a unit with a/c, which we would recommend not so much for the heat, but because it is a humid area and the a/c helped to make things a bit more pleasant. By the way, the a/c is not a central unit. Each bedroom had a window unit which cooled down the bedrooms, but didnt do much for the living room. The unit was spacious and we never felt confined or cramped during the 2 weeks. The view from our unit was magnificent - facing the ocean from a hill which was about a quarter mile from the shore. We had a very large balcony outside the living room and another two small balconies outside the bedrooms. The management company that rented to us, Ridge Realty, was very professional and helped us with our requests prior to and during the stay - they got us into the type of unit we wanted even though we were staying at a busy time, and they ensured that everything was delivered as promised. I have heard that their units are better than the units managed by other realty agents in the area. The area itself is nice, although anyone staying should be aware that this part of the island is windier and a bit cloudier than the more touristy areas - Kaanapali and Wailea (the weather at times disappointed us, but at other times, we were actually happy to have a constant breeze cooling us down at the pool). On a positive note, the area is quieter and less congested than the more popular areas on the island, so there is a tradeoff to balance. Also, Kapalua is about as far north as you can get, which means it is further from the main airport and some of the major sights such as Haleakala, Hana Hwy, Upcountry area than Wailea or Kaanapali. This didnt bother us much but may be a factor for those who want to be near the popular sights. Those considering the Kapalua Villas should be aware that housekeeping service is sometimes extra extra depending on who you rent from. I believe some other rental agencies include a once a week service, but we paid $95 per cleaning. I'd say that if we decide to stay in Maui again, we would definitely consider the Ridge again - it was a very good value and met our expectations for cleanliness, convenience and quality of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE VILLAS! Went for our honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: Foodiegrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the villas (ocean front) the first half of our honeymoon and it was great. The villas are clean, quite and spacious. The view of the ocean is amazing! We loved the fact it was close to Lahiana and Kananapali but still secluded in it's own little niche on the island! We loved the kitchen as it was nice for us to cook breakfast and to store our drinks in the full size fridge! It was also nice to have the villa give us a 'honeymoon' basket during our stay which included a lot of goodies from Maui. We loved the fact we could use all the amenities at the Ritz. We also thought the Ritz was great and would probably stay there next time too. The food at the Ritz was great!! We also stayed at the Kea Lani Fairmont Resort in Waiela and it was SO NOT WORTH THE MONEY. Service was bad, except for the valet and bell desk and the rooms were not that great (our ocean deluxe suite...it was a partial ocean, mainly Four Season's villa view!) The villas were far superior and we loved it! We didnt care for Maui in general as the locals didnt really seem to care or give off the 'island' friendliness they do in Oahu. Are they bitter about Maui becoming more and more touristy? Who knows?! In general, the best food we had was at I'O on front street in Lahania. We had our reception dinner there and the food was excellent, again the best we had on Maui and the service was great! The views of the ocean while we dine and drink are great since there's the little beach in front of the resturant. I also read about Maui Tacos and the rave reviews so we decided we had to try it....it was NOT good and NOT that inexpensive as everyone said. My husband had the fish tacos and I had the burrito and it was something I could have made at home...if not better. I know good tacos and burritos but these were not even close to OK! So dont waste your time going there. I would recommend going to Aloah Mixed Plate, the food was cheap and the korean bbq plate was great! We went there several times! All in all we enjoyed Maui...but it's more for older couples or families, not really for 20 somethings. However when we do go back to Maui in another 10 years or so...we will want to go to the Villas or Ritz...and possibly the Hyatt! Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Kapalua and the Villas”
Reviews.Author: CookinCO
Reviews.Content: I grew up going to the various islands of Hawaii and have stayed at most of the big name hotels. There is nothing better for us than staying at the Kapalua Villas. We have stayed at the Bay Villas, the Ridge Villas and the Golf Villas. As others have indicated, they are individually owned so you may be shown one you do not like, but dont despair as they will continue to show you others until you are happy (at least they have for us!). Staying at Kapalua cannot be beat. It is close enough to Kaanapali and Lahaina to get out and do things, but far enough away to enjoy the quietness of the island. We have done the Molikini and Lanai snorkeling trips and have found there is no better snorkeling than at Kapalua Bay! My husband loves the golf at Kapalua too. The other nice thing about staying at a condo vs. a hotel, particularly if you have children, is the ability to eat breakfast in your condo and not have to eat out every single meal! Some nights, it is nice to just stay in and eat a Maui Taco or two!!!! Maui No Ka Oi and the same goes for Kapalua!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just had to write a review of the Kapalua Villas in Maui, as we relied on the Trip Advisor reviews prior to our trip in June 2005, and had found little current information in the Advisor. "Bottom line" is that clearly this is "the best place to stay for the family of 5" in Maui. We booked our trip thru Classic Custom Vacations, who were a great asset throughout the trip, and insured that we were able to get the "best villa" available. We called in advance, and received a great two bedroom fairway villa within the Kapaula Golf Villas (Unit 12-P2), which was on the 10th fairway of the Bay Course at Kapalua, and the whole family absolutely loved it! I was concerned about the "bug stories", and the lack of an "Ocean View" villa going in, but had no problems with either, as the Fairway villa did, in fact, have an Ocean view, and our vacation was "bug free". My wife and I have three kids (15,13,9), and the two bedroom villa was the perfect alternative to our previous 2004 stay (wife and I alone) at the Kapalua Bay Hotel. Guests at the Villa have full use of the facilities at both the Kapaua Bay Hotel and Ritz Carlton Hotels, and we used both extensively. The Kapalua Bay Hotel has the best "snorkel beach" around, along with a great pool, while the Ritz offers a great series of "waterfall pools" , with a "sandy beach alternative" to the "snorkel, coral beach" of Kapaula Bay. We also had a "semi-private" pool adjacent to our Villa, so we truly had the best of all worlds. Golfers have to stay here (I played twice, but could have played a lot more). "Villas" offer the best family meal alternativeas well, so you can choose to eat any specific breakfast, lunch or dinner meal with the full kitchen, when you get tired of spending $80-$100 per meal during an extended stay here (ours was 8 days). The money you save makes the Villa the best cost alternative around. When we did go out for dinner, the "Pineapple Grill" (a short walk out the back door of our Villa) and Vino's (Italian Tapas and Wine Bar) at the Village Course were excellent choices for us. Kapalua is a short 15-20 minute ride to the Kannapali and Lahina "strips", but offer a much "quieter, get-away" alternative to the "commercial hotels" at either location. We spent the last day in Wailea, looking at the Grand Wailea. Four Seasons, etc., and found the Fairmount Kea Lani as the only, "real" secondary choice for our families taste. But, Go to Kapalua- you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at Kapalua at The Ridge Villa #2014 and loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kapalua at The Ridge villa No. 2014 and loved it. It is a two bedroom/three bath condo with gorgeous ocean views from all rooms. It feels huge, being all on one floor. Open up the wood louvres and the ocean breeze comes in, keeping things cool but still Hawaiian. You look down into the ocean from a ridge and can see the changes in sea water coloring caused by changing sea floor depths. You also look at two lava flows extending into the sea with waves crashing over them. Watch whales and porpoises jump in the Molokai Channel, large sail boats, board and wind surfers, and the green island of Molokai. You can also watch golfers in the distance tee off and putt on Kapalua's Bay golf course on the signature hole by the ocean. More than 180 degree view of the ocean. It's wonderful! Walk to 3 different beaches and two luxory hotels, restaurants, shops, and two tennis gardens. There are gas barbeques for cooking in the pool areas. This is in addition to world class wonderful golfing. Tip: walk to breakfast at either the little plantation store on the main road into Kapalua, or walk around the lava tip to the south of Kapalua Beach to Napilli Bay where there is a great omelette shack. Also, lunch at the Plantation club house shouldn't be missed. Great views of the PGA tournament golf course and the ocean; great food; great service. The nearby Ritz Hotel is beautiful and welcoming and always has something interesting going on. This is a great place for those who want more of the real Hawaii, more interesting weather, great beaches, and less of the crowd. It's at the end of the road Maui (almost). We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Villas not up to Par!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently celebrated our 10 wedding anniversary and since we golf, what better place to golf than Kapalua. The golf courses were great (too bad the planation course was closed). On the downside, we were so disappointed in our villa. Very dated, mold in the shower, musty smell and wall to wall carpets that were not very clean. The front desk did their best to find us something more appropriate. After seeing 5 other unit, we settled on an ocean front unit (no smell, no carpets). The unit was much better but still could use an upgrade in the bathroom. Of course, the view was the best part. I think people who are thinking of booking at Kapalua, must realize that the units are 30+ years old and indepentently own and the owners are not obliged to renovate. This is what we were told from the person at the front desk. So if you go, you must ask for a renovated unit. As for the rest of the Kapalua area - it is very pretty, peaceful and the beaches nice and the restaurants very good.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua Was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently won a trip anywhere in the world I wanted to go. It took awhile and a lot of thought and we finally decided on a Golf Trip to Kapalua for four weeks. We stayed in the Golf Villas, and ours had just been Completely redone inside, it was great. We also had 12 rounds of Golf included, 4 rounds for the two of us with a cart at each course. The guys at the course could not have been nicer, they were super. That trip as I said was for anywhere in the world I wanted to go and I really think that for what we like to do I picked the best. Now I just have to win a lottery because it was a bit expensive. Also we had a car for the 28 days which is almost a neccessity at Kapalua. It's 20 minutes or so from Lahaina and shopping. It is deffinetly one of the best trips we've ever taken and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families and couples! (long)”
Reviews.Author: Dimara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ridge Villas in Feb 2005 for 5 nights and then moved to the Kihei/Wailea area. Kapalua was the family favorite. We found it as beautiful as Wailea (tho Wailea had more tropical plants) and much quieter than Kihei. We should note that we were there over Valentines and President's Day weekend - so Kihei was esp. busy and traffic on the island was at times very backed up. Our Ridge Villa was peaceful, private and well kept. We loved the atmosphere at the resort. It never felt touristy or overly busy tho it looked like the Ritz and the Villas were fully booked. Because of the size of the resort, you never felt limited to just one building, hotel or pool and could choose according to your mood that day. Our young teenage kids prefered this atmosphere over busy Kihei. They used the shuttle to go to the beach, the Ritz pool and the Honolua Store. They loved the snorkeling at Kapalua Bay and the drive "Over the Top' of the island. After I read the reviews I was somewhat worried about Kapalua's 'remoteness' and the stories about bugs. We loved it. Napili and Kaanapali are 5- 15 min. away and that drive was much more relaxing and usually faster than driving from our Kihei condo to the Kihei Safeway! (Take your Costco and Safeway cards with you ! ) Perhaps it was the convertible that made driving so enjoyable? Bugs, thankfully, were non existent in our villa. The Ridge is not ocean front but has beautiful views of the ocean with lovely greenery in front. We toured the Bay Villas as well and found them to be less private (lots of windows and close together - but more exclusive.) They are oceanfront but not beachfront. Our Villa had it's own BBQ which we really appreciated, many other complexes in Maui have shared BBQ areas. There were also public BBQ's at the Villa pools, along with a small library. The Ridge units are large compared to the other Maui condos we saw. Our 1 bedroom was 1300+ (incl. the lanai.) The main bedroom was large as was the ensuite. Our unit had air conditioning and we used it a few times. Ask the rental company for an updated unit if this is important to you. We were told that some rental companies grade units and only accept those in A and A+ condition into their rental pools. THe rental companies offer charging privileges at the hotels and stores as well as golfing packages. Private rentals will cost less and not include some of these extras. Depends on what you prefer/require. Either way ask lots of questions and be specific about your needs. Weather was fine when we were at there - preferred the changing Kapalua weather to constant sun on the south side. We found evenings cool on both sides of the island. Wind was an issue on both sides as well - but we were told that an unusually windy front moved thru that week. One possible downside at Kapalua: Who to call with general questions eg. how do we register for the pineapple plantation tour, closest internet cafe (Napili Market) or Ritz (high rates - business/adult not teenager geared). Found the rental agency quite helpful. Quick notes: Honolua store: handy and reasonably priced, small deck outdoors for eating. Catholic church right next door to store - standing room only on the Sunday we went. Sansei at Kapalua Bay Hotel has 50% off on Thurs. and Fri nights after 10:00pm if your passion is sushi. New development happening here in 2006 - Kapalua Bay hotel is being demolished and new owner/membership type facility is going in. Rental prices expected by some to increase in this area as it becomes more exclusive. Car is required. On maps Honolua store looks like a short walk from the Ridge across one of the golf holes, however a ravine and fence make direct crossing pretty much impossible. If I was doing the Hana drive from Kapalua vs. southside - I might choose to spend a night in Hana depending on how many stops and sights were on my itinerary. Get the book Maui Revealed and read up before you go. Enjoy Kapalua!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite spot on out two week trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the ridge and loved it. The condo was clean and very welll located. We had snorking at Kapalua Bay, surfing at Onida, and relaxation at the pool at the ritz. The Access to the Ritz amentties is a huge benefit. Thr prices are very fair. We booked trhrough Kapalua Ride Reaity. Great experience. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent our honeymoon (08/18/04-08/29/04) in Maui and stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas. We reserved a 1 bedroom ocean front condo through a travel agency back on the mainland. The first unit that we stayed in was a little thrashed (out-dated furniture/ washing machine broken). This unit had a beautiful view however not much privacy since it was a lower level unit. We asked the staff at the rental office if we could switch to another unit and they were very accomidating. They moved us (the staff moved our luggage and fridge items for us) into a beautiful two-level 1 bedroom condo that was absolutely AWESOME. The number of the unit is 22-B3. Very nicely appointed, remodeled kitchen and gorgeous views. We took full advantage of being able to use the facilities at both the Kapalua Bay Hotel and Ritz Carlton. The Bay Hotel has the most beautiful grounds and we had a blast snorkling with the sea turtles. As far as the bug stories go, we only came across one rather large roach in the condo however quickly relocated him outside. This was the only bug encounter we had while we were there. We will definitely be staying at the Kapalua Bay Villas again in the future and recommend that you reserve directly through the Kapalua Bay Villas rental office.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 8 nights at the Kapalua Villas and would go back again any time. Having read the reviews on this site I was very concerned about what we were going to find once we checked in but we were pleasantly surprised to get a fantastic villa in The Ridge development. I had booked 'ocean view' and expected to get maybe a glimpse of the ocean but our villa had the most amazing ocean views on three sides. We requested air conditioning but was told there were no units available with ac until the following day. However, it wasn't necessary in the end as the properties are built with adequate ventilation and once you open all the louvered panels in the rooms the tradewinds just keep flowing through. I spoke with one of the realty staff about the bad reviews I had read and he explained that as each villa is privately owned the conditions can vary. He also explained that the the Kapalua Villas rental facility now 'grade' each property either A or A- and will not rent out properties that fall below those grades. So my guess is if you rent through an independant rental agent you may be getting a property that the resort rental people have rejected. The golf courses were fantastic and being able to use the facilities at both the Ritz Carlton and Bay Hotel were an added bonus. We also used the resort pool, which was within walking distance of our villa, and had it pretty much to ourselves. It is a much quieter resort than those in the Kanapaali area and families with children may prefer a livlier environment. My only complaint would be the 'laid back' attitude of the staff when we checked out - I stood for at least 5 minutes with 8 staff behind the desk either chatting among themselves or staring at their computer screens, all ignoring me completely, even when I asked if someone could help me they all stopped, looked at me, and then went back to what they were doing !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned home today from a 7 night stay at the Villas. We stayed at the Bay Villas and had an oceanview that was amazing. The room was very large and nicely decorated. The kitchen was really handy to have your snaks, if you don't want to eat out the kitchen is great. The bathroom was my favorite part of the room it was huge! The entire wall was mirrors and it had two separate sinks so it was easy for us to both get ready at the same time. Most of the rooms have no air conditioning. I did not feel it was necessary b/c of the breeze. If you get hot easily request a unit with air. Having a rental car is a must, there are very few things in walking distance. I recommend going to the Honolua Store for snacks and beer, it is much cheaper than the grocery store and they have breakfast and sandwiches. The golf courses are beautiful and very challenging (mostly b/c of the wind). I did not mind the wind at all I thought it was wonderful, you can lay on the beach all day and not feel hot. You will have to walk to the beach, the water around the villas is mostly surrounded by lava rock, but at most it is a 5 min. walk (depending on which beach you use). The villas do offer shutteling services free of charge. The most practical beach is at the Kapalua Bay Hotel (5 min walk) it is great for snorkeling and is less windy. If you are a surfer I recommend the beach inbetween the the villas and the Ritz, great waves, but more wind there. You can use the neighboring hotels services, but be careful of the Ritz, they will charge you for everything, including use of there fitness center and a $30 charge for unreturned towels. We had the breakfast buffet there one morning, the view was good and so was the food but it was $54 for two buffets. I really didn't think things were as expensive as I thought they would be. My meals ranged from $12 -30 per person and that was for steak and seafood. Eating is part of a vacation so splurge, it was worth it. Going shopping on Front St. in Lahaina is a must, it is a wonderful shopping area. I already miss Kapalua and am anxious to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View, Villas needs updating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently honeymooned at the villas, 7/26/04-7/29/04. The view from our unit was great, we could see the sun rise every morning and because of the way that the property is designed no one could look directly into our place. The place is clean, but like so many others have said the place needs remodeling, which is what they were doing to several of the units, every morning of our stay, so try to get one away from the construction. There were bugs crawling in every room, as a matter of fact, I brought one of those surprises with me to my next destination. The concierge was not the most helpful person, so book your own adventures ahead of time. Overall, because of the view and the proximity to the beach, once they finish remolding the units, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay...Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kapalua Bay Villas in May 2004. We absolutely loved the Villa and the around surrounding it. The view was beautiful. We would drive to Lahaina for most of our meals. But the one night we ate at the Kapalua Plantation House was great. We loved staying in West Maui away from "traffic" but still a short drive from the shopping and popular restaurants. My husband played all 3 of the Kapalua golf courses and he really enjoyed them. We would highly recommend the Kapalua Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views and surrounding area's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our Villa was clean, poolâ€™s very close with nice BBQ's, and the view from the villa was beautiful. With great views of the ocean and the golf course. Kapalua has a shuttle that will take you to the beach or other resorts. Kapalua Bay was calm and great for the kids to snorkel, and play. We had no wind and nice sunny days. We just got back we went the first week of April 2004.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the termites and bugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first 4 days of my honeymoon in 2001. Had a great villa overlooking the ocean, wonderfull views, best ever, wrap-around windows in the bedroom. Could not ask for a better view! Villa was clean and nicely furnished. But... The Villa was infested with termites and other bugs! Purchased food for us to cook (save some money as Maui is very expensive), termites infested all of our food and all of the villa. It was so bad. Also had some wrapped hard candy in my suitcase in the bed room and the ternmites swarmed my suitcase! Had large palmetto bugs. Could not sleep! Went to the office to complain, and they offered to waive our $25 resort fee (lost $100 in food and they would only offer $25!). Would go back if they found a way to control the bugs, loved the resort and villa, not the bugs. Resort was beautiful, but very windy, shared property with the Ritz. My husband loved the golf. Went to the Four seasons for our last 6 days, so glad we did. The four seasons was perfect, amazing and my choice for the next time!

HotelInfo.Name: The Kapalua Villas
HotelInfo.Address: 2000 Village Road, Kapalua, Maui, HI 96761
